story:
The Problem

Small and Medium Sized Enterprises employ the majority of Nigeria’s workforce and GDP but only 15%  receive the capital they need to grow. Consequently, the majority of these businesses end up failing in their first 3 years of operations.

To make this problem 2-fold, foreign investors actually want to invest in these businesses! In fact, compared to just 2 years ago, investors are now considering 4 times as many deals in Africa. The desire to invest is evident, but it is incredibly difficult for investors to find the right opportunities.

 

Investing In Africa is Hard

This problem, in turn, leaves 85% of SMEs stunted by lack of capital which leads to rapid failure of SMEs, high unemployment, and poverty.

The 15% of SMEs that do get financed are just the friends and family of corrupt politicians and decision-makers. But hardworking, honest business owners are swept under the rug.  

 

Nigeria needs a meritocratic platform for financing that allows foreign investors to clearly see accurate data on well-run SMEs. My start up, Releaf, aims to do just that.

 

Our Platform

Our platform allows Africa’s best companies to show interested investors their data. Our data analytics algorithm also does the heavy lifting for investors, helping them to find companies similar to the ones they worked with in the past. Put simply, we’re automating pre-due diligence for African SMEs.
 

Releaf: Investing in Africa Made Easy  

We work in three primary steps:

  1. First, we gather data from promising African businesses through a rigorous 2 week process where we assess not only the accuracy of the business data but also the management ability.
  2. Second, we use our proprietary algorithm to score verified businesses on 11 investment factors.
  3. Lastly, after we've scored them, the top-ranked companies are filtered and presented to investors in easily-digestible business profiles with graphs, tables, and scores to fully showcase each investment opportunity to our network of investors.
 

Big Data For Small Business

With Releaf, business are evaluated on what they’ve done rather than who they know.

 

Our Team

Releaf is led by three Nigerian-American entrepreneurs who have studied at Duke, MIT, and Yale respectively. Our founders have also been employed at Microsoft, Facebook, and Bain.

Releaf has also partnered with Africa’s largest agricultural research institution, the International Institution of Tropical Agriculture, to assist with verifying and assessing the quality of agribusinesses.

Releaf Members with the IITA's Youth Agripreneurs in Ibadan, Nigeria



 

Our Traction



 

Where our Funds will Go

In order for Releaf to succeed in our mission of creating a true meritocracy for African businesses, we must be on the ground in Nigeria working full-time. Currently, we are forced to outsource our local due diligence services to contractors who add many unnecessary costs, inhibiting our ability to scale.  

 

For this reason, Ikenna Nzewi, a fellow co-founder of Releaf, and I plan to move to Lagos, Nigeria upon graduation to establish a local office to expand our services dramatically. We estimate the costs to establish our office will demand about $40,000.

 

Broken down, every penny of this required sum will be attributed to the following items:

  • $7,000 will go to platform maintenance.
    • This refers to the operational cost of upkeeping the data and analytics technology we've built.
  • $8,000 will go to a distributed network of talent scouts.
    • These are the on-ground due diligence individuals that will vent and hire full-time for Releaf.
  • $5,000 will go to our Registered Investment Advisory (RIA) certification.
    • This legal certification grants us the ability to act as an investment advisory firm.
  • $20,000 will serve as a survival salary for Ikenna & I in Nigeria.
    • After we graduate from Duke & Yale we do not have the financial runway to continue bootstrapping hence it's essential we have a pool of money to live frugally while we're pre-revenue.
 

While $40,000 is our goal, with the more money we raise, the more businesses we will be able to reach  and the greater impact we can have in Nigeria. Please see the chart below for our projected impact:


 

Risks and Challenges

Although Nigeria is full of opportunities, the economy also has its challenges.

We recognize these challenges and choose to actively confront them head on. We believe this is the best approach to reveal the vast number of opportunities that await in our home country. Listed below are the challenges we have identified that will present the biggest obstacles for Releaf:

 

Ensuring companies’ data is valid and accurate:

Companies seeking investment have a strong incentive to over-exaggerate the success of their business. To combat this potential issue, each company must go through these three critical processes:

  1. First, each business goes through a rigorous two-week program where they are required to provide key information regarding eleven factors of investability. This process is characterized by strict deadlines and high attention to detail. We specifically created this system to weed out SME owners who are not serious enough to be ready for an investment.
  2. Second, we verify the company’s financial information through the value chain. Here, we look at both the business’ suppliers and distributors to assess whether there are any inaccuracies in the data that they presented to us.
  3. Third, we employ a due diligence expert to meet the owners, suppliers, and distributors in person, to verify the viability, integrity, and condition of the company.  

Making sure investments are used correctly:

During the two week vetting period, we devote the majority of our time to validating the company’s business model and future growth plans. This is when our expertise of management consulting is particularly helpful. By doing our own research, we are able to verify whether the amount of funds requested is valid for their business model.

To donate please visit this link below!

https://www.paypal.me/TheReleafGroup


Other Ways You Can Help

We would greatly appreciate it if you share the word about our campaign. Releaf's mission to provide fair access to capital in Nigeria is a solution that can scale across the developing world. Please support us in piloting this disruptive approach to economic development!

  • Follow and Retweet us on social media to get the word out about our campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!


Have any questions? Email me at uzo@releaf.ng and I’ll answer it directly

story:
A Box of Things - A hand-picked box of gifts

At some point, everyone wants to give someone a gift, but they just don't know what to buy.

Hi, I'm Asia, and this is the exact reason why I started A Box of Things. If you can't find the right gift for a co-worker or are just looking for a special gift for a special someone, you've come to the right place!



A Box of Things was created to be able to help people buy special gifts for others without knowing what a perfect gift would be. Your gift will include unique products that can't be gathered in a last minute shopping trip. And I care about quality too! I go through great lengths to make sure each of my customers will be satisfied with the quality of each product in their gift box. 

Every gift from A Box of Things should be as unique as the person it is for. Once I get enough funding, there will be a variety of options for many of the products which will give you a more personal gift box. It is our hope that A Box of Things will be the solution for your gift buying needs. Especially for holidays such as this past Mother's Day where the box below was a feature!


What Do I Need & What Do You Get?

The contributions from this crowd funding campaign are going to help me build inventory for the pre-set gift boxes and build momentum for the custom boxes.

Anyone who wants to help me reach this goal can buy one of the following four preset boxes!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are want to help me grow or are interested in the concept, there are still other ways you can support the cause!

  • Please share! Helping spread the word about this campaign will be instrumental in my success!
  • Get your custom box. If you are interested in getting a custom box please send your request to ABoxofThings@gmail.com and we can discuss the brilliant products I can put together for you!
  • Social media. Like, follow, or tweet us on all of the social media below to get updates and see what's new!
Questions, Inquiries, Concerns? You can email me at ABoxofThings@gmail.com 
Check out The Gift Box Lady for updates after the campaign!

story:
The Beginning

Black Pearl Creations was started in 2001 after 9/11. I made American flag afghans and sold them to parents whose children were serving overseas.  I gained a pretty good following and transitioned over to clothing and accessories. 

For the past 14 years,  I've run my business in the background all while working full time, raising 2 children on my own,  through breast cancer,  college and domestic violence.  




Expanding the Passion

It's now 2015 and my passion for Black Pearl had been reignited. 

During my 2x cancer battles,  I learned how important it is for us to live life on our terms.  Not to run out and hurt others or anything but if you want to be bolder in your style and be more expressive,  then that should be an option.  Unfortunately, society has us bamboozled: "Sure, be expressive,  but not like that. " I love giving others the opportunity to be expressive via unique clothing and accessories. 

I love to crochet.  I mean,  I LOVE to crochet! I even crochet for a hobby!  To see what I can create with a hook and some yarn is nothing short of fascinating!


Now it's time to expand this passion from online to offline. To create an environment where others can come in,  be fitted and walk out with pieces that suit their individuality and inner hippie. 

I want to open a bohemian shop with pretties and a Wanderlust spirit inside of a converted mill that is a hipster's haven. I drool just thinking of it! An indie movie theater, café, live music, yoga studio, shops and so much more are already established in the building. Along with the weekly and monthly events, the foot traffic would be fantastic for Black Pearl!



Allocation of Funds

But I need your help to make it happen! Here's what is needed to get the shop open, running and self-sustaining.  



$1,200 3 months lease

$500 Build website

$500 Yarn

$1500 Improper Bostonian and Hippo Marketing (Local area cultural arts newspaper and magazine)

$500 Store build out and interior design

$250 Credit card transaction fees

Total $4,550.

This is 3 months of expenses. The website is a one time cost. It will be paramount to continue the online sales I've already established to compliment the in person sales and to continue make Black Pearl available to its international clientele.


Tier Rewards! (AKA Black Pearl Swag)

$20 donation: BPC reusable shopping bag!


$50 donation: Fringe Necklace, shopping bag and $20 Gift Card!


$100 donation: Infinity Scarf,  shopping bag and $20 Gift Card!


$200 donation: Hat and Scarf Set, shopping bag and $20 Gift Card!


$500 donation: Lace Maxi Skirt, shopping bag and $20 Gift Card!




$1000 donation: Silk and wool Bohemian Throw, shopping bag, $100 Gift Card and permanent placement on my Thank You wall in the shop!



No donation is too small.  100 pennies still make a dollar!  If you can't donate, please share my story with your friends and network. 

I appreciate all of you!

story:
Thanks to YOU our supporters!

This campaign finished on April 14, 2015. It did not raise the entire goal amount, but has raised enough funding to enable a limited release of the Mini Metal Maker in the USA near the end of 2015. We will be producing all of the perks as promised for the contributors of this campaign. Thank you for your encouragement and support!

Create with metal


The Mini Metal Maker brings together the exciting worlds of 3D printing and metal clay. It is the only fully self-contained 3D printer designed specifically for metal clay materials. This 3D printer is the perfect addition to your jewelry studio or maker workshop. 

Stanford Bunny test object in 104 layers of solid bronze, 15mm tall


The Mini Metal Maker prints 3D objects from digital files directly in metal clay, rather than in plastic.  Once these clay objects air-dry, they are fired in a kiln to produce beautiful solid metal objects of high purity and precision.  Using metal clay essentially replaces the wax-casting or lost-wax process ordinarily needed to do this. 

The Mini Metal Maker is the perfect tool for the jewelry artisan, artist or DIY maker. 3D printing with metal clay makes fabrication in metal easy and direct.  It will be a boon for anyone interested in creating custom printing jewelry and metal ornaments. It can also be used to produce small metal parts such as gears, clips, and bushings. The Mini Metal Maker is solidly built out of steel and aluminum and features unique patent-pending technologies.   

Bronze gears printed from open source files for REPRAP Wade extruder.


Monies raised 

We aim to raise $150,000 in order to move production of the Mini Metal Maker out of our basement and  onto a factory floor. Your contributions will help us bring this exciting tool to market. Monies raised will be spent toward software development, purchasing of tools, and setting up a professional build-space. 

There are several hurdles to overcome before this can happen, including software development, tooling-up, and licensing. It is our goal to create a user friendly host program that will make the user experience as direct and creative as possible. Tooling up for production involves creating shop drawings, jigs, dies and CNC programs with local Colorado manufacturers. Finally, there are several permit and licensing hurdles involved with physical equipment manufacture. 

Our first mini production run of 30 units, displayed at Rawlings Library, Pueblo CO.


If we do not reach the entire goal

This project has been carried this far through incremental progress, and we will continue moving toward our goal: bringing the Mini Metal Maker to market. Regardless of the funds we raise through this campaign, we will continue moving toward this goal.   Bottom line: if your contribution is for $1500USD or above, you will receive a Mini Metal Maker.


The impact 

The Mini Metal Maker is a game-changer in the world of low cost 3-D printing. It gives artists an craftspeople a new tool for creating directly with solid metal.  It is a powerful new tool for creating beautiful customized durable objects.  It is also a valuable and accessible educational tool because the Mini Meal Maker is small, portable, and affordable.

Personal Note

 We’ve dreamed of being able to print miniature parts and detailed sculptures directly in metal.  The Mini Metal Maker has let us go beyond plastic toys and into the world of true artistry with bronze, copper, and tin alloys. We have had a simply wonderful time creating beautiful items with the Mini Metal Maker, and we believe that you will too.   

David and Lindsay Hartkop, creators of the Mini Metal Maker

Other Ways You Can Help  

If you can not contribute, or if you simply wish to help another way, please like us on Facebook, re-tweet us on Twitter, and share our website with your friends. Help us spread the word about the Mini Metal Maker to anyone who might be interested.


FAQ

What is the Mini Metal Maker for?

The mini metal maker is for creating small objects out of metal. This includes custom jewelry, metal findings, sculptures, specialized machine parts and ornamental hardware.

Who will use the Mini Metal Maker?

The Mini Metal Maker is for anyone interested in creating small detailed metal objects.  This includes jewelry artisans the 3D Maker community.  The Mini Metal Maker is also a valuable tool for design engineers and machinists who require small runs of specialized hardware. The Mini Metal Maker adds new capability for the DIY inventor or artist by making fabrication in metal easy and direct.

What's the print bed size?

The print bed currently allows for prints up to a 3.15 in cube (8 x 8 x 8 cm).

What is the positioning precision & resolution?

XY resolution: 10 microns
Z resolution: 2 microns
Extrusion resolution: 250 micron traces with 22 ga. nozzle


Base of test object with 250 micron bronze traces.


How does the clay become metal?

The device prints with a commercially available jewelry product known as "metal clay." This material is a pre-mixed emulsion of metal particles in a water soluble organic binder.  When heated to 1550˚F(600˚C-900˚C) in a kiln, the binder burns away as the metal particles fuse together.

As with all metal clays such as PMC, our bronze and copper printable metal clays have a certain shrinkage factor, based on the type of clay and the firing procedure. This shrinkage is predictable and is in the 12 - 20% range, depending on the above factors.


Where will I get the metal clays?

Mini Metal Maker is working in conjunction with the manufacturer Metal Adventures to produce special blends of metal clay. The clay is preloaded in 50g cartridges and can be used with different sizes of extruder nozzles.  

Clay will be available through the Mini Metal Maker website.

How big is the printer? 

The Mini Metal Maker measures 9 in wide, 12 in deep, and 18 in tall (23 cm x 30 cm x 46 cm) 

Will it work with Windows 8?  How about Macintosh?

Yes, and Yes. The core computer for the Mini Metal Maker is an Arduino Duo running modified Sprinter-based open source firmware.  We are developing a cross-platform work environment for loading your objects into the printer. It can also be used with open source host and slicing software such as Printrun and Slicer.

Do you always need a computer to print?

Currently, the printer requires a connection to a computer. We have plans to produce a version that prints directly from an SD card, but not the version 1 machine.


Does it work with a USB port? 

Yes it does.  It just has a standard printer-type USB port.

Does it cause indoor air pollution or health problems for users?

No. The Mini Metal Maker does not cause any fumes or air pollution. The clay is water based and non-toxic, as its original purpose was for sculpting by hand. Also, the  entire machine operates at room temperature because it does not have to melt plastic.  You will need to purchase a small *kiln, however, in order to fire the objects.

*Kilns of any sort should be located in a well ventilated area away, often in a garage or a covered outdoor work area.  


Perks for Contributing:

What is the positioning precision & resolution?XY resolution: 10 micronsZ resolution: 2 micronsExtrusion resolution: 250 micron traces with 22 ga. nozzleBase of test object with 250 micron bronze traces.How does the clay become metal?The device prints with a commercially available jewelry product known as "metal clay." This material is a pre-mixed emulsion of metal particles in a water soluble organic binder.  When heated to 1550˚F(600˚C-900˚C) in a kiln, the binder burns away as the metal particles fuse together.As with all metal clays such as PMC, our bronze and copper printable metal clays have a certain shrinkage factor, based on the type of clay and the firing procedure. This shrinkage is predictable and is in the 12 - 20% range, depending on the above factors. Where will I get the metal clays?
Mini Metal Maker is working in conjunction with the manufacturer Metal Adventures to produce special blends of metal clay. The clay is preloaded in 50g cartridges and can be used with different sizes of extruder nozzles.  Clay will be available through the Mini Metal Maker website.How big is the printer? The Mini Metal Maker measures 9 in wide, 12 in deep, and 18 in tall (23 cm x 30 cm x 46 cm)  Will it work with Windows 8?  How about Macintosh?Yes, and Yes. The core computer for the Mini Metal Maker is an Arduino Duo running modified Sprinter-based open source firmware.  We are developing a cross-platform work environment for loading your objects into the printer. It can also be used with open source host and slicing software such as Printrun and Slicer. Do you always need a computer to print?Currently, the printer requires a connection to a computer. We have plans to produce a version that prints directly from an SD card, but not the version 1 machine.Does it work with a USB port? Yes it does.  It just has a standard printer-type USB port.Does it cause indoor air pollution or health problems for users?No. The Mini Metal Maker does not cause any fumes or air pollution. The clay is water based and non-toxic, as its original purpose was for sculpting by hand. Also, the  entire machine operates at room temperature because it does not have to melt plastic.  You will need to purchase a small *kiln, however, in order to fire the objects. *Kilns of any sort should be located in a well ventilated area away, often in a garage or a covered outdoor work area.  Perks for Contributing:

story:
Saving lives with creative art. I create life-like medical moulage (realistic injury simulation effects) for realistic simulation training for emergency responders.

I’m the daughter of a former police officer, and have grown up around first responders and military members. I was born 4 months premature, and faced many challenges in my first few years of life. I defied the odds and the doctors’ grim predictions, and function well and lead a completely normal life.

Since June 2007, I’ve used my knowledge of cultures, religions, and languages (Spanish, Arabic, and American Sign Language), my personal experiences, and my skills in moulage, to assist police, military, EMS, and CERT civilian responders in their training. My characters and scenarios teach them how to handle a variety of different emergency scenarios, illnesses and injuries, and cultural and language challenges. This broadens their understanding and prepares them for any number of situations that they will face.

In order for the training to be effective, it needs to be as detailed and realistic as possible. You can only do so much with a plastic rescue dummy wearing a tag that says, "Gunshot wound to chest." It's much more effective for responders to be confronted with a realistic-looking wound, and have to figure out how to handle the blood, gore, and serious injury. Unfortunately, it’s often difficult for emergency response groups and military training personnel to have access to quality moulage/FX supplies and artists who know how to use them. This is why trained and knowledgeable personnel like me, and projects like mine, are so important.

You can see pictures of my work in my Flickr album HERE.

------

What I Need

The economy hasn’t been kind to my family. After multiple job losses, my parents and I narrowly avoided losing our house to foreclosure in December 2013. We are doing better now, but are still working hard to get back on our feet. 

I’ve been hired to provide training support and moulage makeup for several exercises around the US in 2015. This will be a great learning experience, as well as a much-needed paycheck! 

The moulage requirements for these exercises mean that I need to buy some new supplies, ones that I can’t work without. Depending on the exercise scenario and the conditions that we are working in, there are specific requirements (waterproof, able to last for several hours, etc) and specific materials that we need to use. 

I’m “between a rock and a hard place” – without these supplies, I won’t be able to work, which means I won’t get a paycheck. But I don’t have enough money to buy them. 

Most of the groups that I work with don't have any moulage materials or anyone trained in how to use them, which is why they rely on me. Any materials that I use, I have to purchase myself. I work with so many different groups - asking all of them to provide materials for me for all the exercises simply isn't practical! 

The total cost of the supplies that I need to purchase is $1,200. This will be a one-time supply purchase; the moulage pieces that will be made from these supplies are re-usable.

Liquid material to make wound pieces – $170.00

Set of 20 prosthetic molds - what you pour the material into to sculpt/shape the different pieces - $460.00

Gelling agent to solidify the pieces - $20.00
Used to solidify the pieces more quickly (within an hour). Otherwise, each individual piece takes 8 HOURS OR MORE to solidify before it can be pulled out of the mold.

Fruit/jerky dehydrator to dry and set pieces so they can be used - $50.00 
Used to completely dry the pieces after they've solidified and been taken out of the mold. The pieces can't be used until they're completely dry, and larger pieces take DAYS to fully dry without a dehydrator.

Alcohol activated makeup palette to properly color the pieces - $28.00

Paint, fake blood, and other finishing products to properly color and finish the pieces for use – $165.00

Shipping costs – $150.00

Fees (IndieGoGo, PayPal) - $160.00

TOTAL: $1,205

Any additional funds raised beyond this amount will go to purchase additional supplies and props (such as appropriate clothes (plain clothes, uniforms, outfits for cultural/religious scenarios, etc), prop medication bottles, etc) for more scenario realism.

-------

The Impact

Most of the exercises with local responders, here in my home town, have been as an unpaid volunteer. I do it because I love it; it is my way to give back to the responders who have done so much for me. That was my starting point, and it’s opened the door for several other wonderful opportunities. I’ve gotten to work with the US military, and several agencies that provide training for responders around the US and the world.

Having these supplies will open up MANY more opportunities for me to participate in exercises, here in my community and in other states (and other countries). The requirements for larger, longer exercises are different than the requirements for shorter, smaller exercises. Having these materials would allow me to do whatever they need, so I would be able to participate in more opportunities when they came along. 

More exercise opportunities for me means more training courses being conducted, which means more people being trained in important skills. 

Civilians: The CERT (Community Emergency Response Team) program trains civilians in disaster preparedness, search & rescue, and emergency first aid, so they can help their family, neighbors, and community members in a disaster. 

Medical and military: Professional responders (police and medical personnel) and US military members receive training in emergency medical care, humanitarian aid, disaster response, conflict resolution, cultural awareness, and foreign languages. This will allow them to help people in their communities, across the United States, and in other countries around the world.

----------

Ways You Can Help

Please, will you help me reach my goal? Every little bit helps - $1, $10, $20, $50, $100 - it all adds up. Every single penny is GREATLY appreciated, and means more to me than I can ever explain!

Even if you aren't able to contribute financially, you can help by getting the word out! Share the link to this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, and other social media. More shares means more people seeing this! 

Whether you contribute by donating to the project, by sharing and promoting it, or both - it all is greatly appreciated! THANK YOU!

Even if you aren't able to contribute financially, you can help by getting the word out! Share the link to this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, and other social media. More shares means more people seeing this!

story:
Biodiversity: Is More Important Than a Seed Patent!
Don't Panic. Eat Organic. We have a Right To Know.

The 4th March Against Monsanto rally and protest takes place on Saturday, May 23, 2015 at Westlake Park. We rally at 12 NOON and march to The Gates Foundation for protest at approximately 2:30 PM. March ends at 3 PM. This is a family-friendly event! 

  • We are a dedicated group of activists, some of whom brought you the first three #MAM events, including MAM 3.0 last May. The ongoing dirty dealings of the GMA (Grocery Manufacturer's Association) continue to affect our right to labeling laws. The DARK Act is a threat (again). We are calling for a new GMO Labeling Initiative in Washington State, an end to Food Deserts, and demand that the Gates Foundation divest from Monsanto & Cargill. Protecting Biodiversity is imperative.

  • Your contributions are greatly needed to help us cover the expenses of producing this rally & march (permits, tents, tables, tech & sound equipment, and so much more). We're creating literature to help inform Seattle citizens of the need to continue the fight for Label Laws on ALL GMO foods, and to educate our population about the need to protect Biodiversity.

  • YOU can help us provide a family-friendly event that will bring our community together to speak out about the dangers of GMO Agriculture, demand labeling, and to educate more and more people about Food Safety issues. Although we successfully lobbied the City of Seattle to BAN the use of Neonics in all parks and city properties, we will continue to educate folks about these dangerous pesticides, which are responsible for harming bees and other important pollinators! Make your garden toxin-free! Learn how at one of our info booths. 

  • Any surplus funds, after costs to cover the event, will be routed directly back to the parent NGO (March-Against-Monsanto.com) as well as used to help start a #MAMSeattle 501(c) non-profit organization, made up of coalition members, that will be used for on-going education projects, additional actions, and to continue providing Seattle with a march every May! In addition, we will try to coordinate events in conjunction with October World Food Day. 

    Watch an inspiring CALL TO ACTION video here:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=su0om5L4Bhg

    Visit our COMMUNITY SUPPORT PAGE on Facebook:
    https://www.facebook.com/MAMSeattle (Please "Like" and share!)

         

                                

What You Get (And What We Need):

  • A Rally and March on 05/23/2015 at Westlake Park in the heart of Seattle!  
    (event info:  https://www.facebook.com/events/773432106077410/ )

  • Special guests, speakers, and demos from groups like CAGJ, Beacon Food Forest, Seattle Tilth, WAMend, Educating the Gates Foundation, Seattle Farm Co-op, CISPES, Seattle350.org and more. Opening Ceremonial Blessing from a member of the Snoqualmie tribe.

  • Musical performances from local artists such as Gary Kanter & The Raging Grannies. We are hoping to secure Smashie Smashie (again!) or Atomic Ballroom. Fun music for everyone.

  • Activities for the kiddos, including face-painting, chalk art & sign-making. We'll also be offering buttons, seed bags, seed balls, patches, samples of GMO-free products and other fun goodies to help you start your own garden and to show your #MAM Solidarity! (*small cash donations appreciated and go directly to cover costs of sound tech.)
  • Funds are needed to cover the many cost of Permits, Staging, Sound Equipment, Megaphone(s), Banners, Light Actions, Info Flyers, Supplies for Kids' Activities, Street Medics, Water, Security, Educational Materials, and much, much more. 

    **Sadly, the Seattle Community Media Lab has not returned as a resource. Without their support, we are having to rent tents and tables and things that were provided for free in the past.**
  • What do you get (besides a fun event and a chance to march)? 
    ~The satisfaction of knowing you are helping to spread the word about the need to protect BIODIVERSITY, fight for GMO Safety Standards, and work towards Food Labels in the United States, starting right here in WA!
    ~We'll be informing others about the many ways Monsanto continues to exert control and undue influence over our global food system, while they patent seeds, then turn around and sue family farmers, who find unexpected GMOs have cross-pollinated into their own crops.
    ~We'll shout it to the Gates Foundation: They need to sever ties with Monsanto and think about the impact their policy-making has on our city and the well-being of our children!
    ~It's time to stop worshiping profit over the health and safety of the people!
    ~No one should be able to patent what we can eat!
    ~Biodiversity is MORE important than a patent! 
    ~We have a RIGHT TO KNOW what we are buying/growing/cooking/eating, so we'll continue calling on elected officials to support a new initiative to LABEL IT!
  • Reminder: Any surplus funds, after event costs, will go directly back to March-Against-Monsanto.com and towards the formation of our own #MAMSeattle non-profit organization! Detailed financial records available upon request.

The Impact:

  • One corporation should NOT own patents on food technology, including the actual seeds! This is a direct threat to global Biodiversity!
  •  They should not be able to sue farmers, who do not use their seed, for accidental crop contamination.
  • We should all have the right to choose what we eat. GMO Labels should be mandatory in every state, including Washington.
  • This rally will help garner more support for a NEW Initiative, which would seek to secure GMO labeling laws for the state, and help us combat the mis-information campaigns of giant lobby groups like the GMA!
  • Educating people about the dangers of the DARK Act and the need to stop Fast-Track for other acts, including the TPP!
  • Monsanto is a multinational corporation (like Syngenta, Dow, Bayer, and others) that seeks to disenfranchise local & global farmers, by selling patented toxic seeds at lower costs, which in turn, can put Organic Farmers out of business!
  • We now know that harmful chemicals like Neonicotinoids are responsible for killing off pollinating insects, including bees. (While the City of Seattle has approved a full BAN on Neonics in all parks and city properties, we will continue to educate the citizens about the dangers of using Neonics & RoundUp® in their home gardens.)
  • We'll offer demos and access to seed and seed balls to teach people more about Guerrilla Gardening!
  • We all have a right to access healthy food, regardless of socio-economic background, and we need to end neighborhood "Food Deserts" for good. We ALL have a right to food that is Organic & GMO-free! 


Other Ways You Can Help:

If you cannot contribute, don't despair. There are other ways you can help!

  • Ask your friends and family to make some noise about this campaign!
  • Email it to folks that might be able to help with a small donation. Or share it via Facebook and Twitter!
  • Contact the event coordinators to volunteer. We need extra people to help with work parties before May 23rd and people to help set-up and break-down equipment on event day.
  • Please go to our Facebook Event Page and join the Rally and March on Saturday, May 23rd at 12 PM.  Be sure to share & invite all of your friends, family, neighbors, and co-workers! Share the link to the Community page and check out our posts. https://www.facebook.com/MAMSeattle
  • Visit our new Twitter feed and Instagram: 
    https://twitter.com/SeattleMAM  & https://instagram.com/seattlemam/ 
  •  Sharing is Caring!

story:
We love Buffalo and the amazing changes it has been going through in the past several years. At Sail Buffalo, located on the Outer Harbor, we are also seeing the amazing changes to the beautiful waterfront.
We want to provide you access to everything the Outer Harbor has to offer! Not only is it the home of Sail Buffalo, a public boating community, but the Tift Nature Preserve, Times Beach Nature Preserve, Lighthouse Park, and Wilkeson Point. The Outer Harbor is also a beautiful area with bike paths and nature trails just seconds from the city!

With your help, we can make access to the Buffalo Outer Harbor easy and affordable to the entire Buffalo Community by introducing The Buffalo Aquabus! Take Part in the Buffalo River Renaissance Today!

The Buffalo Aquabus is a non for profit vessel, similar to a Ferry, that will connect the Buffalo community to the Outer Harbor.

We feel it’s extremely important to bring people not only to the water, but onto the water as well, in a safe and fun environment.

Our Goals and Your Incentives:

Here is your chance to participate in Buffalo River Renaissance! We need to raise $23,000.

We have created a unique and exciting perk list in return for your generous donations.  Please look over our perk list!


The Buffalo Aquabus will provide:

1. Transportation for our Jr. Sailing Camp students back and forth to and from Canal Side. Most students are from Buffalo City Schools.

2. Transportation to the Buffalo public to the Outer Harbor, for a small, tax-deductible donation.

3. A fun and exciting, River Cruise rental option open to the public (all you need is a driver's license). A suggested, tax-deductable, minimum donation of $98 per hour or $198 per 2 hours, with a 2 hour minimum on weekends. The Buffalo Aquabus is a 22 ft electric, eco-friendly riverboat that can carry 10-12 passengers.

All proceeds generated by the Aquabus will benefit the Sail Buffalo Jr. Sailing Camp Scholarship Fund!

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Our Team:

Captain Pierre Wallinder, Sail Buffalo Director of Programs & Operation, is a life-long sailor and boater. Born and raised along the windy shores of Gothenburg Sweden, with a mission to foster new appreciation for everything water for Western New York.

Attorney Suzanne Villacorta, Trustee, Co-Founder Cazenovia Community Boating Center at the Outer Harbor Buffalo NY, life-long sailor and wind aficionado, loves not only windsurfing but also creating art!

Jennifer Keppard, Campaign Coach, is Buffalo born and raised and is an avid outdoor person. She took her boating license a few years back, and is eager to bring the joy of being on the water to as many people as people. Jennifer is also our resident Wellness Program Coach, she is your most immediate point of contact for any inquiries.

Also on the team, Webmaster Media Specialist Lesa Quale Ferguson
story_txt:
We
 love Buffalo and the amazing changes it has been going through in the past
several years. At Sail Buffalo, located on the Outer Harbor, we are also seeing
the amazing changes to the beautiful waterfront. 
We want to provide you access
to everything the Outer Harbor has to offer! Not only is it the home of Sail
Buffalo, a public boating community, but the Tift Nature Preserve, Times Beach
Nature Preserve, Lighthouse Park, and Wilkeson Point. The Outer Harbor is also a beautiful
area with bike paths and nature trails just seconds from the city!

With
your help, we can make access to the Buffalo Outer Harbor easy and affordable to the entire Buffalo Community by introducing The Buffalo Aquabus! Take
Part in the Buffalo River Renaissance Today!
The Buffalo Aquabus is a non for profit vessel,
similar to a Ferry, that will connect the Buffalo community to the Outer
Harbor.
We feel it’s extremely important to bring people not only to the water, but onto the water as well, in a safe and fun environment. Our
Goals and Your Incentives:
Here is your chance to participate in
Buffalo River Renaissance! We need to
raise $23,000.
We
have created a unique and exciting perk list in return for your generous
donations.  Please look over our perk list!


The
Buffalo Aquabus will provide: 
1. Transportation
for our Jr. Sailing Camp students back and forth to and from Canal Side. Most
students are from Buffalo City Schools.
2. Transportation to the Buffalo public to the Outer
Harbor, for a small, tax-deductible donation.
3. A fun and exciting, River Cruise rental option open
to the public (all you need is a driver's license). A suggested, tax-deductable, minimum donation of $98 per
hour or $198 per 2 hours, with a 2 hour minimum on weekends. The
Buffalo Aquabus is a 22 ft electric, eco-friendly riverboat that can carry
10-12 passengers. 
All proceeds generated by the Aquabus will benefit the
Sail Buffalo Jr. Sailing Camp Scholarship Fund!

Other Ways You Can
Help
Just because you can't contribute, but
that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please get the word out and make
     some noise about our campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share
     tools!


Our
Team:
Captain Pierre Wallinder, Sail Buffalo
Director of Programs & Operation, is a life-long sailor and boater. Born and raised along the windy shores of Gothenburg Sweden, with a
mission to foster new appreciation for everything water for Western New York.
Attorney Suzanne Villacorta, Trustee,
Co-Founder Cazenovia Community Boating Center at the Outer Harbor Buffalo NY,
life-long sailor and wind aficionado, loves not only windsurfing but also
creating art!
Jennifer Keppard, Campaign Coach, is Buffalo
born and raised and is an avid outdoor person. She took her boating license a
few years back, and is eager to bring the joy of being on the water to as many
people as people. Jennifer is also our resident Wellness Program Coach, she
is your most immediate point of contact for any inquiries.
Also on the team, Webmaster Media
Specialist Lesa Quale Ferguson

story:
Short Summary

Soulcialtravel started out as a social enterprise to help to connect non-profits / NGOs with people who want to volunteer or help in other ways (donations in kind) while living or travelling abroad. Living in India, we bear witness on a daily basis to the various challenges and hardship of many communities, the physically challenged in particular. We therefore decided to go a step further and initiate fundraising for such causes via Soulcialtravel.  

In every city and at all major crossroads in India, people are begging - many of them have physical disabilities either from birth, through an accident, illness or due to physical mutilation. This campaign will help some of those people in various ways... 

  • Providing healthcare and physiotherapy
  • Providing equipment, whether wheelchairs, boards, protective gloves, medical supplies or training - both professional and physical, to help people become more autonomous and independent.
The stigma associated with disability in India can be far more intense and restrictive than in Western countries. The infrastructure, mentality of society and will to accommodate disabled people and treat them as normal human beings is seriously lacking. 
 By contributing to this campaign, you will not just be giving the means to help these individuals through the means mentioned above, you will be helping to restore their dignity and give them a chance to live a more normal existence.  


What We Need & What You Get

There is no end to the work that can be done in New Delhi, let alone in India, to help the disabled.  We have set an ambitious target for the funding we are hoping to raise, but every contribution, however large or small, will go to help. You will find some contributions with perks for yourself, others where the benefits will be the knowledge and satisfaction of providing concrete means of support. 

Each fundable item has a tanglible benefit linked to it. Please see our perks for more details. For the perks where you can receive merchandise such as necklaces, cards, bags etc. your support will have a double impact as all these products are sourced from an NGO where the proceeds from our purchases will go to help other disabled communities. 

Whether or not we reach the fundraising target, we will be able to provide care and equipment to the much needy disabled people in Delhi; The beneficiaries will include not only those we have already connected with, but also many others, depending on the funds raised. The main beneficiary organisation of the fundraising campaign is a Delhi based non-profit organisation, specialised in empowering and aiding spinal cord injured people in India. 


How your contribution will make an impact

Can you imagine losing both your legs but still being able to scoot about on a skateboard? Or being paralysed in your legs, but still playing rugby - wheelchair rugby that is...?  Guddu, our ambassador featured in our video and friends who live at the special home for spinal cord injured people in Delhi, which will benefit from the fundraising, are witnesses to the fact that despite physical difficulties, they are able to enjoy life to the full. 

The mentoring and counselling, as well as the physical care and medical treatment which organisations such as ESCIP provide real empowerment to these individuals. 

For others, it could be just a question of receiving a pair of gloves and a proper wheelchair (as opposed to makeshift chairs), which will make their lives on the streets of Delhi infinitely more comfortable and accessible.  

Having raised funds for various causes and NGOs in the past, through a variety of means, whether selling artwork, made by children, organising charity concerts and dinners or online fundraising, we can attest to amazing results and immense satisfaction achieved, especially when close to the cause and in direct contact with the beneficiary organisations or individuals. 

In the case of helping the physically challenged in India, who not only suffer from their disability, but also due to their exclusion from society, the impact is all the more direct and their gratitude all the more intense.  

 

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge to the success of this campaign is to ensure that the beneficiary organisations are themselves transparent and operationally efficient. By helping smaller organisations, we are able to monitor the use of the funds more closely and ensure that the funds are being deployed precisely for what they were intended and not being diluted by huge admin, marketing and personnel costs. 

Given our direct contact and close association with the organisation and individuals who will benefit, we are able to ensure optimal usage and efficiency. 

Accountability is essential and close collaboration with the organisation's chartered accountants, who work for a number of trusts and non profits in India of the organisation means we are fully confident that the funds will be well used. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that while many want to help, it's not always possible. However, you can help in other ways... 

If you know people who are getting married, or celebrating some other occasion and wish to have a solidarity gift list, instead of receiving gifts for themselves, you can suggest they request contributions to this campaign.

Alternatively, you can encourage friends to share this campaign on Facebook and other social media sites.

If you are taking part in a fun run to raise money for charity and don't know which charity you want to give to, you can decide to donate to this cause. 

You can also use all the sharing tools which the Indigogo site provides users. 


Thank you so much for any support you can offer.

story:
My name is Martin Ebner. I am 49 years old/jung and an "Entrepreneur", real nerd", for innovative technologies and a skilled avionic engeneer. Since 18 years I am a self-employed marketing and media consult/manager. Two years ago I had a stroke and this experince changed something in my life and now I want to show you the result of the ambition.

Some friends of my, with the same interests, hobbies and aims, are a  unbeateable team and we worked together on our idea to fund the association  ... ]mint[SLOT- An association for lateral thinkers! ... for jung and old ... male and femal ... all colours, religions, education and interests - for all, hobbyists and developer!


THE NAME ... ]mint[slot
MINT - Mathematic, it, natural siences, technologies
slot - are the intended groups and rooms of the association!

THE IDEA ...
In all of us are a lot of ideas, concepts and aims. Most time thes are sleeping and we have no idea how to awake them. We need help, inspiration, tool, the right rooms and possibilitys ... and so on ... and thats whats ]mint[SLOT for! ... ]mint[SLOT will expand to an pool of inspiration, ideas ... Different Members with different interests, different influences are an unfailing "brainpool" of knowhow.

]mint[SLOT - will built up a home for all of this peoples. A place to realise the ideas, to get inspiration and help ... Thats the aim - ]mint[SLOT is not only an assosiation, it will be a spirit for all of us!  ... An well known appeal - "YES WE CAN!"


WHAT WE HAVE DONE SO FAR ...
Since 15 month we planed the funding of the assosiation ]mint[SLOT. We function, the structure, the organisation. We make the businessplan and contacts to local institutions, comanys and accademys. We worked and planed forward, contacted all our friend and our businesscontacts to ask for donats in kind ... for the moment, when we can start our great an ambitious project - ]mint[SLOT.

... but during this time we additionaly worked on our project to generate little success-storrys ... little examples, what we can do and how professional we work now ... could you imagine, how professional we could be, if all the future members of ]mint[SLOT inspirit the assosiation!

Our current sucessfull ended project was the development of the 3D-Printer - mintPRINT. Know we try to built up our finances and offer 3D-Printer-WORKshops, to be able to start Idea and fund the assosiation.

After we finished the 3D-printer mintPRINT the idea came up, to develope a power unit for a (skate-)-longboard. All parts are constructed with a 3D-software, to make it possible to print them with the 3D-printer. (Pictures and video will follow.) At the end we will offer the 3D-Parts as freeware-data-download on the internet page - http://www.mint-slot.de


The concept of a RESCUEcopter (drone). This concept attended actuall on a cometition in the United Arab Emirates - "Drones For Good!" and we hope to get the chance to rise to this challenge, and get the possibility to develope a prototype.

Furthermore, the eBIKE concept - fourWHEELER (The youtube video shows an animation from the aim we want to reach) - It will be activated with the smartphone, will have to backwheel eEngines (can be seperatly be activated or automatically), and will get many more interesting features.


The development of rc-parkjets and rc-accessories - rc-civil used drones - mobile catapult, etc.


HOW WE WANT TO INVEST THE MONEY ...

At first we will rent an workable location to realice the SLOTs, we want to offer ...
1) academySLOT - for education,seminars and workshops/insentives
2) robot SLOT - for the cnc-machines (3D-Printer, Laser Cutter, CNC lathe, etc.)
3) electronicSLOT - for work with elektronic-parts (solder, measurements, etc.)
4) creativeSLOT - general workshop
5) designSLOT - freeforming-Tech. (Using modern component materials)

- We will calculate the nessesary reserve funds for regular(monthly) paiments (telefon, internet, energie, water, etc.)
- We will activate our conections to local companies, witch offers us there help and donations in kind.
- We will activate our contact to an "home for aged peoples". Two aged but very activ mens (mechanical engenieer) want to be with us and will help us with there knowhow. A lot of peoples dont know how to handle tools and other electrical mashines. The knowledge of this guys is tremendous and very, very helpful, to built up a SAFE WORKSHOP.
- We will activate our first "members", "instructores" and "trainers" to become a effective, productive and safe-conscious structure in the MINTslot-assosiation.
- We will purchase the environment we need (tool, mashines, furniture, etc.) and will activate all possibilitys we can use - friends, companys, ebay, etc. - and BUY them on the normal way, if we have no other possibilities ;-)
- We will renovate (if nessesary) the rooms and built up our HOME FOR ALL MINT-MEMBERS

... and then we will start and open the doors ... invite the local press ... local companies ... other assosiations ... and all our friends ... to get infected with the MINTslot-SPIRIT!

OUR Indiegogo - AIM
If we could infect you - send the link to all your friends and companies you know.
We will be happy for all donations in kind (But please inform us, we are not able to pay for shippments :-))

FEEL THE SPIRIT - LIFE THE SPIRIT

Yours Martin Ebner
and the (current) MINTslot-Team

"To be a "nerd" is no swearword - the "nerd" develope fire, the wheel, cars, planes, etc. etc. etc. - a "nerd" makes the world goes round" (Martin E.) ;-)

story:
_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

                   Ketos Creative is a creative agency in Fort Worth, TX. 

I'll tell you up front: we're different. Unique. Our business model is unlike any of our competitors in the creative world. We combine an agency of professional creative services with a creative training academy. Sort of like a teaching hospital. 

SERVICES: 

  1. Audio Recording
  2. Live Sound
  3. Photography
  4. Videography
  5. Graphic Design
ACADEMY:
  1. Music (all instruments and voice)
  2. Music Production
  3. Recording Arts
  4. Stage Lighting
  5. Photography
  6. Videography
  7. Graphic Design
  8. Creative Writing
Our creative professionals split their time between teaching classes and completing projects for clients in their field of specialty. In our apprenticeship program, our advanced students / interns complete projects for clients under the guidance of our professionals at a reduced rate for the client.  Our Academy provides instruction for students of all ages: as young as four through all ages of adults. 
We work hard to get to know each client and each student. The way we provide our services and teach our courses / lessons is through the relationships.  We tailor our services and academy offerings to the wants and needs of the clients and students.

We work very hard to be cutting edge but we don't take ourselves too seriously. You'll see the gamut of expression at Ketos Creative from super silly to highly intense. There's never a dull moment at Ketos Creative!

___________________________________________________________________________

IndieGoGo 2015 • Blooper Reel

_____________________________________________________________________________

                   Why IndieGoGo? Well, we could go a more conventional route and take on massive amounts of loans from a bank but we don't do anything like anyone else so why would we do this in a conventional way? We are fiercely independent and we like to forge our own path. We also like to do it with as many quality people as possible. 

When we were trying to determine which funding route to pursue, we looked for an option that would allow us to involve our incredibly passionate community of clients and students. We looked for a way to get new people involved with our community. We searched for a funding option that would allow everyone involved to feel a sense of accomplishment and ownership. Crowd Funding turned out to be the perfect option!  

_____________________________________________________________________________

I would like to direct your attention to the list of rewards to the right with dollar amounts attached. The rewards are great, but more than that, every dollar you contribute goes to growing this unique creative community, providing for all of the families, and helping to keep it operational. 

If you can’t support us with dollars then your enthusiasm and support is equally valuable. Share the project on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Linkedin, Google+, Instagram, etc. as much as you can. Talk about it with friends and associates at work, church, Starbucks,  Chick-fil-A, the park, in line for a roller coaster, at the library, at the gym, etc. Spreading the word about the campaign is just as important! We’re so thankful for ANY support you can offer during our campaign.

Don't forget to use the IndieGoGo Share tools. Tap into all of the amazing features that IndieGoGo has built into the platform. 

_____________________________________________________________________________

Check out some testimonials below from some of our Ketos Creative community members: 

Parent Testimonials


Youth Student Testimonials

Adult Student Testimonials


_____________________________________________________________________________

                   Anything creative requires a LOT of time and can quickly become expensive. This particular venture is no different. We have worked hard to buy equipment piece by piece in stages to keep the overhead cost down and consequently keep prices down. We will do the same with the next phases of the company. 

We are currently operating in a 500 sq ft space and we have enough music equipment for that space. We are seeking to grow to a minimum of 2500 to 3000 sq ft for the next phase. We would like to grow to 5000 sq ft and include a performance hall / project gallery but it will depend upon how much we raise. 

To give you an idea of how quickly costs can add up, here are some examples:

EQUIPMENT:
     - 1 digital piano = $1200 X 7 for piano room = $8400
     - 1 drumset = $2000 X 6 for drum set room = $12000

As you can see, equipment is expensive. And that's just two of the items needed. Once you go through all of the creative disciplines and a performance hall, the cost of equipment is substantial.

LEASE:
     - finishing out a leased space with the necessary finishings for a recording studio and creative academy will easily run $50 per sq ft or more depending on choices. 
     - Build out cost estimate = $50 X 2500 sq ft = $125,000
     - RENT = ~15 sq ft/year X 3000 sq ft = $45,000

PERSONNEL:

     - the goal is to raise enough money to cover several months of salary for each employee to get them trained and fully operational so that their position pays for itself through labor. 

As you can see, the dollars add up quickly and we have only listed a fraction of the costs here. Look at the Stretch Goals at the top of the page for a general overview of the total costs. 
_____________________________________________________________________________

                Check out the list of the rewards below or to the right. You can contribute through the links on the right. Please remember, if you are unable to give financially, you can still help a great deal by sharing this campaign with your friends and family. We CAN grow this to the next level with your help. Thank you for believing in us!

_____________________________________________________________________________

                   We’re excited to expand the company and we have a LOT planned. But, ultimately we just want to say thank you. Your support is the inspiration behind the expansion of the vision.  You've believed in us and supported us beyond what we ever expected. We are so thankful for your belief in our vision. AND, Like most things in the modern world, we wouldn’t exist without you. Thank you.
_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________



                   Why IndieGoGo? Well, we could go a more conventional route and take on massive amounts of loans from a bank but we don't do anything like anyone else so why would we do this in a conventional way? We are fiercely independent and we like to forge our own path. We also like to do it with as many quality people as possible. When we were trying to determine which funding route to pursue, we looked for an option that would allow us to involve our incredibly passionate community of clients and students. We looked for a way to get new people involved with our community. We searched for a funding option that would allow everyone involved to feel a sense of accomplishment and ownership. Crowd Funding turned out to be the perfect option!  

_____________________________________________________________________________


I would like to direct your attention to the list of rewards to the right with dollar amounts attached. The rewards are great, but more than that, every dollar you contribute goes to growing this unique creative community, providing for all of the families, and helping to keep it operational. 
If you can’t support us with dollars then your enthusiasm and support is equally valuable. Share the project on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Linkedin, Google+, Instagram, etc. as much as you can. Talk about it with friends and associates at work, church, Starbucks,  Chick-fil-A, the park, in line for a roller coaster, at the library, at the gym, etc. Spreading the word about the campaign is just as important! We’re so thankful for ANY support you can offer during our campaign.
Don't forget to use the IndieGoGo Share tools. Tap into all of the amazing features that IndieGoGo has built into the platform. 
_____________________________________________________________________________
Check out some testimonials below from some of our Ketos Creative community members: 

Parent Testimonials




Youth Student Testimonials






Adult Student Testimonials



_____________________________________________________________________________



                   Anything creative requires a LOT of time and can quickly become expensive. This particular venture is no different. We have worked hard to buy equipment piece by piece in stages to keep the overhead cost down and consequently keep prices down. We will do the same with the next phases of the company. 

We are currently operating in a 500 sq ft space and we have enough music equipment for that space. We are seeking to grow to a minimum of 2500 to 3000 sq ft for the next phase. We would like to grow to 5000 sq ft and include a performance hall / project gallery but it will depend upon how much we raise. 


To give you an idea of how quickly costs can add up, here are some examples:

EQUIPMENT:
     - 1 digital piano = $1200 X 7 for piano room = $8400
     - 1 drumset = $2000 X 6 for drum set room = $12000

As you can see, equipment is expensive. And that's just two of the items needed. Once you go through all of the creative disciplines and a performance hall, the cost of equipment is substantial.

LEASE:
     - finishing out a leased space with the necessary finishings for a recording studio and creative academy will easily run $50 per sq ft or more depending on choices. 
     - Build out cost estimate = $50 X 2500 sq ft = $125,000
     - RENT = ~15 sq ft/year X 3000 sq ft = $45,000

PERSONNEL:

     - the goal is to raise enough money to cover several months of salary for each employee to get them trained and fully operational so that their position pays for itself through labor. 

As you can see, the dollars add up quickly and we have only listed a fraction of the costs here. Look at the Stretch Goals at the top of the page for a general overview of the total costs. 
_____________________________________________________________________________




                Check out the list of the rewards below or to the right. You can contribute through the links on the right. Please remember, if you are unable to give financially, you can still help a great deal by sharing this campaign with your friends and family. We CAN grow this to the next level with your help. Thank you for believing in us!




_____________________________________________________________________________



                   We’re excited to expand the company and we have a LOT planned. But, ultimately we just want to say thank you. Your support is the inspiration behind the expansion of the vision.  You've believed in us and supported us beyond what we ever expected. We are so thankful for your belief in our vision. AND, Like most things in the modern world, we wouldn’t exist without you. Thank you.

_____________________________________________________________________________

story:
Bonneville, the very name conjures up amazing images of shimmering mirages, endless space and limitless speed, and I have always been fascinated by it, but it was only after watching a movie, “The Worlds Fastest Indian” the story of Burt Munro, did the absolute fascination begin, I then read the book “One Good Run” and without ever having set foot in Bonneville, I was starting to feel the effects of Salt Fever. Nicci my partner and I sat down and formulated a plan about how to make it happen with the knowledge and resources we had.

We build "One Good Run" our salt lakes racer a Suzuki GN400,build in homage to Burt and all the speedsters at Bonneville, completed in September 2014 and tested at Kalahari Speedweek in 2014. We now want to get it to Bonneville for Speedweek 2015, and see what we can achieve, but without help, this dream cannot be achieved.

It is financially very difficult for us to fund the trip, and every little contribution will help get us there, you can play a big part in getting us there.  The first woman from South Africa to race at Bonneville!

We have put together a few exciting options for our sponsors, which can be found in the perks section, and I hope you will take some time to look at them and choose the one that suits you best.

We are trying to raise $20 000 this is broken down into transport and living expenses. We will fly into Houston where our SLR will be shipped to Metric Motorcycles, owned and run by master mechanic Andy Marcer, we will meet there, spend a few days tuning the bike on the Dyno. Once done we will load the bike and travel via RV to Bonneville and spend the week there.

Flights to and from Houston for Nicci and Myself -  $3000

RV hire - $2500

Crating and shipping of the Bike to and from Houston -  $ 9500

Membership Fees - $180

Visas - $250

Fuel and travel expenses - $ 5570

We know it's not saving the world or anything like that, but how awesome would it be for not only the first rider, but the first female rider from South Africa to put up an amazing speed at the mecca for speedsters from all over the world! 

So hit that share button, get the word out and help me be the first woman from South Africa to race at Bonneville!

story:
"Seaside needs a bakery!"

I hear this almost daily from people, both local and tourist alike.  And I wholeheartedly agree!  Our bakery has been in operation for two years now as a custom order bakery, and we are now ready to take the next step.  We are gearing up to open a retail location in the heart of Seaside in the Gilbert District. 

It takes a village to raise a loaf of bread!

So as we get down to the very end of the final stretch, we realize there are a few pieces of equipment that still are out of our budget.

  • a proofer for our dough ($1500)
  • a larger mixer ($3-4000)
  • installation of both ($500-$1000)

These two machines are pretty vital in bringing the freshest breads and baked goods to the North Coast in the quantity that people are asking for.  And I would hate to turn away customers because I was unable to provide enough loaves to feed the masses! (I'm by no means a "fishes and loaves" miracle worker!)

And then, there was you...

By contributing what you can, you are not only helping Seaside regain a wonderful bakery (how many of you remember the old one and miss it?) but you are also gaining some pretty substantial discounts!  And all on things you can't live without!  I mean, you CAN live without a cupcake or pastry, but who wants to?

Anything is better than nothing.

Some people just can't contribute, and we understand that.  The community of Seaside has already been more supportive than I ever imagined, and I want to personally thank all of you for your overwhelming encouragement.  If you are unable to financially contribute, just talk about us (in a good way, of course).  Tell your friends, your family, even a total stranger on the street!  Well, maybe introduce yourself first, but then tell them.  Share it on Facebook, Twitter, even smoke signals would work!

And again, I can't thank you enough for all your support!  But hopefully, the perks this provides will be a start!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Brad, founder of UgoTransfers.com

What is Ugo?

Ugo is a ground transport company that doesn't own any vehicles or hire any drivers, yet we can take you anywhere you want to go. Airports, cruise terminal, sporting events & much more.

Similar to Uber but not the same, our pre booked service gives you a choice of RIDES. From chauffeured limousines & shared shuttles to private cars & coaches, all operated by fully licensed companies & importantly ......licensed drivers.

Ugo is a technology company that provides a virtuous solution. We help providers find new business by displaying them on our website, we help travel agents earn more commission by providing a simple booking solutions on their desktops & we help customer like you to easily find & book a safe, reliable transfer to or from your destination on our website or your mobile devises.

Ugo, is a dedicated team of travel professionals, with over 60 years of experience in the travel industry, we know a thing or two when it comes to travel. We are passionate about customer service & satisfaction, supporting our suppliers & we look for sustainable and environmentally friendly ways to move people.

We want to expand Ugo into other countries & build better systems. This is where we need your help and support.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise funds for the following 5 key reasons.
  1. To deliver our product to thousands of travel agents desk tops via a 3rd party solution.
  2. To enhance our website to enable customers traveling Internationally to book a RIDE in any country they visit.
  3. To bring on International ground transfer suppliers.
  4. To enhance our mobile devise booking capability to make it easy for customers to book instantly on their smart phones & tablets.
  5. To pay my business partner and myself a small wage to keep working on Ugo.

The Impact

The impact of your contribution, be it big or small will go a long way in helping us establish & grow our new business.

It will also give us the means to deliver this unique website to help customers like yourself to find a safe & reliable ground transfer provider anywhere in the World.

Most importantly, it will give us the ability to keep working on Ugo so we can build  innovative technology solutions for all our customers and trade partners.

Risks & Challenges

It's no secret that even the best laid out plans can fail, however, with over 60 years of travel industry management experience in airline & cruise line operations behind us, we believe we have the right plans, structure, experience & skills to deliver a  sound, well managed & successful business.

Read a bit more about Us Here. published in the Travel Daily.

Our challenge is to stay ahead of the competition, to keep innovating & most importantly to keep enjoying what we do.

Other Ways You Can Help.

If you are unable to help financially, you can still help our business greatly in a few simply ways.

* Use our service the next time you want to ride somewhere.
* Tell your family, friends & work colleagues of our service.
* If you run a business, lets chat about setting up an account.
* Pass on any contacts that you think might benefit from our services.
* Like & follow us on Facebook & Twitter.

story:
Who am I & What is She's Got Guts?

Hi there! My name is Laura Sprinkle, and I am a Gut Health Coach, author, speaker, and wellness entrepreneur! I dream of a world where everyone knows just how valuable they are, and has a happy & peaceful GUT! What do I mean by that? Well, that the majority of folks nowadays have gut issues, whether or not they know it. So my mission is to bring light to the subject & empower people to heal their guts holistically.

What is the situation today?

  • Rampant degenerative disease
  • Low self-esteem & lack of self-care
  • Health issues galore
  • Questioning place and purpose in the world

Ask yourself: is this normal?! The answer is NO. 

That is why I have written She's Got Guts, a simple, yet comprehensive, guide to creating a personalized healing action plan! This book covers the who, what, where, when, why, and how of self healing - and you don't need to be a science nerd like me to understand it. 

I'm asking for donations to She's Got Guts because I want to be able to spread the message of health & happiness in a BIG way - and I need your help to accomplish that. 

Not only do I want to get this book into the hands of those who will use it & thrive, but I also want to teach outstanding programs and work with people 1:1 to create a life they love. All of your help is SO appreciated, thank you for your abundant love & contribution! 

Who else is involved in this project?

A few amazing individuals have been integral in the creation of She's Got Guts, as a book and as a movement! I'd like to give them a shout out!

Hayley Parker - My friend & an incredible graphic designer, who came up with the genius book cover! She has also been super helpful with the book in our jam sessions on digestive health. I <3 talking about poop. 

Amy Masterman - I shouted out at a retreat that I needed a book editor, and Amy came to the rescue! She is the mastermind behind Sacred Sensual Living - a site dedicated to writing & art on living in a meaningful and beautiful way. However, she also moonlights as a genius book editor, and did a wonderful job turning my word vomit into something more digestible. 

Marissa Framarini - This lovely lady is not only my cousin, but also a fantastic writer & journalist. She is making sure my words are validated with cold, hard sources. My brain is a scary, scary place, and she's shining the light on the fuzzy facts, all whilst looking stylish and cute. 

What's Needed

You'd be shocked at how much starting & running an online business can actually cost. I know I still am. While I have tried to go very DIY this past year in business, the reality is that most business do not see profit within the first year or so. So why am I asking for your support - where the heck will $5,000 go? 

1. Creating & maintaining a members-only website: interactive members site with videos, articles, members boards, and everything clients need to create their dream lives & healthstyles! This requires lots of PEOPLE, people who need to be fed & watered in order to do their jobs appropriately.

2. The creation of classes & programs as a companion to She's Got Guts: the book. I envision a program that combines both personalized 1:1 coaching as well as online resources, tools, and community to deepen gut healing for all clients. 

3. Book tour! I would love to speak at various locations around the country about gut health, and I also love to travel - perfection. Travel costs money, but money well worth spending from the budget in order to spread the holistic health message. 

What You Get 

This is the good part. The PERKS! There are many, and with 4 different tiers depending on how much you want to get involved in GUTSY movement! 

 

The Perks Explained

Tier 1: Accelerate Your Learning (self-explanatory)

$10 - PDF book, $15 - physical book, $25 - signed copy of the book

Tier 2: Experience the Difference 

Everything in this tier includes a signed copy of the book, as well as an opportunity to deepen your learning and involvement through the book launch event and workshop, a live online class, or a 15 minute personalized jam session with Laura.

$50 - book launch ticket, $100 - FREE live class, $150 - 15 minute session

Tier 3: Healing from the Inside 

This tier also includes a signed copy of the book, and the perk of additional support in the form of 3 different workshop packages to choose from. The options are: 

  • Digestion DeLite - the basics of good gut health
  • Digestion Deluxe - up your gut health game with optimized health
  • She's Got Guts: The Big Kahuna - in-depth and personalized program coming in January to explore every aspect of your gut health and happiness!
$200 - Digestion DeLite, $300 - Digestion Deluxe, $500 - She's Got Guts (at 1/2 off the cost)

Tier 4: Thrive with Personalization 

This tier also includes a signed copy of the book, and the SUPER BONUS of extremely discounted 1:1 coaching with Laura to completely personalize your gut health plan & healing! This is the highest level of involvement with She's Got Guts and you will also be included in the She's Got Guts big kahuna program.

$1000 - one-month coaching program 1:1 with Laura, $1,500 - three-month coaching program 1:1 with Laura, $2,000 - six-month coaching program 1:1 with Laura 

Frequently Asked Questions 

  1. How can I learn more about She's Got Guts? You can learn more by going to www.shesgotguts.com!
  2. How can I learn more about Laura Sprinkle? You can learn more by checking out her YouTube channel, her Facebook page, her Instagram, or www.laurasprinkle.com.
  3. What credentials do you have to teach about digestive health? I studied at the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, as well as had a myriad of my own digestive health issues, and I love to talk about it so please feel free to reach out with any questions!

Other Ways You Can Get Involved

1. I have digestive health issues and/or know someone who has them, what can we do to get involved?
It would be so, so fantastic for you to get the book, or even donate enough to win one of the programs as a perk so that we can work 1:1 or in a group setting to ensure your gut health & healing! Make sure to sign up for my newsletter over at the website as well, because there are weekly free classes on healing, as well as tips and articles sent straight to your inbox! Feel free to reach out with questions, but note that I am NOT a doctor and do not diagnose or treat specific conditions. 
2. I have much knowledge of web design, development, video creation, and/or online business and I LOVE your project, how can I get involved?
Please reach out to me via email laura@felisalud.com because I LOVE collaborating!        
3. I am also a health coach/wellness entrepreneur and I'd love to team up, what can I do to get involved?
Please reach out to me via email laura@felisalud.com because I LOVE collaborating!    
4. I just dig your project. What can I do in addition to contributing or in lieu of a financial donation? 
You can share this campaign with friends! You can also sign up for my newsletter, reach out with what you love and any ideas you may have (there is always room for improvement!), or even just say hello. A kind word can go a long way.
