I just dig your project. What can I do in addition to contributing or in lieu of a financial donation? You can share this campaign with friends! You can also sign up for my newsletter, reach out with what you love and any ideas you may have (there is always room for improvement!), or even just say hello. A kind word can go a long way.

story:
Need Help With Your Photos?

These days most of us are taking digital photos, and we're taking so many of them that they're overwhelming us. How do you find a photo to share it with family? I can help clients get their photos and slides organized and learn how to keep them organized. They will be able to keep track of the photos of family milestones and share them.

What about the older photos, that aren't digital? The photos you took before digital cameras became so common. The ones your parents took. The ones your grandparents took or had taken.


Maybe you've got some even older than that. You want to share them but scanning the contents of that box could take the rest of your life. I've been there, and I want to help you with your box, boxes, or albums of old photos.

How Will This Work? (also known as, why do you need this much startup money to scan things?)

Have you tried to scan your own photos with the scanner you have at home, found out that it took a long time, and gotten frustrated? Me too! I'm sure that if you've been through that you're wondering how anyone can think they're going to scan boxes and boxes of photos. I don't have more patience than you do, believe me. I've done the research and found out that there is a better way. Commercial scanners are much faster than the flatbed scanners many of us have at home. They have feeders, but they are specially made to be gentle enough not to damage photos. They can even scan both sides of the photo at the same time, so that the scanned images include any information that is on the back. The scanner I intend to use would scan 85 images per minute at 300 dpi. That's a low resolution for photos, so at 600 dpi, a better resolution, it won't go that quickly, but that's still much faster than our flatbed scanners, isn't it? 

Who Am I?

I've worked for the National Park Service and with museums, helping to organize and properly take care of artifacts. I have a masters degree in history with a concentration in applied history - the tangible things that teach us about our history. I also have a bachelor's degree in business administration, I've done bookkeeping for other small businesses, and I have been successfully running my own history and genealogy research business for a few years now. So, I have the skills and experience to an run a successful business and to help people take proper care of those tangible pieces of their family history.

Where We'll Operate

Most of the existing scanning services involve shipping your photos and slides.  Shipping those precious bits of family history is a risk, and it doesn't help with proper storage or organization.  A personal service will meet more needs and diminish the risk. I will pick up and deliver, or scan photos in the client's home. I will scan photos at family reunions. so that they are never out of the owner's sight but they can be shared with the whole family. Will I turn you down if you really want to send me your photos or pay my costs to get to your location? Absolutely not! I want to help!

What It'll Take

My start-up budget is $25, 000. That includes things such as equipment, insurance, and office supplies.

Since I'm assuming that the contributors most likely need my services or know someone who does, the perks are discounts. You can use these yourself or give them to someone else. If there's something else you'd like to see, please feel free to suggest it.

    The Impact

    What will I do? I will help clients get organized and learn how to stay organized, properly store their family bible, photograph albums, photos, slides, and other family memories. All of that comes on top of scanning everything so that you can share all of those photos with your family.

      Risks & Challenges

      Every new business is a risk. What makes this less risky than others?

      I will do my own bookkeeping, right down to my tax return. I don't need to hire anyone to do that, and I have enough experience that it won't take an inordinate amount of time. I am experienced at sorting photos, properly storing museum collections, and scanning thousands of documents and photos. I have tech skills to keep things running. I expect to keep working part-time doing research and bookkeeping for others indefinitely, so I won't be dependent solely upon this business and thus possibly trying to grow too quickly. I may need to hire employees eventually, but not until or unless the business grows quite a bit.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      I know that everyone can't afford to help in a substantial way, but I hope that you'll decide that this is worthwhile and help get the word out. The more people who know about it, the more likely we'll reach the funding goal. Indiegogo makes that really easy, so please go ahead and use their share tools.

story:
Tesla STEM EV Conversion

Who we are


We are a team of high school students at Nikola Tesla STEM High School converting a 1993 Mazda RX7 into a fully functional electric vehicle.  Our project will serve as a platform to educate students and the public on the benefits of electric vehicles.

Our Mazda RX7 that We are Converting


The Engine Bay Before the Conversion


Our Goal

Every year there is a national science fair for high school students called Imagine Tomorrow, which is held at Washington State University. The focus of this competition is to seek new ways to support the transition from non-sustainable fuel to alternative energy sources. In a world raised on gas and oil, it’s important to be open to new forms of energy. We want to help bring that spirit of sustainability to our community.

                                         

Located in Redmond, the students of Tesla STEM High School have always been inspired by technology. Last year, we had several teams from Tesla STEM compete and win in the 2014 Imagine Tomorrow competition. The process was educational and helped us to create new ideas to bring to the table next year.

This year, we want to continue Tesla STEM's winning streak. Our project started when we obtained an 1993 Mazda RX7 that we could work with. With many new electric cars being produced, we thought it would be ideal to convert a gas car to electric. We began tossing the idea around and realized its potential. With hard work and determination, we hope to bring this project to Imagine Tomorrow and make this year even better than the last.


What We Need

To complete our project, all we need are LiFePO4 batteries costing approximately $10,000 - we hope to raise the sufficient funds from a combination of crowd sourced funds and sponsorship.  If your company would like to sponsor us, please contact us!


We've already obtained all the electrical components and adapters needed to attach the motor to the flywheel. 


       

       

The Impact

With this project, we are obtaining the knowledge of how to convert a gasoline powered car to a more efficient, sustainable electric vehicle. When we finish this project, our group members will be enlightened and benefited by what we have learned. We will also have access to a fully-electric Mazda RX-7, which could be shown to other students who are interested in gasoline to electric conversions. With your contributions, you will grant us the ability to delve deeper into the world of sustainable and eco-friendly design.


Risks & Challenges

Large projects like electric car conversions have been well documented online and there’s a large community of hobbyists and professionals in our area that have pledged to assist and support us through the process.  Regardless, there are still a number of challenges we’re facing as a team. One such challenge is our lack of automotive fabrication experience. We’re combating this by researching ahead of time and ensuring we have professional mentors through the entire building phase of our project.

     


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute to our fundraising via donation.  Regardless, it would be a big help if you can spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, or share the project with your friends and family in any way to help us reach our goal.  There’s a number of helpful sharing tools on this page we encourage you to check out.  In addition, follow our build blog as we progress through our conversion!


Visit our page! : www.TeslaEVConversion.org
Follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/STEMCarConversion 
Follow us on Twitter: @TeslaEV

THANK YOU!

story:
The Braw project

Braw is beer for creative people. The Braw project is not just about brewing great craft beers: the experience doesn’t stop with an empty bottle. The bottle itself will be an object of inspiration and study. We are collaborating with the best creatives in the world to design artworks for labels for our beers. You will taste our beer and collect the artworks, downloading it from our website also in a psd or vector format to see how they did it.

During the last 20 months we have been working at Braw to set up everything and we did several experiments to define all the recipes of our beers. Initially we are going to produce an IPA (Brainstorm), an Imperial Stout (Moodboard), a Porter (Viewport) and a Pilsener (Break)

Now we need your support to make our dream come true. We want to brew beer for creatives, a beer that helps them in every step of their workflow and study.

Our beers will be delivered world wide.





  




The team

  


 


  • Leonardo Mattei CEO | Graphic Designer 

    He completed the Master in graphic design and photography at ILAS of Naples in 2011 and he has worked as art director since 2012 and freelance graphic designer since 2014.

    Moreover he collaborated with Creative Pro Show in recording some video tutorials for their youtube channel. He taught photography and post production since 2012. 

    Passionate about craft beer since he was 16 (don’t tell the authorities), Leonardo has been developing the Braw project for the last year and half. Focused in the idea in which he’s totally and insanely into, he moved to London which is going to be the Braw’s headquarter.

  • Giovanni Mattei Brawmaker 

    He has worked as video maker since 2010. For the first three years he has been working for a private tv and a news show. Now he’s freelancing since 2013, specialised in direction of photography, he has collaborated with CreativeProShow recording some video tutorials for its youtube channel.

    Three years ago he started home brewing and he completely fell in love with that, causing an high level of blood alcohol content in his friends. In May 2014 he heard about Leo’s idea of Braw for the first time and since then they have been working together on the project. In 2015 he graduated at CERB in brewing techniques.

  • Maurizio Pagnozzi Brand Designer | Art Director

    Italian designer based in London. In January 2014 he began his career as a teacher of visual communication. Teaching supports the freelance activities at his studio One Design. Specializing in branding, corporate identity and packaging. His aim is always to create works that combines concepts with strong functional and solid executions.

    In 2013 he won the Cread Portfolio Awards, his works have been published in several online galleries and inspirational books. He’s one of the most appreciated profiles on Behance.

  • Carlo Iengo CFO

    Carlo Iengo holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Economics and Social Sciences from Bocconi University. Passionate about enterpreunership, Carlo has worked as Chief Operating Officer for PVCompare Network where he has been in charge of planning strategy, industry analysis, market research and recruiting. Moreover, he worked as intern at Felicitas Global Pte Ltd, a consulting company based in Singapore focused on business development.

    Beer lover, he has followed the Braw project from scracht taking care of the financial and business planning. His favourite beer is Trappist Westvleteren 12 (XII).



BrawCard

You will receive our exclusive collectable card when you will buy a Braw beer, thanks to this card you will be able to download the label artwork.

We are going to produce more than one card per artwork, so when you will buy again the same beer, you will have another collectable card.



Braw brand

Braw is brotherhood, brew, Raw file, BR (try to pronounce it!) and it is a Scottish word for "well dressed", like our bottles, and "bravo".
The Braw icon is the essence of the brand. At the first glance you can read B and R, but the mark is more than that. It contains all the letters for Braw, but in a non-complete shape, because Braw is an experience, that begins with the beer and doesn't have an end.
The mark is in constant evolution, in fact it doesn't have an institutional color, but one color per beer, and it is at the service of the artist that has the power to assign the color in relationship with his artwork.
Moreover, which other beer mark is also perfect for a bottle opener?  :D



Braw box

This box contains 6 beers + brooch + T-Shirts + artworks. You can get one of these selecting the perk, be quick, they will go fast ;) 


Kind of beers


What we have already done

We have been working at the Braw project since the beginning of 2014. In this period we did a lot of research (and tasted a lot of different craft beers) to write our recipes, and now we're looking forward to let you taste our results. 

We brewed several times to refine our recipes and we got crazy experimenting new ones.

We studied a lot about brewing instruments, and we already know how to invest money to get the best instruments for brewing.

Thanks to Maurizio, one of the best brand designer you can meet around, we built a very strong brand identity.

We worked a lot to have sponsors as CreativeProShow, One Design and Blowhammer that have been supporting us from the beginning.

We built partnership with some of the best creatives in the world, and we can't wait to present their artworks to you.

Thanks to Carlo, we did strategic planning and now we have got a very strong plan of investment.


Our Dream

We dream big, and we need your help to reach our goals and dream even bigger.
Our dream is to set up our own brewery, and open several BrawBar around the globe to offer you a co-working and networking space. You will go to the BrawBar to work, to drink our beers and to get inspired by the labels, to study how the creatives did them and to speak with other creatives, make collaborations and start exciting projects. The more funds we get, the more BrawBars we will be able to open.

There is no better situation and a better place to start new projects. We will have beers, artworks and creatives all in one space: the BrawBar.


Our Partners

Blowhammer is the manifesto of young people who break the rules. It is not just a clothing brand, it was conceived to emphasise the Italian underground style, blending the variety of international design and the quality of raw materials completely treated in Italy.

One Design is one of the most followed design studio on Behance, specialized in branding, identity and packaging.

CreativeProShow is an organization that shares knowledge and experience. It organizes every year one of the most important event and workshops in Europe in the creative field. 


We are always searching for creatives!

If you are a designer, a digital artist, a creative, feel free to get in touch with us to design a label for our beers. Thanks for your support!




Thanks for supporting us!





Artworks by Giovanni Maisto

story:
It's red and it's dirt

In April 1889 the Unassigned Lands of Oklahoma Territory were opened to any and all adventurers who would stake their claim to 160-acre tracts in the land run. C.E. Pauly was among them, a rugged young settler on horseback who rode across the red dirt prairie where Native red men had lived for thousands of years. Pauly claimed a little corner of the world that day just west of a town now called Edmond.

Near the turn of the century, the settlers longed for a church. They were meeting in homes or one-room schoolhouses, but they needed a place to gather—a real place—so they built one and called it Hopewell Baptist Church. And when it burned they built another. In 1947 a congregation of little more than 200 farmers and oilfield workers outgrew their crowded clapboard church on the prairie.

If you're not stuck on that

The church leaders went to the University of Oklahoma's School of Architecture, hoping some student work might fit their building project budget. What they got was beyond what they ever imagined: the creative genius of its lead architect Bruce Goff. Professor Goff's buildings across America were famous, nothing less than “innovative and imaginative” according to experts. Happily, Goff liked these fellows from Hopewell Baptist Church. When the elders asked him, "How about a building made of concrete blocks?" Goff replied, "If you're not stuck on that, let's do something else!"

Using surplus pipe from nearby oilfields and native stone quarried by church members, Goff designed what would later be called the "cathedral of sacred spaces" and "the most unusual church in America." From his blueprints the church was built by the wits and sweat and determination of a humble congregation working many long nights after their day jobs. The building took shape—formed from 1,000 tons of drill stem pipe—and the workers named its 12 trusses after the apostles. The last was called Judas because it gave them trouble. A symbol of Native American inhabitants of the land with its conical style and red-shingled roof, and the booming oil industry with its welded steel trusses, Goff's building brought the energy of Oklahoma to life on that prairie.  

Sadly, the Tepee experienced many challenges. Leaks began to spring in the roof and around angular windows, and nearby road construction triggered continual flooding into the lower level. Asbestos was added to climatize it, but years later was removed at significant cost. The TP’s doors were finally locked and Goff's once-sacred space had reached its most challenging low. While mold and rodents had their way, its only other visitors were birds and termites. Its congregation worshiped in another building on the property and the most unusual church in America could only stand watch on its corner, dark and silent.

Until now. Now—in 2016. This is the year of  the 'TP'! 

National Register of Historic Places

Listed on the National Register of Historic Places under its original name, Hopewell Baptist Church, this building will see its space transformed for adaptive re-use as an exciting and unique events center. The Hopewell Heritage Foundation, Inc., a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization announces, "This is the year of the 'TP'!"

Adaptive re-use as an events center

Significant for a growing metropolitan region, the building is being adapted—repurposed—for use as a modern events center with historic distinction. When completed it will offer beautiful, adaptive space with quality acoustics, community programming, and the latest technology and staffing for events. Plans include creative and performing arts, community workshops, business training, educational conferences, historic tours, weddings and celebrations, and children's and charitable programs, to name a few. The new facility will provide historic elements throughout to connect visitors with Oklahoma history, American Indian history, architectural appreciation and more. 

Funding: You're one of the team!

Through generous contributions, the building rehabilitation for this one-of-a-kind historic structure is underway! The Foundation has nearly completed Phase I of the work for approximately $120,000 with additional in-kind contributions of $60,000. 

Following preliminary pre-design work necessary for architectural elevations, a targeted feasibility study and preparation of a business plan, The Hopewell Heritage Foundation seeks $220,000 for Phase II, FULL REDESIGN that includes the architectural Master Planning, Schematic Design & Construction Administration. 

The Foundation is pleased to announce the selection of award-winning architect Hans Butzer, AIA, LEEP AP, AK NW, and the Oklahoma City firm of Butzer Architects and Urbanism (BUA) for the work of architectural redesign of the Bruce Goff "tepee".

Butzer was named a recipient of the American Institute of Architects 2016 Thomas Jefferson Award for Public Architecture. According to AIA, "the award recognizes excellence in architectural advocacy and achievement." The AIA identified Butzer's leadership and innovative work, noting:

"Butzer is a gifted and accomplished architect who has built his career in Oklahoma City by dedicating himself to improving the built landscape and enriching the fundamental civic dignity of the city."

Butzer and wife Torrey founded the firm responsible for OKC landmark projects such as the Skydance Bridge, the Oklahoma City National Memorial, Century Center and numerous other projects. He was recently deemed interim dean of the University of Oklahoma College of Architecture.

It is a great  honor to have this firm working toward the rehabilitation of the building through creation of a master plan and design work. The total project completion is $2.5 million to see this gift of organic architecture revitalized for public access. Your generous donations, endowments and in-kind contributions will allow Phase II to be completed in preparation for Phase III, "bricks and mortar."

Connect with the TP Team

Connect with the best of central Oklahoma architects, structural engineers, construction experts and community supporters giving their time, talent and resources to bring this one-of-a-kind architectural rarity back to life. Join us as we work with preservationists from the National Trust for Historic Preservation to create the best possible rehabilitation of one of America's most unusual spaces.

You can:

  • Contribute generously on this site. Remain anonymous or prepare to get noticed! Read our perks!
  • Share this site with your colleagues, friends, family or others who love history, architecture and all things Oklahoman.  Plan a meeting at the TP in 2018.
  • Visit our web site at www.goff-hopewell.com. Watch our progress!
  • Talk us up! Tell others about this work. Let us know how you think we could spread the word! Send your comments to yearofthetp@engineer.com.

It is an exciting undertaking to honor the great work of Bruce Goff and to revive the legacy of earlier generations on the red dirt prairie. It is creative and important work, connecting shared histories of the American Indian, early Oklahoma settlers, architecture of the 20th century and a hard-working congregation who began with only a love for creating a house of worship and a very unique "pipe dream".
story_txt:
It's red and it's dirt 

In April 1889 the Unassigned Lands of Oklahoma Territory were
opened to any and all adventurers who would stake their claim to 160-acre
tracts in the land run. C.E. Pauly was among them, a rugged young settler on
horseback who rode across the red dirt prairie where Native red men had lived
for thousands of years. Pauly claimed a little corner of the world that day
just west of a town now called Edmond.
Near
the turn of the century, the settlers longed for a church. They were meeting in
homes or one-room schoolhouses, but they needed a place to gather—a real
place—so they built one and called it Hopewell Baptist Church. And when it burned they built another. In 1947 a
congregation of little more than 200 farmers and oilfield workers outgrew their crowded clapboard church on the prairie.


If you're not stuck on that

The church leaders went to the University of Oklahoma's School
of Architecture, hoping some student work might fit their building project budget. What they got
was beyond what they ever imagined: the creative genius of its lead architect
Bruce Goff. Professor Goff's buildings across America were famous, nothing less than “innovative
and imaginative” according to experts. Happily, Goff liked these fellows from
Hopewell Baptist Church. When the elders asked him, "How about a building
made of concrete blocks?" Goff replied, "If you're not stuck on that,
let's do something else!"
Using
surplus pipe from nearby oilfields and native stone quarried by church members,
Goff designed what would later be called the "cathedral of sacred
spaces" and "the most unusual church in America." From his blueprints
the church was built by the wits and sweat and determination of a humble
congregation working many long nights after their day jobs. The building took
shape—formed from 1,000 tons of drill stem pipe—and the workers named its 12 trusses
after the apostles. The last was called Judas because it gave them
trouble. A symbol of Native American inhabitants of the land with its
conical style and red-shingled roof, and the booming oil industry with its
welded steel trusses, Goff's building brought the energy of Oklahoma to life on
that prairie.  




Sadly, the Tepee experienced many challenges. Leaks began to
spring in the roof and around angular windows, and nearby road construction
triggered continual flooding into the lower level. Asbestos was added to
climatize it, but years later was removed at significant cost. The TP’s doors were finally locked and Goff's once-sacred space had reached its most challenging low. While mold and
rodents had their way, its only other visitors were birds and termites. Its congregation worshiped in another building on the property and the most
unusual church in America could only stand watch on its corner, dark and
silent.


Until
now. Now—in 2016. This is the year of  the 'TP'!

story:
We are a small independent distillery located in the hills of Fairbanks, Alaska above the Tanana River.  Our products are distilled from local barley grown in Delta Junction and certified Alaska Grown.  All of our stills are hand made by the distiller to produce exceptionally smooth and pure spirits.

We offer 3 products:

1.  Long Winter Vodka - Our flagship product. An exceptionally smooth, honest vodka made from 100% local barley. Long Winter Vodka has a slight strawberry nose, with clean, crisp vanilla notes at the finish.

2.  Summer Harvest Gin - Bronze medal winner at the American Craft Distillers Association's Judging in March 2015! It's a traditional gin that is very balanced, with a long citrusy finish. It's made from the same local barley as our vodka, with the addition of select botanicals such as Juniper, Coriander, Iris Root, Mace, Cardamom, and fresh Rhubarb grown on the distillery property.

3.  Fairbanks Sourdough Rum - Alaska's first Rum! Fairbanks Sourdough Rum is a unique Alaskan experience. Instead of using commercial yeast, this rum is fermented using a sourdough that was started in Alaska more than 60 years ago. This is an honest rum, with no added sweeteners, spices, or flavorings. Enjoy Alaskan history in every sip!

Ursa Major has quickly outgrown our initial distilling room and are very excited to be moving our operation to the Annex Building in Ester, AK.  There we are building a cocktail lounge with a tasting room for our friends and supporters AND want to give the community an opportunity to be a part of it. 

We will feature a warm and enticing ambiance, and it will be the perfect place to get away, sit with your friends, and enjoy a cocktail after a long day.... 

The interior will have a warm, rustic aesthetic comprised of wood architecture and timber framing.  The lounge area will be brought together with inviting leather furniture, and a super fab fire place(ethanol stove that burns on our waste product).

Expanding is a big move for a small business, and we want to create a beautiful and comfortable atmosphere for our patrons.  

In order to be successful we need your help.

  • We are looking to raise $25,000 in order build a tasting room and lounge.
  • There are 7 different perks available to choose from in all price ranges.
  • We are offering 2 premium levels that feature a private event, catered by the local eatery Brazen Bistro!  Both of these events would be wonderful for holiday, anniversary, or birthday parties!
  • Note the wooden nickels!  We are super excited to offer these.  Each nickel, when brought to the tasting room, is redeemed for one free cocktail and will be personalized with your name and you will be featured as an official Ursa Major Contributor!
Ursa Major Distilling is at a very special point in its evolution.  Demand is rising as fast as word can spread across the state (and farther).  We can't keep the secret any longer!
While this is encouraging, the necessity to expand is very real and needs to happen in order to be able to keep up with our customers requests and purchases.  This adventure begins with creating 'the' northernmost Distillery and Tasting room!
  • We have spent  2 years perfecting our product and growing our line!
  • A location has been chosen, retrofitting is progressing, but not without your help.
  • Our goal is not to be the largest distillery in the state, but to be the best local establishment in Fairbanks.

Other Ways You Can Help:  

Feel like you can't contribute but still want to help?  Please help us spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign!  We need as much noise and traffic as we can possibly get...  Here is the link to our campaign, please share on all your social sites as well as email! 

Ursa Major Indiegogo Campaign 

Thank you!!!

story:
My name is David Zibell, and I was born in France, raised in Canada, Israel and the US. I recently dropped my real estate career in Canada to follow my dream of distilling a new style of whisky in a place I truly can call home, the Golan Heights of Israel. I've taken great steps, invested lots of time and money, and am already seeing great results. And now I need your help to take it to the next level -- let's create the first whisky to be produced in the Golan Heights and realize dreams together.

Check out this interview which covers things nicely and clearly: http://www.voiceofisrael.com/distilling-whisky-...

Whisky Gospel early preview on our spirits: http://whiskygospel.com/2015/06/01/a-very-early...

My Whisky Adventure:

It was on a hot Friday afternoon in San Jose, Costa Rica, while picking up Shabbat groceries with my friend Fernando, that he suggested we pick up a bottle of “Caol Ila 12”. Little did he know that although I enjoyed a good dram, I had been conservatively sticking to the lighter, sweeter whiskies that are just easier for a novice’s palate to appreciate, but that I had never ventured into the great flavor that Islay or other full flavor whiskies have to offer. As we sipped that bottle on Shabbat afternoon, I realized that I had been missing out on something, and that was the beginning of my realization that each and every whisky is truly unique and has something wonderful to offer. Many whiskies later, my palate now more mature, my “family” at the small Shulounge minyan whom I would meet every Shabbat for prayers and a few l’chaims made me realize that any whisky tastes so much better when it is enjoyed with others, and this is where the dream to make a delicious world class whisky that will challenge the palate and bring people together was born. I didn't know when or how to begin, but I started learning everything there was to know about making good whisky which raised my appreciation of whisky to a whole new level. The quality of the water, the malted grains, the endless possibilities of yeast strains, the fermentation of the wort or mash, the distillation of the clear spirit, and finally the aging in casks which give it all of its color and up to 70% of its flavor, fascinated me .


Make your Dreams Come True, Just Do It!:

In the spring of 2014 on a trip to Israel with my family we arrived at the town of Katzrin in the Golan Heights and fell in love with the place. It was then I decided to put this dream into action when I saw that the abundance of natural springs

the fields of wild barley

and the quality of life

would make this the perfect place to create a new whiskey. I immediately ordered a copper pot still, a couple of fermentation tanks, and by that summer I was in the Golan Heights distilling my first single malt spirit, and one of the first few Israeli whiskies to be.

  

The Absinthe story:

Now that I was moving along and had committed myself, I realized the real financial challenge of distilling and putting away casks of whisky for at least 3 years. Every business needs to sell in order to survive, and I was searching for a spirit I could be passionate about and sell immediately while our whiskey was aging. I didn't just want to make any clear spirit just because the market would buy it, I wanted to connect to it as well, so I experimented with a few different thing that at first excited me, but it wasn’t until October that I found my connection to absinthe. I had heard of it before, but after having a taste at my friend Yona's, I became very curious, and the more I read about it the more I realized I could make this, so after looking through many, many recipes I found one I thought I liked. I made it, and it turned out to be an instant hit. Little did I know that a little over a century ago, when my great-great grandfather fell through the ice while fishing to make a living and died, my great-great grandmother started serving absinthe in the estaminet (the name used in the north of France for an establishment that served alcohol and tobacco) she had opened to be able to support her family. My mother, who revealed this to me after tasting my absinthe, told me she still has the last absinthe spoon in the family from this Estaminet.

Hearing this brought my enthusiasm for absinthe to a yet a higher level and the decision was made that absinthe would be the spirit we would sell while our whisky ages. We named it the “Holy Spirit” because the absinthe plant is known in France as the holy herb, and we distill it in the Holy Land and it truly is a ‘holy spirit’.

Where We Are Holding:

-We have succesfully created a single malt, a corn mash and a single malted rye spirit that is now 7 months old and on it's way to become a whisky.

-We have three 225 liter casks aging to fulfill perks from this campaign.

We are sourcing our water from the local Salukia spring which is just down the road from us.

- We have a supplier of English Malted Barley and Malted Rye and a supplier of american corn.

- We have come to an agreement with a local winery, The Golan Heights Winery (who in my humble opinion makes the best wines in Israel) to supply us with casks that have once held Port and other red and white wines. Some of these casks will be used fresh after wine is dumped by the winery, and others will be carefully shaved, and toasted to bring out the fruitiness of the wine they once held and then charred to caramelize the sugars in the wood.

- We are waiting to receive our new Stupfler still, a revolutionary still that not only is highly efficient and environmentally friendly but makes a spirit of quality I've never before experienced; this still will produce 220 litters of spirit in a 12 hour period, making it more than enough to get us through our first 3 years of operation.

- We have designed our labels and have found a beautiful bottle from the revolutionary bottle makers at SAVERGLASS to hold our fine spirit.


- We have created a very fine Absinthe using organic herbs in the traditional method without adding sugar or color using only the best quality ingredients and have bottles waiting to be shipped for perks in this campaign.

- All our whiskies and spirits will be kosher certified lemehadrin by Katsrin chief Rabbi, Rabbi Levi.

We have found a great piece of land to build our distillery.

But before we approach any investors for help to realize that part of our dream, we will be dedicating the next 3 years to operating as a micro-distillery in order to improve our product and test the market, We have found a building to rent in the Katzrin’s industrial zone for the next 3 years where we can distill and store our spirit as it ages.

*************************UPDATE**************************

Thanks to all of you who participated in this campaign we took the next step and signed a lease, we were also able to prepay our rent for the first year with the funds raised so far, we hope to continue selling to raise enough funds to cover our rent for an additional 2 years and to cover all our other fixed expenses. Thank you again you are all part of our success!


Where you come in:

So far we have invested close to $100,000, but still are in need an additional $120,000 for renovations and rent for our 3-year plan. At present, we have $60,000 which will cover renovating our new rental location, and we need another $60,000 to cover our rent for the 3 years. From past business experience we know that paying rent every month can be a burden, especially when our product is resting in casks... so we have decided to reach out to you and give you the opportunity to help us sell some of this whisky and absinthe now so that we can cover our rent for the next 3 years and have the ability to focus on making the best whisky possible without having investors waiting for a return on their money, or bank loan awaiting repayment - just quality product development. 

All funds raised above our goal will be dedicated to the purchase of casks and grain to strengthen our inventory and put us in a position of strength when we approach our potential investors 3 years from now to build our ultimate distillery.

Perks:

We have created some perks that will show you what we are really made of: 

Whisky Perks 

1) First ever age your own spirit.

     No wood Influence             3 Months                        6 Months                   3 Years

Received you bottle of fresh off the still spirit, get to taste it with zero influence from the wood, now add the included American Oak cubes and begin the journey of whisky aging right in your home or office, taste it every now and then and taste it slowly developing, watch it's color go from clear to beautiful tones of gold, age it for as long as you want and see how science and time transform the spirit, although not traditional and even maybe frowned upon it is finally an opportunity for true whisky enthusiasts to participate in the the aging of this fine spirit which will give birth to what we know as whisky. 

2) For those of you with a little more patience, willing to let the hotter climate of Israel, the Golan wine casks and our close supervision, develop a world class whisky, we offer our first accomplishment, no longer a spirit but now a whisky, be one of the first to receive our whisky as soon as we decide it is ready to be enjoyed (3-4 Years). 

3) Shulounge Special Reserve, for a group of friends who became family, who supported my ideas and dreams from the start, it is the least I can do! After all you guys taught me how to properly light a menorah

Thank you!

4) For the collectors among you we offer our first ever bottle of each of our expressions, bottled at cask strength from a single cask, numbered and signed.

5) For those who just love what we are doing and want to go all out, we have full casks available which can be privately labeled.

Absinthe Perks

1) Your own bottle of our Holy Spirit Absinthe made with all natural and organic herbs bottled at 68% if you love absinthe you will definitely appreciate this and if you have never tried it, this is a great opportunity to do so.

2) Replica Absinthe spoon. 

This is a replica of the last spoon left over from my great-great grandmother's Estaminet, these spoon are used to hold a sugar cube above your glass so that you may gently drip ice water melting the sugar and diluting your Absinthe to a slightly easier to drink alcohol level, adding sugar to Absinthe is a question of taste, think of it as a coffee or tea, some like it sweet and some don't.

Taster's pack Perk:

Receive one 100ML bottle of each Ashtaroth Sinle Malt New Make Spirit, Bashan Corn Mash New Make Spirit, Hermon Single Malted Rye New Make Spirit and Holy Spirit Absinthe.


Shipping Perk:

Please make sure to ad the appropriate shipping perk if you will not be picking up your perk.

Just Showing Support Perk

Your support means a lot to us, every little bit bring us closer to our goal. We would like to thank you by sending you a 100ml sample of our aged raisin brandy which will only be available to the israely market.

We also understand that some supporters cannot make any financial commitment and you are just as important to us, so please share this with as many people as you can because every little bit make a huge difference. 

TAKE ACTION!!!

Please go ahead and choose a perk and then share this with as many people as you can! We thank you for taking the time and making the effort to read our story and for taking actions that will help us reach our goal! By buying a perk you not only are helping realize a dream but we hope that when you receive your perk and look at it you realize that your dreams could and should be realized none too big none to small just do it!

financial challenge of distilling and putting away casks of whisky
for at least 3 years. Every business needs to sell in order to
survive, and I was searching for a spirit I could be passionate about
and sell immediately while our whiskey was aging. I didn't just want
to make any clear spirit just because the market would buy it, I
wanted to connect to it as well, so I experimented with a few
different thing that at first excited me, but it wasn’t until
October that I found my connection to absinthe. I had heard of it
before, but after having a taste at my friend Yona's, I became very
curious, and the more I read about it the more I realized I could
make this, so after looking through many, many recipes I found one I
thought I liked. I made it, and it turned out to be an instant hit.
Little did I know that a little over a century ago, when my
great-great grandfather fell through the ice while fishing to make a
living and died, my great-great grandmother started serving absinthe
in the estaminet (the name used in the north of France for an
establishment that served alcohol and tobacco) she had opened to be
able to support her family. My mother, who revealed this to me after
tasting my absinthe, told me she still has the last absinthe spoon in
the family from this Estaminet.
 
Hearing
this brought my enthusiasm for absinthe to a yet a higher level and
the decision was made that absinthe would be the spirit we would sell
while our whisky ages. We named it the “Holy Spirit” because the
absinthe plant is known in France as the holy herb, and we distill it
in the Holy Land and it truly is a ‘holy spirit’.


Where We Are Holding:
-We have succesfully created a single malt, a corn mash and a single malted rye spirit that is now 7 months old and on it's way to become a whisky.
-We have three 225 liter casks aging to fulfill perks from this campaign.

We are sourcing our water from the local Salukia spring which is just down the road from us.

- We have a supplier of English Malted Barley and Malted Rye and a supplier of american corn.
- We
have come to an agreement with a local winery, The Golan Heights
Winery (who in my humble opinion makes the best wines in Israel) to
supply us with casks that have once held Port and other red and white
wines. Some of these casks will be used fresh after wine is dumped by
the winery, and others will be carefully shaved, and toasted to bring
out the fruitiness of the wine they once held and then charred to caramelize the sugars in the wood.

- We
are waiting to receive our new Stupfler still, a revolutionary still
that not only is highly efficient and environmentally friendly but
makes a spirit of quality I've never before experienced; this still
will produce 220 litters of spirit in a 12 hour period, making it
more than enough to get us through our first 3 years of operation.

- We have designed our labels and have found a beautiful bottle from the revolutionary bottle makers at SAVERGLASS to hold our fine spirit.



- We have created a very fine Absinthe using organic herbs in the traditional method without adding sugar or color using only the best quality ingredients and have bottles waiting to be shipped for perks in this campaign.

- All our whiskies and spirits will be kosher certified lemehadrin by Katsrin chief Rabbi, Rabbi Levi.
We have found a great piece of land to build our distillery.
 
But
before we approach any investors for help to realize that part of our
dream, we will be dedicating the next 3 years to operating as a
micro-distillery in order to improve our product and test the market,
We have found a building to rent in the Katzrin’s industrial zone
for the next 3 years where we can distill and store our spirit as it
ages.

*************************UPDATE**************************
Thanks to all of you who participated in this campaign we took the next step and signed a lease, we were also able to prepay our rent for the first year with the funds raised so far, we hope to continue selling to raise enough funds to cover our rent for an additional 2 years and to cover all our other fixed expenses. Thank you again you are all part of our success!


Where you come in:


So
far we have invested close to $100,000, but still are in need an
additional $120,000 for renovations and rent for our 3-year plan. At
present, we have $60,000 which will cover renovating our new rental
location, and we need another $60,000 to cover our rent for the 3
years. From past business experience we know that paying rent every
month can be a burden, especially when our product is resting in
casks... so we have decided to reach out to you and give you the
opportunity to help us sell some of this whisky and absinthe now so
that we can cover our rent for the next 3 years and have the ability
to focus on making the best whisky possible without having investors
waiting for a return on their money, or bank loan awaiting repayment
- just quality product development. 

All
funds raised above our goal will be dedicated to the purchase of
casks and grain to strengthen our inventory and put us in a position
of strength when we approach our potential investors 3 years from now
to build our ultimate distillery.

Perks:
We have created some perks that will show you what we are really made of: 
Whisky Perks 


1)
First ever age your own spirit.

     No wood Influence             3 Months                        6 Months                   3 Years Received you bottle of fresh off the
still spirit, get to taste it with zero influence from the wood, now
add the included American Oak cubes and begin the journey of whisky
aging right in your home or office, taste it every now and then and
taste it slowly developing, watch it's color go from clear to
beautiful tones of gold, age it for as long as you want and see how
science and time transform the spirit, although not traditional
and even maybe frowned upon it is finally an opportunity for true
whisky enthusiasts to participate in the the aging of this fine spirit
which will give birth to what we know as whisky. 

2)
For those of you with a little more patience, willing to let the
hotter climate of Israel, the Golan wine casks and our
close supervision, develop a world class whisky, we
offer our first accomplishment, no longer a spirit but now a
whisky, be one of the first to receive our whisky as soon as we
decide it is ready to be enjoyed (3-4 Years). 

3) Shulounge Special Reserve, for a group of friends who became family, who supported my ideas and dreams from the start, it is the least I can do! After all you guys taught me how to properly light a menorah
 Thank you!
4)
For the collectors among you we offer our first ever bottle
of each of our expressions, bottled at cask strength from a single
cask, numbered and signed.
5)
For those who just love what we are doing and want to go all out, we
have full casks available which can be privately labeled.


Absinthe Perks


1)
Your own bottle of our Holy Spirit Absinthe made with all natural and
organic herbs bottled at 68% if you love absinthe you
will definitely appreciate this and if you have never
tried it, this is a great opportunity to do so.


2)
Replica Absinthe spoon. 

This is a replica of the last spoon left over
from my great-great grandmother's Estaminet, these spoon are used to
hold a sugar cube above your glass so that you may gently drip ice
water melting the sugar and diluting your Absinthe to a slightly
easier to drink alcohol level, adding sugar to Absinthe is a question
of taste, think of it as a coffee or tea, some like it sweet and some
don't.
Taster's pack Perk:
Receive one 100ML bottle of each Ashtaroth Sinle Malt New Make Spirit, Bashan Corn Mash New Make Spirit, Hermon Single Malted Rye New Make Spirit and Holy Spirit Absinthe.


Shipping Perk:
Please make sure to ad the appropriate shipping perk if you will not be picking up your perk.

Just Showing Support Perk
Your support means a lot to us, every little bit bring us closer to our goal. We would like to thank you by sending you a 100ml sample of our aged raisin brandy which will only be available to the israely market.


We
also understand that some supporters cannot make any financial
commitment and you are just as important to us, so please share this
with as many people as you can because every little bit make a huge
difference. 
TAKE ACTION!!!


Please
go ahead and choose a perk and then share this with as many people as
you can! We thank you for taking the time and making the effort to
read our story and for taking actions that will help us reach our
goal! By buying a perk you not only are helping realize a dream but
we hope that when you receive your perk and look at it you realize
that your dreams could and should be realized none too big none to
small just do it!

story:
Hi, we're Williamson Wagner and we're here to shake up the distilling industry.

Williamson Wagner is comprised of two friends Tom Williamson and Robbie Wagner. We've known each other for over a decade and taken part in many ventures together.

Your contribution will help us start up only the 2nd legal distillery in southwest Virginia, bring jobs and tourism revenue to the area, and support local charities. We will be giving 10% of all proceeds to charity from this campaign, and from future sales, starting with the Roanoke Valley SPCA and picking a new charity each quarter. 

Help us support the SPCA and find homes for all of our furry friends, like Turbo here!

It has always been a lifelong dream of ours to open a distillery and we have plenty of knowledge in distilling, farming, entrepreneurship, and all the skills necessary to make this business a success.

We are two young entrepreneurs, that are not backed by any large corporations or venture capitalists, so help us keep this a 100% locally owned operation.

What We Need & What You Get

To get started, we will need approximately $100,000, but more would certainly be helpful, and we could work with less, but there are several expensive things for us to buy. 

Things we need include:

  • Distilling/Fermentation Equipment ($50,000+)
  • Virginia ABC Distillery Permit ($450)
  • TTB Distillery Permit
  • 45 Oak Barrels ($15,750)
  • ~12,000 Bottles (~$20,000)
  • Building Lease/Mortgage ($3000+ per month)

Our most major expense, is the distilling equipment itself. The next major hurdle, is the building and the licenses. We need a federal license from the TTB and a Virginia license from ABC. These are also not cheap, and take awhile to acquire. We then need a building to put all of our equipment in, and we need to get it inspected and approved.
If we do not reach our entire goal, we'll use the funds we receive to explore other options, such as a cooperative with another distillery, leasing equipment, getting less expensive items and starting smaller scale, or some other option to get us off the ground.

Awesome Perks For Contributing

We have quite a few perks, in all price ranges. They range from just plain donations for $10, shirts at $25, vouchers for liquor, custom labels for our products, and even really adventurous stuff, for you big spenders, like coming down to the distillery and helping make a whole batch of your own custom product!

How will my contribution make a difference?

Every dollar raised will help immensely to push us towards our goal. Your money won't just help us but it will:
  • Create jobs
  • Stimulate the local economy
  • 10% will go to charity
Not only that, but you will be directly sponsoring bringing people together and creating memorable life moments around a glass of our Williamson Wagner Whiskey.


Don't forget that 10% of all proceeds from this campaign will go to the Roanoke Valley SPCA. Help animals like Brutus here find a forever home!


What are the risks?

There are risks involved when starting any company, but we have a few advantages to be successful.
  • We are 100% self owned, and we have a clear vision for what we want to accomplish.
  • Craft distilling is on the rise, and has grown from less than 100 craft distillers in 2003 to over 600 today.
  • We would be only the 2nd legal distillery local to southwest Virginia, so there is plenty of room to grow in the market and be successful. We would also be the first one located in Roanoke.
  • Demand for whiskey is steadily increasing, and in 2013, whiskey sales achieved their fastest growth rate since the 1960’s.

How else can I help?

The best way you can help, is to get the word out to all of your friends, colleagues, associates, your mail man, your mother-in-law, everyone!
You can use the provided sharing tools to post on Facebook, Twitter, or email this page to your friends.
Even sharing it with one person helps so much, so help us get the word out!

story: We are raising money for a coffee roaster of our own. With a combined experience of 15 years we have roasted for many people. Finally, forged in the fires of our hearts, Iron Brothers Coffee Co. Is born. We have finally found a chance to share creations with our community and the success of this campaign will make it happen. There's always a story to be told and it's best over a good cup.

story:
WHO WE ARE:
STREET STYLES Fashion has been running at MetWest (an Oakland Public HighSchool) for almost a decade. This years students have organized and are taking it to a new level with the Fashion Club. They plan a trip to LA to see a runway show and visit some Fashion Schools and possibly the garment district.
Every Monday and Wednesday from 4-5 pm MetWest in the Maker Lab/Sewing Room. Detailed notes are taken, and formal meetings and fashion design sessions are held. Students have made Tie-dye, jewelry, and held a number of fundraisers to raise capital for their trip. 


A MESSAGE FROM THE CLUB PRESIDENT:
Hello my name is Kaliyah Killens. I am the president of the brand new Fidm Fashion Club at Metwest High School. I have been in Metwest's fashion's program since the 9th grade. Since then I have been able to sell me earrings and clothing in multiple stores, participate pin professional photo shoots, win a competition for using recycled clothing, and network with industry professionals. As a 12th grader I wanted to start my own club because I wanted to provided a space for students who are passionate about fashion to have a space to be creative, build community, and show case their talent. The objective of my club is to encourage students who love fashion to own their skills and surround themselves with other who are passionate about fashion to come together as a community to support one another. By contributing to this campaign it will give my club the opportunity to experience going to a fashion show, learning more about the fashion industry and college exploration.


WHAT WE NEED:
We've got to fund for Public Transportation Travel, Hotel and Food for 11 students and two adults.

We need you to spread the word by sharing this link on your social media and to friends and family. There are some really cool hand made perks that we think you will enjoy!

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/oakland-to-la-in-style

story:
What we are all about...the "Experience"

The Cleveland Candle Company is a vision of three close friends who wanted to re-imagine how scents were created and brought to life.  We believe fragrance can transform an environment, set a mood, and create a memory.  Fragrance helps connect us to the world around us and the experiences we have in it.  

For those of us on the team, we didn't want to just create a product but an experience to be shared with those around us.  In the digital age we live in, we wanted to make a space where people could go to put down their devices and really enjoy a life experience with others.  Hence the Cleveland Candle Company was born in late 2014.

The Creative Process...

 Here's how the experience works...
Step 1: Come in to our store and start your experience!  We will have over 70 different fragrances for you to choose from with more being added as we grow.  Mix and match up to 3 fragrances to make your own custom signature blend as you explore our fragrance wall!  We will also have free tea and coffee available, so take your time and truly enjoy the experience of discovering scent.

Step 2: Select your container! Come visit our container wall and pick out the size and shape of your candle container!  You can also bring your own containers to fill as well.  After you have selected your container, you will make a custom label for your candle to remember the experience by.

Step 3: Time to blend your oils!  Once you create your perfect blend you will pour it into your candle container and mix it with our custom soy wax blend.  Come back to visit us in 60 to 90 minutes and your brand new custom candle will be ready for you to pick up and enjoy!

The Funds 

The Cleveland Candle Company is set to open sometime in the Spring of 2015 around late April to early May.  So far, we have purchased our initial inventory and all of the candle-making equipment we need to get the store started.   It is in the next phase where we could really use your help.  We have a couple of interior design plans, but we need some additional funding in order to create the perfect atmosphere. The money raised here will go to building our one-of-a-kind "candle bar", light fixtures, walls, party room and other interior design elements.  With your help, we can make this place amazing from day 1 and a place people in Cleveland will be proud of.

The Vision

Our long term vision is to create a successful "experience-based" retail concept and begin building stores on both the East and West sides of Cleveland.  We believe there is a need in the marketplace for a local, handcrafted candle company that uses Eco-friendly, sustainable products. We plan on becoming this premier company, both on the retail and wholesale sides of the business.  We love Cleveland and we believe people in our city should be able to buy products made locally, at an affordable price, with businesses who want to reinvest in the city and it's people.  It is this vision that drives us everyday as we look to bring people together and raise up the city we love: Cleveland!

The Team

David Gin (co-founder):  This is David's second small business venture in the city of Cleveland.  He is the founder and owner of Real Fruit, LLC (www.realfrut.com), a gourmet juice company that uses local produce to create world class juice.  Real Fruit are winners of "The Best Juice in Cleveland 2013 Award" and "Taste of Painesville Best Drink 2014".  He has a passion for Cleveland and has over 10 years of retail experience.  He is a graduate of Indiana Wesleyan University and holds both a Finance and Marketing Degree.  His favorite board game : King of Tokyo.

Linda Turner (co-founder): This is Linda's first small business venture in the city of Cleveland. She has 10 years of retail experience and loves helping people. She volunteers at the Cleveland Food Bank. She has an Associate of Arts degree from Lakeland Community College. She enjoys reading and watching movies. Her favorite movies are based on the author Nicholas Sparks.

Tanya Bratten (co-founder): This is Tanya's first small business venture in the city of Cleveland.  She has over 5 years of retail management experience and is truly passionate about customer service. She studied business at Lakeland Community College and has also worked with Real Fruit, LLC for the last four years. She loves to try new restaurants and her favorite movie is "Bridesmaids."

We Need Your Support!

First off, our team wants to thank you for coming to our page to learn more about this project.  We really want to create something special in the city of Cleveland for people to experience.  

We are asking for your help to get the word out about our vision and company to those who you are friends with.  We hope you will support us both in our funding effort and through word of mouth.  We will be constantly updating this page as we go through this journey and hope you can join us on the adventure.  Thanks!

-The Cleveland Candle Team

story:
"BİR TUĞLA DA SİZ KOYUN"

Projeme yan sütunda gördüğünüz seçeneklerden size uygun birini tercih ederek katkıda bulunabilirsiniz.


Merhaba, ben Nil. Sizlere, Kapadokya’da gerçekleştirmeye çalıştığım kaya otel projemden bahsetmek istiyorum. Kapadokya’ya İstanbul’dan 8 yıl önce taşındım. Bölgenin en eski kaya otelinde yönetici pozisyonunda çalışmaya başladım. Turizm sektöründe hiç tecrübem olmadığı halde, bu işe çok uygun olduğumu ve bölgede yaşamaktan çok keyif aldığımı fark ettim. Böylelikle, hayalim olan kendi küçük otel projemi hayata geçirmeye karar verdim.

Satın almış olduğum tarihi kaya evde restorasyon çalışmaları sürerken, ben de otel yönetimi konusunda tecrübemi artırmaya karar verdim. Bu amaçla, inşaatı henüz tamamlanmış bir küçük otelde teklif edilen yöneticilik pozisyonunu kabul ettim. Çok kısa bir süre içerisinde, yetiştirdiğim ekibimle birlikte, TripAdvisor’da Kapadokya küçük otelleri sıralamasında birinci sıraya yerleştik. Bu başarı dört sene boyunca, bugüne kadar devam etti. Bu sene ise Avrupa’nın en iyi 25 küçük otelinden birisi olduk. Şimdi, sıra bu başarıları kendi otelimde elde etmeye geldi.

Projemin %70’i kendi bütçem, banka kredileri ve devletin tarihi eser restorasyon desteği ile tamamlanmıştır. Projemin daha kısa sürede tamamlanabilmesi için sizin değerli desteklerinizi bekliyorum. Katkılarınızı, Kapadokya seyahatinizi önceden planlayarak sağlayabilirsiniz. Yakında otelimde sizleri ağırlamak dileği ile!


Hello, my name is Nil. I would like tell you about my dream cave hotel project at Cappadocia, Turkey. I moved to Cappadocia 8 years ago from Istanbul. I started working at the first cave hotel of this region. Although, I had no experience at tourism sector, I realised that I was very suitable fort his job and loved living here. Therefore, I decided to make my dream come true and open my small cave hotel.

As, the restorations started at the traditional cave house I have invested in, I wanted to gain more experience at hotel management. And, I accepted the management job offered at a newly finished small cave hotel. With, the team I built and trained, we achieved to become number one on TripAdvisor at Cappadocia region in a very short period of time. And, this success continued until today, for four consecutive years. And, finally this year we achieved to become of one of the top 25 small hotels of Europe. Now, it is time to realise these successes at my own small hotel.

The 70% of my hotel project has been completed by my own budget, bank credits and government loans for restoring old houses. To finalise this project sooner, I need your valuable contributions. You may help me by planning your Cappadocia trip in advance. Looking forward to meeting with you at my cave hotel soon!
story_txt:
"BİR TUĞLA DA SİZ KOYUN"Projeme yan sütunda gördüğünüz seçeneklerden size uygun birini tercih ederek katkıda bulunabilirsiniz.
Merhaba, ben Nil. Sizlere, Kapadokya’da gerçekleştirmeye çalıştığım kaya otel projemden bahsetmek istiyorum. Kapadokya’ya İstanbul’dan 8 yıl önce taşındım. Bölgenin en eski kaya otelinde yönetici pozisyonunda çalışmaya başladım. Turizm sektöründe hiç tecrübem olmadığı halde, bu işe çok uygun olduğumu ve bölgede yaşamaktan çok keyif aldığımı fark ettim. Böylelikle, hayalim olan kendi küçük otel projemi hayata geçirmeye karar verdim.Satın almış olduğum tarihi kaya evde restorasyon çalışmaları sürerken, ben de otel yönetimi konusunda tecrübemi artırmaya karar verdim. Bu amaçla, inşaatı henüz tamamlanmış bir küçük otelde teklif edilen yöneticilik pozisyonunu kabul ettim. Çok kısa bir süre içerisinde, yetiştirdiğim ekibimle birlikte, TripAdvisor’da Kapadokya küçük otelleri sıralamasında birinci sıraya yerleştik. Bu başarı dört sene boyunca, bugüne kadar devam etti. story:
About us

Hi we are called Simply Good Food TV and we consists of TV chef Peter Sidwell and technology expert Robert Steadman.  We have worked together on various App based projects but have now decided to team up together and  blend Pete's TV and media  cooking back ground and Roberts technical back ground create the works first dedicated food TV app.

Pete is passionate about food and great food TV content and his dream is to have the best cooking TV channel available for the user to enjoy. 

The app has ended up being a much bigger project that we initially realized so right now funding is essential to match our ambitions globally.  We have completed Phase 1 the ipad version (search for simply good food in the app store)  and we are just about to completing the android tablet version. We now need to build the iphone and android phone versions to cover a large proportion of users devices as well as increase the amount of content inside the app to make a significant impact. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We need £30000 to accelerate the build of the app and add more content. 
  • You chance to be part of something new and exciting. 
  • We are also offering the once in a life time opportunity to join us in the audience to film our first original content as it will be filmed in front of a live audience with 2 UK TV chefs. 
  • Your chance to be a TV star and appear next to the chefs in the TV series
  • The funds will also go in to R&D, adding more content and completing the apps.
  • Creating original content that is exclusive to the app to drive more viewers and establish ourselves as a global media company.

Risks & Challenges

In every project there is a risk but we believe that this will be successful, having a TV chef and a tech guy join up means you get the food part and the technical part being completed by people who know their business.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if right now you can not contribute you can still help us by sharing this campaign.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the message out to your friends

And that's all there is to it.

Get the ipad version now by clicking here or go to the link below

story:
Download Stellup from Apple App Store here

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/stellup-meet-new-people/id998280844?mt=8



The first mobile app focused on meeting new interesting people within your university and company networks.

There have never been more ways to access people with all the social apps available to us today, yet connecting with people you actually want to meet has never been harder.

We are here to make that happen. We are creating a new social networking experience that will let you connect with new people within your university and company networks.

Moving to a new city for work? Trying to connect with alumni during your travels? Our mobile solution makes it easy and efficient to realize the full potential of your trusted networks.

It is currently very difficult to meet alumni from your past universities, as alumni networks exist mainly on web, resources are underutilized, and the websites are search-based. It's hard to find the right people, and even harder to start two-way communication.


On the other hand, the need to meet new people you trust is growing rapidly, with businesses being more global than ever, and thus employees being increasingly mobile and travelling to new cities frequently, in which they don’t know people. Therefore, alumni are trying to hack the problem by using Facebook and Linkedin groups or email lists. These solutions, however, are not leading to meaningful one-on-one connections. In groups and email lists, people do not feel that they are being personally contacted and have no obligation or pressure to respond.


  • A mobile and easy-to-use interface in which users can identify connections that belong to the same academic or professional groups and have thus been pre-screened, hence seen as a trusted reference. Stellup offers this experience.


1. Mobile App - easy to use
2. One-touch connect with your FB Account
3. Double Intro: talk to new people only when both of you of are interested in talking
4. Join multiple clubs: alumni of school, universities and companies

        Easily Signup                See all Clubs          Apply for exclusive ones

               


       Join your clubs         See people to meet         Message if mutual 

          


If you have any doubts on the perks or especially want to know more about becoming one of our Sponsors, please send an email to info@stellup.com, with subject Indiegogo.

How Stellup started?

We are serial networkers who lived in more than 10 countries, moved around a lot for work and know too well the value of having access to interesting people and their knowledge.  

As alumni of leading business schools, we know both how valuable it can be to make new connections within alumni networks.

We are very passionate about technology and meeting new people, and we really believe a mobile solution could help solve this problem.

  • We believe every new encounter has the potential to open a new world. Stellup will have an enormous impact on how we meet people. Making it easier and more fun to develop powerful human connections via our mobile devices. Here's to bringing us all closer to new worlds: new friendships, business ventures, new jobs and new adventures!

    • We are a team of young entrepreneurs with international backgrounds and strong experience in mobile. Before starting Stellup, we  have built products and grown businesses, at both large tech companies and venture-backed startups in the US, Europe, Latin America and China.



    • Our goal is to raise at least USD 25,000, to be used entirely to complete the development of our iOS app and publish it on the Apple Store within a few months after this campaign. 
    • We have higher ambitions and welcome your support to also reach our stretched goals of raising enough to also build Apple Watch and Android apps
    • We are reaching out to friends, friends of friends, and new friends, who want to help us make this a reality.
    • Support us by making a pledge or buying one of our awesome perks! Pick the perk that rocks your boat, become an early supporter and help us create the best version of our product.

    • Apply for early access on www.stellup.com by registering with your email.

    • Sign up to our Thunderclap and share our crowdfunding campaign.

    • Spread the word by sharing our story with your friends, family, colleagues - or even strangers!

We have higher ambitions and welcome your support to also reach our stretched goals of raising enough to also build Apple Watch and Android apps


We are reaching out to friends, friends of friends, and new friends, who want to help us make this a reality.


Support us by making a pledge or buying one of our awesome perks! Pick the perk that rocks your boat, become an early supporter and help us create the best version of our product.





Apply for early access on www.stellup.com by registering with your email.




Sign up to our Thunderclap and share our crowdfunding campaign.





Spread the word by sharing our story with your friends, family, colleagues - or even strangers!

story:
Wicoicage Teca Cangleska Tawapi: A New Generations Circle, June 17th-19th, 2015 in the Long Soldier Community, Fort Yates, North Dakota.  The purpose of this camp is to nurture leadership by reinstilling Woope (Traditional Social Rules to the Lakota way of Life) and Wotakuye (Lakota kinship), the foundation of Lakota society with youth, ages 11-13 and their families.

OUR HOME: The Standing Rock Sioux Tribe is located on 2.3 million acres of land in both the States of North Dakota and South Dakota and is home to the Hunkpapa and Sihasapa bands of Lakota, and the Ihuntuwana and Pabaksa bands of Dakota. Native Americans represent less than one percent of this country's population and yet when you take a look at everything negative mainstream society keeps track of, we're leading the statistics. What most don't know is that Standing Rock is a beautiful place to live. It's here among our own people that our children have their greatest struggles and their greatest strengths. We are actively working to retain our language, cultural and spiritual heritage.

OUR YOUTH: Everybody wants to feel connected in this world. We all have a unique human need to feel a part of something. Today, I don't think that our youth feel that. I don't think they feel connected to their people through their language or their spirituality. I don't think they feel connected to mainstream society or the rest of the world for that matter. What we're trying to do is to help them to center themselves again.

A report by Stephanie Woodard for NBC News recently said, "A youth-suicide epidemic is sweeping Indian country, with Native American teens and young adults killing themselves at more than triple the rate of other American youth, according to federal government figures." In 1997, Standing Rock went through a suicide crisis and in 2000 we went through another. I have personally lost a younger brother and a younger cousin to suicide. What I learned from this experiences is this, we can't wait for the United States government or State Governments to give us much needed resources to rebuild our communities, we can't even wait for own Tribal governments or a program. As a people, we have everything we need to create change. We know that we can do better. We can surround them with support and love. We can create a system of care that acknowledges and gives merit to the cultural and spiritual teachings of our people. I strongly believe we can make a difference with your help.

OUR HORSES: The Lakota/Dakota people were once known to have been one of the greatest light cavalries in the world. Their horsemanship was legendary. Our ancestors knew and understood the horse. They knew and understood that the horses could affect you in powerful ways.

The Lakota/Dakota people have point of origin stories of the coming of Sunkawakan, the horse and the gift they brought to our ancestors. Within those stories is the foundation of Lakota horsemanship, which began with developing a relationship first. Our ancestors weren't just good horsemen, they were good relatives to the horse nation.

We are working on bringing horses back into the lives of our people. We strongly believe that if we can reintroduce horses back into the lives of our people, then our children, grand children and those not yet born will once again flourish.

DESCRIPTION OF PROPOSAL CONTENT:

Sunkawakan Ta Wounspe: Teachings from the Horse Nation is a North Dakota State recognized nonprofit located on the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation. We are committed to preserving the teachings of our ancestors and the horse nation so that our children, grandchildren and those not yet born will flourish.

We are teaming up with Sung Nagi Kici Okiju: Becoming one with the Spirit of the Horse, LLC., www.becomingonewiththespiritofthehorse.com, to host an equine assisted learning cultural camp for Standing Rock youth.

Sung Nagi Kici Okiju: Becoming one with the Spirit of the Horse is not a horsemanship model; it’s a way of life.

Sung Nagi Kici Okiju is a unique experience that honors the spirit of the horse and the wisdom of the Lakota/Dakota Oyate to help people to center themselves, reconnect and find healing. Together, we will look at the four stages of life to gain a better understanding of who we are mentally, emotionally, physically and spiritually.

Sung Nagi Kici Okiju uses 95% ground and mounted exercises for use in the practice of Equine Assisted Wraparound (EAW) and Equine Assisted Learning (EAL).

LEARNING STRATEGIES:

Becoming one with the Spirit of the Horse helps to improve creativity, problem solving, communication, team work and leadership skills. It builds upon strengths and helps to improve self esteem, self confidence and self awareness. By becoming one with the spirit of the horse, you will learn to center yourself, reconnect and find balance.

SPECIFIC LEARNING OBJECTIVES:

1. Participants will gain an understanding of Woope (Traditional Social Rules to the Lakota way of Life).

2. Participants will gain an understanding of Wotakuye (Lakota Kinship), the foundation of Lakota society.

3. Participants will gain an understanding of women and men's roles.

4. Participants will gain an understanding of the sacredness of the horse and their healing abilities.

Please visit our events page on Facebook at, https://www.facebook.com/events/846780022031111/ to learn more about the camp.

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL BE USED:

$2000 will be used to provide food and supplies for camp

$2000 will be used to provide consultant fees to mentors.

$1000 will be used to provide portapotties for the camp.

story:
The UPS Store, is a global company with one of the most recognized and admired brands in the world. Has become the world's largest package delivery company and a leading global provider of specialized transportation and logistics services. I am seeking your help to support this project to Open a UPS Store in New York City, run and administrate it only by Veterans. 

I am a US Army Veteran and as more Soldiers come home from Afghanistan, I want to make a change and hire and support other Local Veterans that live here in the Big Apple. My main goal is to open this UPS Store and Offer employment to Veterans and search for more talent in which they can Partner with me to open other stores to fully support our Veteran Communities and there families, and to Bring the discipline and loyalty of our Veterans to our Local communities with the exceptional services from the UPS store.

what's the money for?

The raised funds will be used for paying the minimum require investment to get the UPS franchise and for our Support campaign for Veteran own businesses across New York City.

President Obama: "Hire a Veteran"




Risks and challenges

The Main challenge is the Financing, If I don't reach my goal, It will be very hard to acquire this franchise and I will need to look for another franchise or Business model with the raised funds but will provide the Perks on time.
