story:
We need your help

Vietnam Veterans of America, California State Council is seeking your help in support of our Veteran Service Officer (VSO) Program.

Our highly trained Veteran Service Officers

Our highly trained VSOs interview, advise, and otherwise assist, veterans, and their families, in understanding and obtaining the benefits to which they are entitled. Specifically, the VSO guides Veterans and their families through the complex processes and forms needed to establish and/or validate, their rights to veterans’ benefits. Such benefits include, but are not limited to, pensions, education, insurance, hospitalization, home loans, medical, and burial. Medical care includes mental health care for maladies such as Post Traumatic Stress Disorder. Once the specific needs are identified, our VSOs assist the veteran and/or their family members navigate through the myriad of paperwork required by Veterans Administration.

Donations are needed

Your donations are needed for the continued training of existing VSOs and hiring of additional VSOs to handle the increasing demand. There are currently 1.9 Million veterans in California. We expect that figure will increase significantly as servicemen and women come home from Afghanistan and Iraq.

Founding Principle

Based on our founding principle, “Never Again Will One Generations of Veterans Abandon Another,” our VSO program assists veterans from all eras and conflicts, ranging from WWII to our current conflict in the Middle East.

An Act of Congress

Our VSO program is operated under the auspices of the Vietnam Veterans of America, the only Veterans Service Organization chartered by an act of Congress.

We are a 501(c)19 non-profit organization. Vietnam Veterans VSO program is supported solely by donations and all donations are tax deductible to the extent of the law.
story_txt:
We need your help
Vietnam Veterans of America, California State Council is seeking your help in
support of our Veteran Service Officer (VSO) Program.
Our highly
trained Veteran Service Officers
Our
highly trained VSOs interview, advise, and otherwise assist, veterans, and
their families, in understanding and obtaining the benefits to which they are
entitled. Specifically, the VSO guides Veterans and their families through the
complex processes and forms needed to establish and/or validate, their rights
to veterans’ benefits. Such benefits include, but are not limited to, pensions,
education, insurance, hospitalization, home loans, medical, and burial. Medical
care includes mental health care for maladies such as Post Traumatic Stress Disorder. Once the
specific needs are identified, our VSOs assist the veteran and/or their family
members navigate through the myriad of paperwork required by Veterans
Administration.
Donations are
needed
Your
donations are needed for the continued training of existing VSOs and hiring of additional VSOs to handle the increasing demand. There are currently 1.9 Million
veterans in California. We expect that figure will increase significantly as servicemen
and women come home from Afghanistan and Iraq.
Founding
Principle 
Based
on our founding principle, “Never Again Will One Generations of Veterans
Abandon Another,” our VSO program assists veterans from all eras and conflicts,
ranging from WWII to our current conflict in the Middle East.
An Act of
Congress
Our
VSO program is operated under the auspices of the Vietnam Veterans of America,
the only Veterans Service Organization chartered by an act of Congress.
We are a 501(c)19 non-profit organization. Vietnam Veterans VSO program is supported solely by donations and all donations are
tax deductible to the extent of the law.

story:
Why respect privacy in web analytics?

I believe we can respect privacy and still generate statistical valid web analytics data. We all know Google Analytics or Piwik. But they all use cookies. But many internet users prefer not to be tracked via cookies.

So I want to explore the possibilities and limits of gathering web analytics data for websites by developing approaches, that

  • do not use cookies to comply with european privacy regulations
  • do not use eTag or other shady technologies to "mark" users remotely
  • provide website and web shop owners with reliable data about their users and usage to help optimize their sites user experience (helpful reports for web and conversion optimization)
  • can be possibly integrated with other already existing webanalytics tools

To proof this concept, I want to do a coding sprint with friends and publish the results afterwards.

If you think this is cool, donate us a coffee or a pop

What I do:

  • sacrifice some of my free time / family time
  • pay some coding friends
  • pay my test suite hosting
  • publish the results at https://datsecur.com

What you get

Of course this is only a proof-of-concept. So there will not be a final product at the end of this proof-of-concept phase. Well, at least not one that could be shipped. But your benefits are:

  • a good feeling to strengthen privacy efforts on the internet
  • assurance, I will be happy for your support

Risks?

Well, I already started coding and i am confident to deliver some outcome, that will increase web privacy and collect sufficient user and usage data and that is anonymous in many ways. Since this is a proof-of-concept project I hope to deliver a production ready proof at the end. However, to be safe, I cannot promise anything. I might not achieve all goals I have set. 

Want to support in other ways?

There are other ways you might be able to help me:

  • Tell your friends about it, share this campaign
  • Join the project as test users and gather data during the testing phase
    (this means, you use my tracking code on your website to populate the web analytics database)

Thanks for reading and supporting!

Thomas

story:
Big River Button Factory is a dream I've been working towards since moving to New Orleans. It's a dream of a small business and community-centric workshop. A chance for me to do what I love, support myself, and do great things for my new found community.

What will the Big River Button Factory do? 

Phase 1: Make buttons for small businesses, non-profits, krewes (parade groups) and other organizations looking to promote themselves and their causes by giving away or selling buttons with their logos and messages. Additionally, selling buttons with original artwork and fun designs through local stores and button vending machines. This can all be done out of my own home.

Phase 2: Rent a storefront. The storefront will serve as a workshop to produce the buttons, a retail space to sell them direct to the public along with other gifts and accoutrements, and a place where booths can be set up so people can have their own custom designs pressed into buttons right there in front of them. The work stations can also host programs whereby teenagers old enough to use the button presses can craft, press, and then sell their own buttons.

The Big River Button Factory storefront is going to be a cross between a Build A _______ Workshop and a candy store. A fun, inviting, wonderland of buttons. Colorful and engaging, it will fit perfectly within the tourist Mecca of New Orleans while also appealing to and fitting in with its local communities. I want to see parents and teachers bringing kids in with drawings that will be pressed into buttons they can proudly wear on their shirts before their eyes. I want tourists to have their pictures taken in front of local monuments and have those memories permanently pressed. I want Summer programs where local youths can have a place to create and sell, building skills and confidence for the future. 

What will Big River Button Factory do with your contributions?

At the $500 mark: A starter button making kit for making 1in. buttons, including a cutter, a press, and the buttons themselves (500).

At the $1,000 mark: A second starter kit for making 2in buttons.

At the $2,000 mark: A third starter kit for 3in buttons and a vending machine.

At the $3,000 mark: Two more button vending machines.

At the goal of $5,000: This last $2,000 will be used for infrastructure to create a button making work-space. As well as packaging and distribution of the buttons.

Additional contributions will all be put towards producing more buttons until I've acquired a steady stream of clients and customers that will allow a shop to be established. The website will be set up once I am ready to start taking orders.

Who am I?

                                                         


My name is Angelo Olegna. Currently in New Orleans, I moved here from St. Louis after being a community activist and small business promoter for years. Specializing in special events, I have a long history of successfully bringing people together to have a great time and support the community and local artists and crafters. I am proud of what I accomplished in STL and excited to be a part of NOLA.

The following pictures are of community events I planned and organized. Examples of the work I've done for my hometown of St. Louis. The skills I developed from this work will help me make sure Big River Button Factory is a success!

Additionally, I am an artist. Having had gallery shows for years. Here are some examples of my work. They are dedicated to my great passions: architecture and Urbanism. Love letters to cities and the people who are a part of them.


I hope my solid business plan, my longstanding dedication to community work, and my artistic skills are enough to prove that the money donated will be well-spent. That this project will succeed, and will be a resource and benefit to New Orleans.

Thank you so much for helping me follow my dreams.

Angelo Olegna

story:
Ever dream of having your own business and the possibilities of being your own boss? My sister and I have had this dream for as long as we can remember. Let me start off by introducing ourselves. My name is Sherry and my sister's name is Valerie. Owning and operating an online baby boutique hasn't been an idea we just stumbled upon.  We have done our due diligence and made a business plan, formed our LLC and done hours and hours upon hours of research on our products we intend to sell. 

   Spotted Hippo is the name of our boutique. Spotted Hippo will sell baby clothing from size newborn to 5T. We will also carry an assortment of baby gear. We intend to carry American, handmade products, we want to make sure our customers are receiving products that have been made with quality and love.

   Contributors will be helping us launch our boutique off of the ground. Spotted Hippo has been such a dream for us, that we hope to be models for young entrepreneurs, to achieve their life goals and dreams. We believe that with hard work and persistence, anything is possible.

   The funding Spotted Hippo needs is $8,000. This amount will be going to inventory, packing supplies, and licensing fees. 

          The Breakdown:

$6,000-Inventory

$1,000-Packing Supplies

$1,000-Licensing fees

We hope to meet our goal, but if our goal is not met, the funds we DO make will still go to our inventory. We are willing to accept whatever we make work. 

   Spotted Hippo will be selling unique, adorable and affordable baby and toddler clothing. We will also be willing to sell products from small local businesses and local sellers. If you have a product or line you'd like to sell feel free to contact us. We want to help build other businesses as we build ours. 

   As we start our entrepreneurial, we want you to know that by contributing, you are making our dreams that much closer to a reality. As independent young women, we'd like to show everyone that every dream is possible. 

-Sherry & Valerie

of Spotted Hippo, LLC

story:
We are a small batch roastery based in Cleveland, Ohio

When we say small batch, we mean it. When we roast our coffee we do it one pound at a time. That means that every single bean gets individualized attention and ensures that every cup of Rooster and Viking Coffee is of the utmost quality. We have been selling our coffee online for several months, but now we are looking to open a stand at local farmers markets and craft fairs. We will be offering pour-overs, Aeropress®, iced coffee, and tea.

What We Need 

We need the supplies to prepare and serve our delicious coffee. This includes machinery such as a water boiler and coffee grinder. As well as serving supplies; cups, lids, sleeves etc. as well as (of course) Coffee. Other miscellaneous  purchases include sugar and half and half. The remaining money will be used to pay for fees that farmers markets and fairs charge vendors.

story:
For the latest updates, donations and info please visit: http://nowruzsfcityhall.com See you Friday!


Summary

Mark your calendars for Friday, 3/27 at 6PM because the Nowruz Celebration at San Francisco City Hall tradition is being revived!

  • Organized by a team of individual volunteers supported by Ross Mirkarimi & Iranican.
  • Come celebrate Iranian music, dance and finger food as we reach out to the community and officials by sharing our New Year traditions complimentary to all guests by our volunteers and sponsors. Limited seats, first come first server.
  • By your contribution, you are the cause in the matter of event happening & with the beauty it merits in San Francisco City Hall.
  • Contact: Atoosa  (415) 212-8490 |  e-mail sfnowruz@gmail.com
بياييد نوروز را در شهرداري زيبا و با عظمت شهر سانفرانسيسكو با موزيك و رقص كلاسيك ايراني همراه با خوراكيهاي ايراني جشن بگيريم . با پشتيباني و شركت خود در برنامه  فرهنگ ايراني را به طور رسمي به تماشا گذاشته و تجليل مي كنيم 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We already have over $6,000 of pledges and need to raise at least $9,000 more to make this happen!
    • We are planning an event that would have normally cost significantly more.
    • Our volunteers, food donors, and City Hall’s contributions are making this possible for under $20,000.

  • Performances coordinated by Atoosa Samiian-Yekan (alphabetically)
    • Ballet Afsaneh
    • Golestan Kids
    • Niosha Dance Academy
    • Ostad Nejad Music Academy
    • Shahrzad Dance Company
    • Vahid Bagheri & Reza Niknejad on Santour & Dombak
    • & others to be announced!
  • Refreshments and Appetizers sponsored by [To be Confirmed]
  • Haft-Seen Spread sponsored by lavishbridalsofrehs.com
  • With your tax-deductible donation* you will help us connect to greater community and officials, be recognized for your contribution and get privileges on the event date!
  • If we do not reach our goal, or if we exceed the goal, the money will go to future cultural events in the Bay Area.

The Impact

  • City Hall is of the most iconic and significant places in the US to host Nowruz
  • Exposure to the greater community at a magnificent venue 
  • Show our presence to San Francisco Sheriff, Mayor, and officials
  • Bring this tradition back to City Hall and keep it

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love the idea and are not in a position to contribute

  • Get the word out and share the campaign via your facebook / e-mail and word of mouth to your friends and family!
  • If you want to volunteer at the event Call Atoosa at (415) 212-8490 or email sfnowruz@gmail.com

story:
SKM's Food For Life Program in Brief

Sri Krishna Mandir Singapore embarked on its Food for Life program in the 1990's when it saw a huge surge in the number of residents in Old Age Homes and elderly as destitutes. We wanted to do our part to ensure that they have atleast 1 nutritional meal instead of eating instant noodles. We started off serving 60 packets a day and now we are delivering close to 1,000 packets a day!

What We Need 

We require funds urgently  because:

  • Our delivery van has to be scrapped, as in Singapore you need to renew after 10 years. Our delivery van is our only lifeline, our only transport to continue with our charity effort, hence we urgently need to acquire a van that cost SGD $98,800.
  • We have already raised close to SGD $33,085, and now need to source for the remaining amount of SGD $53,715 to buy the van. Purchasing vehicles is an expensive affair in Singapore even for charity organizations!
  • If we do not reach our target of SGD $53,715, then whatever sums collected will be set aside and we will continue with other fundraising efforts till we reach the target.

The Impact

We have been doing this charity effort and do not wish to disappoint our elderly who depend on us:

  • Food for Life Program is important to us as we able to prevent hunger, allow our elderly to live in dignity and be compasionate to our fellow human beings.
  • We have been successfully delivering for the last 7 years and hold an annual carnival and host close to 800 elderly members of the community, giving them an opportunity to step outside their homes and mingle with supporters, donors, well-wishers and members of the community.
  • We do not discrimminate and reach out to everyone regardless of race, creed, language or religion.

Time is running out!

We need funds urgently as the deadline to purchase a van is a month away. So, 

  • please donate generously!
  • help us to help our pioneer generation who have done their part for the country

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help us financially, please help to create awareness about our campaign among your family members, relatives and friends by:

  • sharing our campaign through social media, share our link.
  • make alot of noise about our campaign

Please help, every dollar counts!

story:
Twisted Limb Hard Cider

We're the first hard cider company in New Jersey since the start of Prohibition nearly 100 years ago.  We need your help to expand our operations, and bring our cider to stores and pubs near you!

Marty, Scruffy Mike, and Frank all met playing rugby at Rutgers.  We decided to make traditional hard cider using only local apples and local honey.  

We planted our orchard with traditional hard cider apples, we have some equipment, and we do a lot of work by hand.  We want to raise money so we can increase our production, buy some new equipment, and increase our distribution.  

By funding this campaign, you can have access to local, traditionally made hard cider, while at the same time creating manufacturing jobs, supporting local farmers, and keeping things Jersey Fresh!

What does it take to make a bottle?

Each bottle takes 7 apples, 1 spoonful of honey, a bottle, cork, front and back label, and is aged for about a month in bourbon barrels made of oak.

We would like to make bigger batches during the fall season, as well as some experimental batches.  Can you imagine what a dry hopped, apple and sorghum cider would taste like?  Neither can I!  We have all of our (boring) equipment installed- now we're looking for some operating capital to roll our product out to more locations in New Jersey and New York.  

Keeping it local...

Macro economic trends suggest this wouldn't be possible, but we're manufacturing our product right here in New Jersey.  We also:

  • Support biodiversity- We use wildflower honey from the Neshanic River Valley. 
  • Keep history alive- The Harrison apple species in our orchard was originally cultivated in colonial America in the area now known as Harrison, NJ.
  • Engage in sustainability- Our barn was built with wood cut from trees blown down during Hurricane Sandy.

The craft beer movement

Craft brewing had a long, uphill battle to convince people to stop drinking Big Brewery Beer.  Together, we can demand cider is a "local only" item, and it should be treated the way Champagne, Virginia Ham, Napa Valley, Bourbon, and Parmigiano-Reggiano are treated- as distinct categories, rather than mass marketed junk.  

Can't donate?

Not enough spare income?  No problem!  We're broke too!  We love to have volunteers up to the barn to help us bottle, and you can always help by sharing this indiegogo site.  Check us out on IG @twistedlimb or twistedlimbcider.com!

Twisted Limb Hard Cider We're the first hard cider company in New Jersey since the start of Prohibition nearly 100 years ago.  We need your help to expand our operations, and bring our cider to stores and pubs near you!
Marty, Scruffy Mike, and Frank all met playing rugby at Rutgers.  We decided to make traditional hard cider using only local apples and local honey.  

We planted our orchard with traditional hard cider apples, we have some equipment, and we do a lot of work by hand.  We want to raise money so we can increase our production, buy some new equipment, and increase our distribution.  
By funding this campaign, you can have access to local, traditionally made hard cider, while at the same time creating manufacturing jobs, supporting local farmers, and keeping things Jersey Fresh!   What does it take to make a bottle? Each bottle takes 7 apples, 1 spoonful of honey, a bottle, cork, front and back label, and is aged for about a month in bourbon barrels made of oak.

We would like to make bigger batches during the fall season, as well as some experimental batches.  Can you imagine what a dry hopped, apple and sorghum cider would taste like?  Neither can I!  We have all of our (boring) equipment installed- now we're looking for some operating capital to roll our product out to more locations in New Jersey and New York.     Keeping it local... Macro economic trends suggest this wouldn't be possible, but we're manufacturing our product right here in New Jersey.  We also:  Support biodiversity- We use wildflower honey from the Neshanic River Valley.  Keep history alive- The Harrison apple species in our orchard was originally cultivated in colonial America in the area now known as Harrison, NJ. Engage in sustainability- Our barn was built with wood cut from trees blown down during Hurricane Sandy.    The craft beer movement  Craft brewing had a long, uphill battle to convince people to stop drinking Big Brewery Beer.  Together, we can demand cider is a "local only" item, and it should be treated the way Champagne, Virginia Ham, Napa Valley, Bourbon, and Parmigiano-Reggiano are treated- as distinct categories, rather than mass marketed junk.     Can't donate? Not enough spare income?  No problem!  We're broke too!  We love to have volunteers up to the barn to help us bottle, and you can always help by sharing this indiegogo site.  Check us out on IG @twistedlimb or twistedlimbcider.com!

story:
Help Support the Resilience Festival!

Coming up in March 2015, Transition Guelph will be hosting our annual Resilience Festival. This week long festival is a celebration of the work that is done throughout the year in our community that contributes to making Guelph a happy, sustainable, resilient, thriving city in which we live, work, and play. The festival shares the vision of a more connected community that includes a lower environmental impact and a higher-satisfaction way of living. Along with our partners, Transition Guelph shares a common priority of strengthening community and building its resiliency to adapt to a changing future.


Over the years, our annual Resilience Festival has grown in both size and popularity, and we expect this year will be bigger and better than ever! With over 1000 people in attendance and the support of over 50 volunteers, the festival will host a number of talks, workshops, and other events that all provide an opportunity for organizations, businesses, families, and individuals to come together to build community, learn together, and celebrate social and environmental commitment to our community. Some events this year will include:


  • Seedy Saturday: a public seed swap where people can gather to purchase seeds and plants from vendors and share seeds for free with each other

  • Reskilling Fair: a day of workshops where people can learn new skills

  • Ecomarket and Community Connections Fair: businesses and organizations come together to sell eco-friendly products, promote their business, or share their stories

  • Healthcare Symposium: a discussion around alternative healthcare in our community

  • Builders Workshops: a series of events where we can learn ways of reducing energy consumption in our homes and learn about new, greener building techniques

  • Earth Hour Potluck: a gathering of our community to share food with friends and family

  • Keynote Speakers: an evening of discussion and learning from key members of our community

This year’s theme for the Resilience Festival is “Unleash Your Awesome!”. For us, that means finding the potential in every one of us to come together and make a difference. The Transition model focuses on taking small scale, positive action through volunteering with working groups and projects about which you feel passionate. We believe that the passion to make change exists in all of us, and we want to provide the opportunity for each member of our community to become engaged! For many, the Resilience Festival is the first step to getting involved in making the change they want to see.

We invite you to join is in this year’s celebration by supporting the festival. We rely on community organizations and businesses to help fund many of the costs associated with running the festival including space rental, promotional costs, and festival guide for the week of events.

story:
It's time to take a stand.



Sugar is making us sick.

There's significant evidence linking our overconsumption of sugar to many of the major diseases plaguing our world today, including obesity and all the diseases of metabolic syndrome.

  • In 2014, more than 1.9 billion adults, 18 years and older, were overweight. Of these, over 600 million were obese.
  • 47 million Americans currently have metabolic syndrome.
  • Combined with less physical activity, processed foods full of high-fat, high-sugar, high-salt, micronutrient-poor foods are major contributors. 


The great news? These diseases are preventable.

By reducing our daily sugar intake, we can take the first steps toward a happy, healthier life.


Are you a SUGAR-HOLIC?

You're probably right. Sugar is addictive. And we're eating too much of it.

LET'S TAKE BACK CONTROL OF OUR CRAVINGS AND OUR HEALTH. 

Enter the Sugar Stopper.

Developed by a certified holistic nutritionist, the Sugar Stopper is an all-natural herbal supplement spray. Made with the gymnema sylvestre herb, it suppresses the taste of sugar, reduces sugar cravings, helps maintain normal blood sugar and insulin levels, supports weight management and balances energy levels.


Want to know more? Watch this video:


What are people saying about the Sugar Stopper?



What challenges do we have?

We know that people love their sugar. But we also know that people want to get healthier, need help to do so and need it NOW. Here's how we'll do it:

Get the Sugar Stopper into the hands of those who really need it - we've got some great perks to say thank you. Check them out!


Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute financially. So...

  • Please like the Sugar Stopper Facebook Page.
  • Tweet and Instagram about us using #sugarstopper
  • Visit and share the Sugar Stopper website.
  • Share this IndieGogo campaign. Here's a short link: 

    http://igg.me/at/thesugarstopper


THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING US!

These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.
All images and videos are the property of Sugar Stopper, LLC - Mansfield, TX.

story:
Summary

My name is Pete. I live in Guam.  Our neighbors to the south, Ulithi and Fais (outer islands of Yap State, FSM), got schwacked this week by Super-Typhoon Maysak.  By the time the typhoon reached this tiny atoll in the middle of the Pacific the sustained winds were 160mph.  It ripped apart buildings and ruined crops.  I'm going to sail down to Ulithi and take a bunch of tarps and roofing nails and hammers to try to help start putting things back together.  I don't have a job right now so I have time to help out.  I'm hoping you will pitch in some cash to help me buy as many tarps and tools as I can stuff in the boat.  Thanks.


What We Need & What You Get

I'm hoping to get as much money as we can in a few days and take as much stuff as we can get.  If you send money it will be spent directly on supplies for the recovery.  If we don't reach our goal, we will spend what we've got and go with that.  Here are the things that people need right now:

    • Food
    • Water
    • Clothes
    • Footwear
    • First Aid Kits
    • Personal Hygiene products
    • Building Tools and Supplies
    • Sunglasses
    • Hats
    • Chainsaws and Blades
    • Mosquito Repellent
    • Tarps/Tents
    • Water Filters
    • Batteries
    • Flashlights/Lanterns
    • Plumbing fitting
    • Stomach flu/Diarrhea Medicine
    • Fiberglass mat/resin and hardner
    • hand tools

The Impact

I can take a lot of diarrhea medicine and tarps and flashlights and hammers on my small boat.  There are people on the island right now waiting to use the few tools they have.  If we can take some tools down, they will be able to utilize the manpower they already have available and speed up the long recovery process.  People are in need of help and I am in a position to help them.  I hope you see that you are in a position to help them too and decide to donate.

You'll be able to follow the expedition on my website: www.pyrate-enterprises.com

    Risks & Challenges

    There is risk involved with sailing on the open ocean but this is the best time of year to make this voyage and I have gone this way before.  I am confident in my abilities and the sea worthiness of my boat Absolute to make the voyage with no problem.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Whether or not you can help out with money, please send some positive energy out into the universe on behalf of the people of Ulithi and Fais as well as Yap and Chuuk

    If you are on Guam and want to donate stuff instead of money we need hand tools like hammers and machettes and tin snips.  I can take some clothes and stuff too but if you have stuff in the next couple days, take it to the Julale Center to load it in the container until 8 April. I only have so much room on the boat.

    Please send this to other people so maybe they can help out too. 

    Thanks!!
    Pete

story:
Please visit Peace Starter Meditation radio station just click here

Please visit Tumblr blog just click here

Please visit Twitter just click here

**You can become one of the investors in this project, please look the bottom of this page for more information. Thanks anyone who decide help this project. You can become supporter with any amounts you want.**

This android app consists of these parts:

1. Binaural beats - Brainwave entrainment to help induce relaxation, meditation, creativity and other desirable mental states.

2. Daily wisdom to uplift and motivate you at every morning

3. Meditation Time : A minimalistic part of the app to support short meditation sessions.

4. Meditation Sounds via 'Peace Starter Meditation radio channel'. You can access best meditation music 7/24.

Some of the great features:
★ High quality meditation sounds
★ Nature meditation music
★ Simple and beautiful design
★ Beautiful background images
★ Install to SD Card

**You can become one of the investors in this project, please look the bottom of this page for more information**

Why this project?

My aim is reach as many people as possible because I have a dream about more peaceful world. We can bring Hope & Opportunity to people with many invaluable tools for creating health, well-being, as well as personal and spiritual growth.

I believe if I can make someone smile, the world will become more peaceful place.Creating world peace takes many forms, but surely it begins with individuals. It continues to be the most significant challenge of humankind and requires the efforts of each of us.

I want to create many invaluable tools and make them accessible for everyone at anytime.

The question:

Can I make the World peaceful?

Don't think, "what can I do?" or that you are insignificant….,when the world is in a problem. You too have a role to play. A tiny homeopathic pill, which has a 1/100th, or 1/1000th potency, makes an impact on a body, which is sixty to seventy kilos! Scientists have discovered that a tiny change in one place, like the flapping of a butterfly's wings in South America, may produce a large effect in a far away location, like a tornado in Africa, which is called 'Butterfly effect'.

In the same way, every individual — everyone who is breathing, talking, walking, thinking - influences this planet. So we can all radiate peace, good thoughts, good vibrations, good wishes and that definitely makes an impact on the planet. Being peaceful in a meditative, prayerful state definitely helps.

Now we have a problem : The world is crying out for peace. Tune into the news today, and it’s evident: the world is becoming an increasingly violent place. Everyday we are increasingly asking: what can I do for peace? What can I do about wars, conflict and suffering?

It all starts in the mind. If we are not peaceful in our own mind, how can we be at peace with those around us?

How can I calm my mind – the answer is meditation, brainwave entertainment and daily wisdom to reminder us be happy. With your donate, we will create many projects to reduce stress, help people to calm their mind and reminder their that peaceful world is always possible. These projects will be everywhere: on phone, at metro & bus station, at workplace... 

“Meditation is that technique that puts us in touch with ourselves. Meditation is that inward journey to find peace.”

All world problems, from military conflicts to domestic conflicts, are caused by violence. Through meditation we can remove the cause of violence, thus bringing peace to the world.

Any action that is undertaken without inner peace only leads to regret. And peace does not mean inaction. One has to use all methodologies to curb terrorism. We have to do it through education and persuasion. Force should be used only when nothing else works. Meditation and daily wisdom have transformed the aggression and violence inside people into compassion, love, and care. In these times of war and disease in the world, it’s so important that we all meditate a little bit every day. When we meditate, we nullify those vibrations, thereby creating a more harmonious environment around us.

Make every day a peace day! Start day with smile!!

Thanks anyone who decide help this project. You can become supporter with any amounts you want.

Become one of the investors for this project, select one option from below and with paypal, you can get your monthly return. 
       investment       monthly return
1.    $100                 $10
2.    $250                 $30
3.    $500                 $75
4.    $1000               $200
5.    $5000               $1250
6.    $10000             $3000

story:
Short Summary

We are opening up this funding campaign as a way to pre-sale on screen advertising and coupons to our future guests and clients. 

We will clean up and re-open the 8 screen cinema located in the Eastdale Mall in Montgomery, AL. We will be opening between July 22nd and August 31st. 

We will feature first run, release date titles at a value driven price. We will also have a wide variety of concession items that are also a part of the value driven pricing concept. 

At Evans Theartres locations you can get two 32oz (medium) sodas and one 130oz (large) popcorn for less than $15.00.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to fill 25 advertising spaces before we open. We are going to be offering some perks at extremely discounted prices. We will also be offering some permanent on screen advertising slots. That means as long as we are in business and you are in business we will run ads on our screens. 

Your high impact ad will also be featured on our lobby display screens with other ads and internal promotional materials and upcoming movie trailers.  

The Impact

We feel now more than ever that Montgomery, AL is looking for a value driven family destination that can be enjoyed by all generations and demographics. A place to enjoy the most current blockbusters and some old time classics sprinkled in as well. 

Risks & Challenges

Security and safety of our guests is priority #1 above all else. We will work directly with Mall management to create a security plan for our business and our guests. 

We will do whatever necessary to keep our establishment clean and family friendly at all times. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this campaign, share our facebook page...and of course. Come visit us inside the Eastdale mall for our Grand Opening!

story:
SERILAHH: A CAFÉ WITH A PURPOSE

Help us materialise Serilahh – A truly Malaysian Café which serves delicious, halal, Malaysian foods for a purpose!

A portion of the bill paid by each customer will aid two projects; Mission Coffee – a microfinance programme that lends start-up capital to families to run coffee cart businesses and to refurbish Tuk-Tuks in the Kingdom of Wonder – Siem Reap, Cambodia.

The most beautiful wonder in the world, the sunrise and sunset in Siem Reap

Our Story

Hi everyone!

My name is Shabana, also known as Seri and this is our story.

I used to live the Corporate Dream with a big salary and elevated social status but after almost 11 years working in the field of Public Relations, I decided to quit my job and change my life’s path.

I did this because I realised that I was neither pursuing my passion, nor was I growing as an individual or contributing beyond myself in a meaningful way.

My ‘Eat-Pray-Play-Love’ journey to Siem Reap, Cambodia

I knew I had more in me because I wanted to do more and contribute to mankind in a meaningful way and this clarity was crystal clear to me when I was on an ‘Eat-Pray-Play-Love’ journey to Siem Reap, Cambodia after quitting my job in 2015.  During this journey, I volunteered at a local NGO and chanced upon the idea of being a social entrepreneur.

Together with my best friend – who’s been in the F&B business for many moons, the idea of the first Malaysian Café in Siem Reap, Cambodia was conceived.  Since we both love Malaysian foods, we have decided to showcase the many flavours of Malaysia to the communities and travelers of Siem Reap.


It is during my volunteering days, I was inspired to do more here in Cambodia

Great friendships forged with local and international NGOs

Celebrating monthly birthday with colleagues

Having a great time with my Cambodian family over a delicious vegetarian meal


The name ‘Serilahh’ which is from the word ‘Seri’ came about when we had a brainstorming session with our friends who lived around the globe. During the chat, the group was inspired to take on my nickname, ‘Seri’.

‘Seri’ simply means beautiful or beautiful and happy thoughts in the Malay language. While lahh is a slang used by Malaysians, in which the particle ‘lah’ is used at the end of a sentence to convey light-heartedness, politeness and a flexible effect.

Today, I live by the mantra, 'if it truly changed your life, how could you not tell people about it and pay it forward?' Rather than being caught up in the rat race in the struggle for wealth or power, I’ve decided to focus on my real priorities: health, relationships, passion, growth, and social service.  


Our campaign

We hope to raise $30,000 for the creation of our café and to ensure that it is fully operational to our customers by June 2016.

The funds will also be used for promotions: design; distribution; flyers; banners; hotel, high streets, Tuk-Tuk, airports and in-flight magazine advertising.

As well as to have the resources to train local Khemer cooks and service team to offer state of the art Malaysian culinary and hospitality.

We hope to create a unique Destination Café by serving delicious, halal, Malaysian foods; delivering excellent customer service in a cozy atmosphere and giving back to the local community.

Serilahh - A truly Malaysian Cafe

Serilahh under construction

The Impact

We hope that through Serilahh Café we’ll be able to collaborate more with the local NGOs and make a difference in the lives of the Cambodian people as well as cultivating entrepreneurship amongst young people through two projects close to our hearts; Mission Coffee which is a microfinance programme that lends start-up capital to families to run coffee cart businesses and to refurbish Tuk-Tuks in the Kingdom of Wonder – Siem Reap, Cambodia.

Furthermore, Mission Coffee has a special place in my heart since my volunteering days in Cambodia and it is my greatest wish to see it through by continuing to champion the programme by securing funds through Serilahh Café to ensure the sustainability of the programme.

We believe that through Serilahh Café we’ll also be able to connect, contribute and inspire the people of Cambodia.


Mission Coffee - Coffee for a Cause (Cold Brew & Nitro Coffee will be making waves in Siem Reap soon)


 Refurbishment of Tuk-Tuks

Us best friends together with our dear Tuk Tuk friend; Phos

Risks & Challenges

We basically foresee two main challenges concerning the café but we hope to overcome them as this café is something we really want to do and are committed to make it a success.

They are:

  • Maintaining significant customer volumes due to the high and low tourist seasons in Siem Reap. Thus we hope to boost promotion amongst locals and expats living here
  • Sustaining service staffs with impeccable customer service by providing ample service and culinary training and teaching of the English language

What’s in it for you?

Those who contribute towards Serilahh Café will be a part of our family.

Besides contributing towards our startup-enterprise for a good cause, we are pleased to offer you a variety of ‘Thank You Gifts’ in exchange for your support. Each contribution will be matched in kind with a suitable ‘Thank You Gift so please contribute as many times as you want.

The ‘Thank You Gifts’ include:

  • Private party for you and your 10 friends at Serilahh Café
  • 2 day hotel stay with meals at Serilahh Cafe
  • Donations to your favourite legalised charity in Cambodia
  • Spa Vouchers
  • Gift cards
  • T-shirt
  • Recognition on our Café wall and Facebook page

Other ways to support our first venture into social entrepreneurship

Besides contributing financially, there are other ways to join the Serilahh family.

  • We would like to invite budding Chefs/Cooks to join us to showcase your talents and recipes. We will experiment your recipes by organising a tasting session with our customers and ultimately showcase your recipes/dishes in our menu.
  • Hospitality Trainers are welcome to volunteer in our cafe to train our local talents to hospitality and culinary state of art.
  • Food bloggers too are welcome to pay us a visit to review and rate our foods.


Help us spread the word

Lastly, we request that you help us to spread the word by sharing our campaign with your own friends and family through your social media networks.

Please like us on Facebook @Serilahh and follow us on Instagram @serilahh.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! :)

We look forward to seeing you soon at Serilahh Café in the Kingdom of Wonder!

Thank you.

SERILAHH: A CAFÉ WITH A PURPOSE 
Help us materialise Serilahh
– A truly Malaysian Café which serves delicious, halal, Malaysian foods for a
purpose! 
A portion of the bill paid by each customer will aid two
projects; Mission Coffee – a microfinance programme that lends
start-up capital to families to run coffee cart businesses and to refurbish Tuk-Tuks in the Kingdom of Wonder – Siem Reap, Cambodia.
The most beautiful wonder in the world, the sunrise and sunset in Siem Reap Our Story
Hi everyone!
My name is Shabana, also known as Seri and this is our story. 
I used to live the Corporate Dream with a big salary and elevated social
status but after almost 11 years working in the field of Public Relations, I
decided to quit my job and change my life’s path. 
I did this because I realised that I was neither
pursuing my passion, nor was I growing as an individual or contributing beyond
myself in a meaningful way.
My ‘Eat-Pray-Play-Love’ journey to Siem Reap, Cambodia 

I knew I had more in me because I wanted to do more and contribute to
mankind in a meaningful way and this clarity was crystal clear to me when I was on an
‘Eat-Pray-Play-Love’ journey to Siem Reap, Cambodia after quitting my job in 2015.  During this journey, I volunteered at a local
NGO and chanced upon the idea of being a social entrepreneur.
Together
with my best friend – who’s been in the F&B business for many moons, the
idea of the first Malaysian Café in Siem Reap, Cambodia was conceived.  Since we both love Malaysian foods, we have
decided to showcase the many flavours of Malaysia to the communities and
travelers of Siem Reap.
It is during my volunteering days, I was inspired to do more here in Cambodia Great friendships forged with local and international NGOs

Celebrating monthly birthday with colleagues

Having a great time with my Cambodian family over a
delicious vegetarian mealThe name ‘Serilahh’
which is from the word ‘Seri’ came about when we had a brainstorming session
with our friends who lived around the globe. During the chat, the group was
inspired to take on my nickname, ‘Seri’.‘Seri’
simply means beautiful or beautiful and happy thoughts in the Malay language.
While lahh is a slang used by Malaysians, in which the particle ‘lah’ is used
at the end of a sentence to convey light-heartedness, politeness and a flexible
effect.Today, I live by the mantra, 'if it truly changed
your life, how could you not tell people about it and pay it forward?' Rather
than being caught
up in the rat race in the struggle for wealth or power, I’ve decided to focus
on my real priorities: health, relationships, passion, growth, and social
service.  Our campaign

hope to raise $30,000 for the creation
of our café and to ensure that it is fully operational to our customers by June
2016.

promotions: design; distribution; flyers; banners; hotel, high streets, Tuk-Tuk, airports and in-flight magazine

– Siem Reap, Cambodia.

story:
We are three moms, friends and health professionals who opened Mamarijum, the first Mom’s club in our city of Novi Sad and the region. 


The problems moms are facing and Mamarijum solves

In the city and the wider area there is not a space that is mother&baby friendly, a place where moms can spend time, take care of their babies, breast feed and change them, receive an adequate medical information, as well as give each other support and share experiences.  That is why we decided to solve this problem and founded Mamarijum three months ago using our own funds.


About the Club and its activities

Club’s interior is adapted to suit the needs of mothers with babies, with baby changing areas, comfortable armchairs, breastfeeding pillows, feeding chairs, cribs, a separated play area for crawling babies , as well as playing tables and chairs suitable for older children. 

While moms spend their time at Mamarijum they are provide with free coffee and tea.

For increased pleasant stay we also have books, a computer area and magazines. Besides providing a socializing space for moms, we organize various activities and educational programs run by our expert associates. 

For our pregnant ladies we have a program called Pregnant women academy conducted by the leader of La Le?e liga Serbia, a pediatrician a psychologist and a physiotherapist. The program contains supportive preparation for the delivery, breastfeeding school, psychologist and pediatrician workshops, as well as baby handling training. Pregnant women can also attend a prenatal yoga program led by a certified instructor.


For those young mothers who wish to provide the optimal psychomotor development for their babies,  which is of utmost importance in a baby’s first year of life and which prevents further spinal, feet, stature and self-esteem issues,  a developmental gymnastics program was developed. It is led by a physiotherapist with a rich experience of working with children and babies. We are equipped with all necessary items required for proper baby practice and mothers’ training with the aim of enabling them to continue the practice at their homes, as well.

We developed a postnatal recreational program for our members called Fitness Mamas. What is special about this program is that mothers can bring their babies along. Psychological counseling is run by a psychologist and it has a form of a lecture or workshop with the topics of special interest for moms. Those moms who may have a need for it can have an individual counseling, as well. 

We organized open type lectures on the most frequent health issues with children, as well as a training course on baby and child first aid, all led by a pediatrician. 



We are currently developing two new programs. The first one is Mom balance. It combines yoga and psychotherapy for moms who recently had babies and who need both psychological support and body recovery which are very important in such a sensitive period. The second one is Mental gymnastics. It focuses on developing fine motoric skills of young children, stimulates development of their intellectual potentials and emotional growth, while at the same time teaching the parents to teach their child how to learn through game and proper toy selection.

How do we see the future of Mamarijum? 

Our goal is to form a network of clubs in various quarters of Novi Sad and in the next three years in different cities of our region where we will provide adequate space and stimulative environment for pregnant women and mothers with babies and small children, as well as scientifically proven information and knowledge on various topics related to mental and physical health of mothers and children and parenthood in general.


Campaign goals

Regarding the fact that the three of us are financing everything by ourselves, at the same time mothers of 7 little children, and that the financial and economic conditions in our country are very adverse, your help is required in order for the club to keep functioning and be of assistance to all interested moms.  With your donations we could finance all club’s monthly expenses, as well as opening and furnishing of at least one more club, which would be a logical move since the interest is such that our current space is insufficient to accommodate all interested moms of Novi Sad. The expenses for opening of a new club and maintenance of the existing would be 20.000$. Help us provide a space for moms of our city, a place where they can smile, be happy and educated.

story:
We need a truck. You can help.

Who We Are

Upohar, meaning "gift" in Bengali, is a social impact restaurant and catering company in Lancaster, Pa., where customers can affordably dine on global cuisines,  celebrate the cultural heritage of our staff, and contribute to the lives of women who might otherwise fall through the cracks of our system.

We are a different kind of company, in that we have a social mission: we employ, train, and pay livable wages to people who experience significant barriers to workforce entry (such as newly resettled refugee women) and put them on a path to economic self-sufficiency.

Hear our story on NPR

Why a Truck?

Adding a food truck to our business will significantly expand our visibility and reach. It will allow us to take our distinctive food to our customers, participate in many more community events, and therefore create more jobs. 

What's the Challenge?

Each year Lancaster, Pa. receives hundreds of refugees, who have suffered unthinkable trauma in their home countries. In the US, their futures are bright if they can, within their first 90 days, communicate in their new language, find a home and a job, and enroll their children in school -- a tall order.

Our Solution

Upohar makes these significant life transitions easier. By providing employment and paying a decent wage, we build the self-esteem and skill set of refugee women, while simultaneously putting them on a path to economic self-sufficiency.

  • Training in the day-to-day operations of the business ensures that they will be employable even after they leave Upohar, creating lasting positive impact for our area.
  • Cooking and serving their national cuisine for the public reinforces that their culture is valued and welcomed here, and affords our customers an enticing and vital lens into our employees' rich cultures of origin
  • Mentoring our talented employees, we work to ensure that they become self-reliant, productive citizens, who contribute to the economy; are a vital, integrated part of our community; and are supported through a challenging life stage.

Our Impact To Date

In the past three years, Upohar employees have successfully found permanent jobs in other organizations based on the professional experience gained at Upohar, and gained economic stability.

  • One woman worked at Upohar part-time while she attended school to learn ESL and get certified as a teacher. She now works at the School District of Lancaster.
  • With the money she earned at Upohar, another employee saved enough within one year to move into a bigger apartment, and pay for her daughter’s medical tests so she could immigrate to the U.S. She was reunited with her daughter after being separated for more than 5 years. Read her story.

We intend to build on these successes and promote such outcomes for all of our employees. Here's how:

  1. Add a food truck to our business, to simplify catering, participate at many more events, and significantly expand our visibility and outreach
  2. Relocate downtown where foot traffic is greater, and extend our hours of operation
  3. Create 7 additional full-time jobs as a result of the downtown location and the food truck
  4. Implement these new jobs as paid apprenticeships to help people learn skills and gain professional experience, and become employable
  5. Place “graduates” in permanent jobs elsewhere, and open up apprenticeship positions for new people on a regular basis

We have found a truck to buy. We have found a downtown location to lease. And we have found organizations that are interested in working with us to implement the apprenticeship program. Now we need funding!

The Budget

First Goal: $35,000 for the Food Truck

Here's a breakdown of how the money will be spent:
  • Used truck: $10,000
  • Equipment and supplies: $6,000
  • Labor to refurbish: $10,000
  • Permits, insurance, etc.: $5,000
  • Wrap: $4,000
Once we meet this initial goal, we can roll out the Upohar food truck and a new phase of our business.

Additional Goals for Relocation
While the food truck makes its rounds, taking our global cuisine to you, we'll be working on building out our physical location. Here are the milestones:

Commercial Kitchen Equipment & Installation

An additional $30,000 will allow us to build out a fully equipped commercial kitchen. The location we have found needs a complete build-out. So we will build a commercial kitchen from scratch, and provide all the equipment (range, ovens, refrigerator and freezer, sinks, worktables, storage shelves)!

Restaurant Build-out

For about $40,000 more, we will be able to complete the buildout, and create a warm and welcoming space. Walls, floors, lights, furniture, decor, and signage are all included here. We want to create an environment that represents what we stand for, and a place that you'll want to come visit -- often!

Rewards!

A crowd-funding effort comes with perks. If you love food, if you love Lancaster, and you love Upohar, you'll love our "featured perk"at the $100 level -- this stylish limited-edition t-shirt designed by Modern Art:

We have other perks too -- something for every budget. For the complete line-up of all the rewards we are offering, please see right sidebar. 

Special Reward

If you can't contribute yourself, you can still help! 

We have created a special reward for the person who brings in the most contributions through their connections and campaigning efforts. The reward: an Upohar apron and a private cooking lesson. (We can do a lesson via skype if you're not local.)

So if you want to win this reward, be sure to create an IndieGoGo account and use their share tools.

Important Note

If you plan to contribute, please do so as soon as you can. 

IndieGoGo will give us the money as soon as we meet our first goal. So the sooner you give, the sooner we can get the food truck on the road! And the sooner we can move on to remodeling the restaurant and training apprentices to help them launch new careers.

In Conclusion

Thank you for reading this far. And thank you for your support to date. It is because of your belief in our mission, and your love of the food we serve, that we have been able to stay the course.

We hope you will consider investing in our future.

story:
"Your One-Stop Transformation Shop"

For the past year, I've had a clear vision that won't go away.  It's been screaming for attention and now I'm ready to share it with you.  How fantastic would it be to have a single location in St. Louis where you could find all the best transformational tools and practitioners, along with a community that supports you?  By "transformational", I mean life changing.  That's what the vision for Alchemy is all about - bringing yourself into alignment with the life you are meant to live.  Who doesn't want that?   -Michelle

Break-down

Start-up costs estimate at $200,000 to open the Alchemy Center.  Equipment makes up the majority of those costs.  This round of funding will go directly toward getting the building that will house the center.  (We've already got an eye on one!)

What you can expect to receive from your support:  services and experiences that are designed to create an impact in your health and wellbeing.

The Impact

  • Where else in St. Louis can you go to experience a float, infrared sauna, massage therapy, nutritional consulting, aromatherapy, coaching, meditation, and fun community classes?
  • Need to make a life change?  Looking for something "more"?  Want a way out of the stress cycle?  We are building a COMMUNITY that will embrace and support you in all aspects of wellbeing - body, mind, and spirit.  
  • The second passion that ignites this center is giving practitioners a healthy income.  Most people that consider themselves healers have so much focus on helping others, that they often neglect certain needs of their own.  We wanted to create a space where they can work fully from the heart, with no worries about finances and paperwork - where they can "come in and rock the job".
  • It's time for St. Louis to rise into its greatness.  We believe in the ripple effect caused by helping each client the best we can.

Risks & Challenges

While we fully believe in the manifestation of all that is needed to create this space, we also know that it is necessary to have a plan of action just in case.  If this round of funding does not meet the goal, we will continue with round 2.  If the goal for start-up costs doesn't succeed, we will scale back the scope of the start-up and instead phase into it incrementally.  If this is not possible, in-kind services will be offered for the value of your donation.  If this doesn't work for you, your contribution will be refunded.   

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out!  The more people that share this vision, the better.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Interested in joining the team or being a part of the community?  Reach out to us!
  • We are open to investors!

Michelle Edwards has 18 years experience in the wellness industry as a massage therapist, Reiki Master Teacher, former massage therapy and business instructor, and a personal development coach.
story_txt:
"Your One-Stop Transformation Shop" For the past year, I've had a clear vision that won't go away.  It's been screaming for attention and now I'm ready to share it with you.  How fantastic would it be to have a single location in St. Louis where you could find all the best transformational tools and practitioners, along with a community that supports you?  By "transformational", I mean life changing.  That's what the vision for Alchemy is all about - bringing yourself into alignment with the life you are meant to live.  Who doesn't want that?   -Michelle   Break-down Start-up costs estimate at $200,000 to open the Alchemy Center.  Equipment makes up the majority of those costs.  This round of funding will go directly toward getting the building that will house the center.  (We've already got an eye on one!)
What you can expect to receive from your support:  services and experiences that are designed to create an impact in your health and wellbeing.
The Impact
  Where else in St. Louis can you go to experience a float, infrared sauna, massage therapy, nutritional consulting, aromatherapy, coaching, meditation, and fun community classes?
Need to make a life change?  Looking for something "more"?  Want a way out of the stress cycle?  We are building a COMMUNITY that will embrace and support you in all aspects of wellbeing - body, mind, and spirit.   The second passion that ignites this center is giving practitioners a healthy income.  Most people that consider themselves healers have so much focus on helping others, that they often neglect certain needs of their own.  We wanted to create a space where they can work fully from the heart, with no worries about finances and paperwork - where they can "come in and rock the job".
It's time for St. Louis to rise into its greatness.  We believe in the ripple effect caused by helping each client the best we can.    Risks & Challenges
While we fully believe in the manifestation of all that is needed to create this space, we also know that it is necessary to have a plan of action just in case.  If this round of funding does not meet the goal, we will continue with round 2.  If the goal for start-up costs doesn't succeed, we will scale back the scope of the start-up and instead phase into it incrementally.  If this is not possible, in-kind services will be offered for the value of your donation.  If this doesn't work for you, your contribution will be refunded.      Other Ways You Can Help  Get the word out!  The more people that share this vision, the better. Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Interested in joining the team or being a part of the community?  Reach out to us!
We are open to investors!   Michelle Edwards has 18 years experience in the wellness industry as a massage therapist, Reiki Master Teacher, former massage therapy and business instructor, and a personal development coach.

story:
Short Summary

We are finishing setting up the store RIGHT NOW.  We will be having a soft opening July 12.  Clothes are hung, priced, and sized.  BUT, there are some upgrades that we really kind of need....so we are raising funds to get them asap! The store is located on Main St, right next door to Briar Rose Bakery.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for funding for some upgrades to the store.  Specifically, we think our customers would like shopping carts, (better) fitting rooms, fans in the fitting rooms, REAL shoe racks, and a huge awesome sign out front.  Many thrift stores don't have any of those things, but we want them. 

For $5 you get a voucher for any 1 item, regardless of price. 
For $10 you get 3 vouchers for any 1 item, regardless of price.
For $15 you get a coupon for 10% off EVERY PURCHASE FOR A YEAR!!!
For $100 you get 30 vouchers for any 1 item & a coupon for 10% off EVERY PURCHASE FOR A YEAR


 

Impact

The store benefits the community in several ways. 

1.  Provides plus sized people an alternative to shopping online (because honestly, you have to try stuff on.  Or at least see it in person.  Online shopping for plus sizes is over emphasized.  We need more LOCAL shopping!)
2.  Keeps perfectly good clothing out of landfills and trash bins. 
3.  Makes the overall community more attractive to look at (ok, that one might be stretching it).
4.  Creates jobs.
5. Increases sales taxes for the City of Farmington and Washington County.
6.  Locally owned, so all of the money flows back into NWA.
7.  We aren't even going to mention how helpful AFFORDABLE clothing can be. 

Risks & Challenges

We have a few minor risks (like everyone suddenly losing weight or becoming a nudist), but we do have some serious challenges. 

1.  Reaching our customers and letting them know the store exists.  We are targeting a wide, rural area.  
2.  Getting enough size XL customers to shop.  The biggest portion of our market is size 14-18, but they are harder to get since they don't "have" to shop at a plus size store.  We have to change their thinking to that they "get" to shop with us.
3.  Battling the stigma of the words "Plus Size."  Many women equate plus size to fat, and just telling them the store exists is taken as an insult. 

We think that we are up to the task, but we believe in full disclosure. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is great, but there are other ways to help. PLEASE share this campaign with your friends and family (and enemies, we don't care) who live around Farmington!  We want everyone to know that the new store exists!

story:
Our goal is to raise $10,000 to test, and manufacture a new flavor with the purpose of feeding families in need, and by providing basic essentials for families in need throughout the year. We have already completed the packaging design, and the first round of formulation for the new flavor. We are excited to use a simple idea to make a positive change in the world. 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

 

Why NeatCheeks? NeatCheeks are Mom-Invented, and were thoughtfully created for a child’s face.  NeatCheeks are the only wipes in the world that are sweetened and flavored with Stevia to give face wiping a FUN and pleasant experience to children of all ages. Unlike typical wipes that leave a yucky taste and residue on your child’s lips, NeatCheeks are natural, sweetened, and flavored to give a more pleasant experience.

Are they sticky? No, NeatCheeks are sweetened and flavored with Stevia. Stevia is derived from a natural plant extract. Stevia is non-sticky, highly moisturizing, and has many health and skin benefits.

Are they natural? Yes, we only use high quality, natural ingredients.

What are the ingredients? Patent- Pending- Stevia Rebaudiana Extract (Stevia extract is a naturally occurring plant extract used as a sweetener for flavoring, and moisturizing), Purified Water, Glycerin (Glycerin is an excellent humectant, retains and preserves moisture, and acts as a moisturizer), Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice (Moisturizer), Lonicera Caprifolium Flower Extract and Lonicera Japonica Flower Extract, Dutch Honeysuckle or Lonicera Caprifolium (has excellent cleansing properties and is employed extensively in cleaners and soaps. It is believed to provide toning benefits to the skin). Lonicera Japonica (Honeysuckle) Flower Extract Japanese Honeysuckle extract (a mild, naturally derived, biodegradable, broad spectrum anti-microbial agent), Sodium Lauryglucosides Hydroxypropyl Sulfonate (a naturally derived, sulfate-free cleansing agent. Due to its natural origin, this surfactant is very gentle and readily biodegradable. It is used in products for babies and individuals with sensitive skin), Potassium Sorbate (a food grade anti-microbial agent), Citric Acid (used to optimize the pH of a formulation as well as help refine and renew skin texture).

Do they contain alcohol? No, alcohol is harsh on the skin and can especially be an irritant to sensitive skin. NeatCheeks are alcohol free.

Are they fragranced? No, unlike other wipes in the market, NeatCheeks are fragrance free. Neatcheeks are sweetened and flavored with Stevia to give a sweet pleasant experience when wiping or cleaning a child’s face. Our "Just Peachy" and "Berry Lemonade" flavor will have a mild scent from the natural food flavoring.

Where are they manufactured? NeatCheeks are proudly made in the U.S.A, currently manufactured in California

Where do you ship? We ship NeatCheeks worldwide- FREE Shipping for domestic orders in the U.S, and subsidized shipping for international orders.

Where can I buy NeatCheeks? You will receive our "Just Peachy" NeatCheeks immediately when you donate to our Indiegogo campaign. NeatCheeks are currently being sold nationwide at select Target stores, Buy-Buy Baby, Toys R’ Us, Babies R’ Us, and Kroger.

How can I support the NeatCheeks mission? Our goal is to provide over 100,000 meals, and with your support we can achieve that goal. You can support us by purchasing a reward, and spreading the word with your friends, family, co-workers, and on social media!! Sharing our story and posting pictures using NeatCheeks on social media helps us reach more people and ultimately feed more children, and provide for those in need.

What organization are you giving to? We are honored to partner with Baby2Baby to provide Meals to children in need, as well as some of the proceeds will provide basic necessities.  Baby2Baby found that 1 out of 3 Moms has had to choose between giving their babies diapers or food. We want to help Baby2Baby put a stop to hunger, and families not having the basic necessities to live.

Why is Jaime King interested in helping? Jaime King stumbled upon NeatCheeks one day when she ran out of make-up wipes.  After using them on her own skin for a while, she realized they made her skin glow. Jaime King says, “As a mother, a humanist, and a supporter of my favorite homegrown company NeatCheeks, who with great loving and fun created a product that made my life and other families so much easier with their wonderful wipes. I am beyond overjoyed to partner and put all my heart behind this campaign partnering NeatCheeks and Baby2Baby one of the country’s greatest non-profits that has provided essentials to families on local levels with unprecedented care and results." She believes in both organizations so much, she wants to help make a positive difference.

Do you have questions?  Please e-mail smile@neatcheeks.com with any questions you may have in regards to our product, or the Indiegogo campaign.  Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

The Ofyz project is a not-for-profit initiative with the aim of helping avoid a repeat of the global economic crisis. The team have built a platform that provides a free, transparent and unbiased view of the creditworthiness of companies, financial institutions and sovereign states across the globe.  See www.ofyz.com.

Ofyz Ratings will appeal to all those who have a financial or societal interest in helping to avoid a repeat of the 2008 global economic crisis.

The rationale behind the project

The site aims to contribute to the efficiency and transparency of the credit markets in the manner prescribed by the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA).

The Ofyz business model is that of sourcing credit ratings from the investment community and having the community assess the quality of each rating through feedback scores.  Ratings are neither paid for by the credit taker nor the credit provider.

There are a number of flaws in the existing credit rating world that are addressed by Ofyz Ratings. Primary amongst these are:

-  conflict of interest: Existing credit rating agencies make their profit by charging the credit taker, the object of the risk analysis. This model is clearly biased;

-  failure of mathematical models: Existing agencies use mainly historical data. Ofyz seeks to use actual and forward looking data on top of historical data by integrating the outlooks from its raters and other financial professionals into the equation.

What we need

For the site to be credible, it is is essential that the global business community is aware of and makes use of the site.  Ofyz needs sufficient funding to achieve critical mass by:
- applying for certification in accordance with Regulation (EC) No 1060/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 September 2009 on credit rating agencies (the Credit Rating Agencies Regulation);
- organising a seminar on open source credit ratings in the 'B. Amsterdam' start-up hub;

-  purchasing marketing software tools and undertaking growth hacking initiatives focused on specialists likely to be interested in helping to use and/or promote Ofyz.

The team

The team, all of whom are providing their development and design services without charge, includes a manager at a major accountancy firm who deals with credit risk on a daily basis, an experienced director who provides consultancy and training on financial strategy and a senior functionary at the European Commission.

Risks and challenges

For Ofyz to be successful, it needs a critical mass of raters and ratings. The credibility of its ratings is dependent on there being a sufficient volume of participants. Increasing the awareness of the website is the goal of this funding request.

Protections are being built into the website to avoid the risk of abuse of the site by entities trying to affect their own rating.

Other Ways You Can Help

For this project to succeed, it is essential that the community becomes aware of its existence and contributes to the website's database.  Please help us by spreading the word to all your own contacts.

story:
WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

Help us to raise the funds we need to expand our business, buy in more bulk, and get some more helping hands. We have grown so quickly over our first 2 years of business that we need more hands and more space. We never could have predicted that our toffee would be this popular, but expansion is an issue we are pleased to address! 

FUNDING GOALS

$5,000

1 employee + New Packaging

The bare minimum that we need in funding in order to grow our brand. New packaging allows us to expand into new markets, and extra help will increase the speed of production.

$15,000

2 employees + Expanded Distribution + Nutrition / Shelf Life Analysis

2 employees means deliveries AND kitchen help. And covers the extra cost of self-distribution while we expand, until we can get into a specialty food distributor. 

$75,000

1 year lease of Private Kitchen w/ Retail Space in front

Boost our sales and get rid of hourly rate on kitchen usage, which is really expensive. Although toffee doesn’t require fancy equipment, it does take time… a lot of time. 


In return you get some awesome merchandise, or toffee.... or both! Not to mention the chance for some Indiegogo Exclusive offers.

We are very confident that having a space will immensely increase our sales, and allow us to connect with our local community in a more meaningful way, while also catering to local businesses for all their candy needs.

We are ALL IN, and want to continue to make your favorite toffees all year round, 24/7, 365. I have thrown my entire life savings of $10,000, as well as all the money i have invested so far to build this venture, and we need you to help with the rest.

**As a side note, this funding is now doubly important, because on the way to a Shark Tank Open Audition in Las Vegas, the toffee mobile died and had to be buried in the desert ( it was really scrapped lol). Although we have since got a new, more gas efficient toffee mobile, our insurance will not cover this, and we are out thousands of much needed dollars.

The Toffee, The Tale, The LEGEND

Heavenly Taste Toffee is a family tradition spanning three generations. Invented by my grandmother and taught to me by my mother, this special holiday treat has been a guarded secret for years. It only existed for 2 months of the year for family and friends.

Enough of our friends said we could make money selling it, so guess what we did? We started as a small booth at the San Ramon local farmer's market, and quickly grew into a wholesale distributor that services 20 stores around the Bay Area, including:

 18 Whole Foods Markets

 Overstock.com

2 Draeger's Supermarkets

C&J Cox Family Stores  (Local Gas Station Chain)

Now we get people contacting us from all over out of the blue with referrals from friends or family members who shared their toffee (not an easy task). We also attend at least 1-2 events per month in order to show off our stuff, meet people face to face, and have some good old fashioned fun :)

We partner with local businesses to supply our chocolates during festivals and private events, and have even done a corporate event for Intel! 

We are making 96 lb batches at a time now, and couldn't be happier with all this new excitement!

Please help us to take that next step, and we will make sure you have plenty of toffee for years and years and years. 

Heavenly Taste Toffee isn't just candy.... it's a tradition.
