Flavors
      
       Black & White                 Butterscotch Pecan                  Coconut Macadamia
      
          Espresso Biscotti           Milk Chocolate Almond              Pumpkin Pie
   
                                    Cherry Pistachio            Dark Chocolate Almond

story:
Short Summary

Every month new breweries are popping up all over New England, but yet not one brewery is servicing the people of Quincy directly.  It is unfathomable that a city so rich in history and bursting with potential has been left untapped in the boom of craft breweries.  Our dream is to change that and bring a nanobrewery into the heart of Quincy and provide the people of Quincy a place to call their own.  A taproom intended to serve the community, the people who work here, and the people who visit this historic city.


Why support Widowmaker Brewing?

We are passionate about making great beer.  From day one of Widowmaker's inception our goal has been clear and simple, make great beer and share it with those who wish to share it with us.   

The craft beer world has exploded, everyone wants to try the newest brewery or style of beer they can get in their hands.  People want to drink fresh beer from local brewers made by local ingredients.  This is an experience that the people of Quincy have not had the opportunity to experience.  

You don't have to be paying a great deal of attention to understand the craft beer market is exploding with possiblities.  However for those not paying attention to the development of Quincy it may come as a surprise that Quincy is on a major upswing.  A younger community is flooding Quincy Center and the need for local entertainment, food, and drink is paramount.  Of course we want our potential customers to come in with their growlers and fill up on our latest offerings but how great does it sound to have a place where you can get a couple locally crafted beers before hitting Fat Cat for their world class Mac & Cheese, Alba for perfectly cooked steak, or the great new addition to Quincy Center The Townshend.   Quincy has such potential, it can be so much more than a place to catch the Red Line and jump into the city... help us become part of the rich fabric of Quincy!

  • Our goal of $20,000 will go a long way into helping us secure the needed funds it takes to open a start up nano brewery.  We do not take any person willing to assist us for granted, we are a hard working group with a focused vision.  Your willingness to support Widowmaker Brewing is viewed as challenge we are prepared to meet and exceed.  
  • When we initially thought about what we should offer as donation gifts we obviously thought of tangible gifts like shirts, bottle openers, and pint glasses... really cool stuff to show your support.  We also wanted to add bigger picture things that will not only memorialize your support but really make you feel part of the Widowmaker family.  Something like naming a beer that we put on tap for purchase is very important to us.  We want our beers to represent us and our community in its taste but also its name. Our Pale Ale is a perfect example, we call it Greenbush.  For the locals reading this the Greenbush Commuter Rail may be how you commute into the city or for some their weekday alarm clock.  For the founders of Widowmaker Brewing the Greenbush line runs pretty extreamly close to where we all live throughout the South Shore so it was natural name for a beer we see as our flagship Pale Ale.  We are really excited about all the gifts and we hope you are too!

Risks & Challenges

Like all ventures there are risks, and if you're one of our wives/fiances you have been happy to point them all out to us!  When opening a brewery there are many hurdles, red tape, and a lot of waiting.  A lot of times issues are out of your hands and you will be at the mercy other people and organizations.  There are building issues, permit issues, licensing issues... and all that comes before the simple question: Is your beer good?  It is! 

With all that said we have meet with people from the city of Quincy and other influential people in the community and they have been very supportive.  We are developing a strong network of people who agree Quincy needs a brewery.  The city wants businesses like Widowmaker Brewing to be part of their growth. 

There will be hard times along the way and when we fulfill our goal of opening a brewery we will surely realize the difficult issues we faced were the tip of the iceberg in navigating our way to success... and we can't wait for the challenge!


Spread the word about Widowmaker Brewing

If a monetary donation is not an option please share it with people who you think it may.  We appreciate anyone who took the time to  read our story and our goals.
story_txt:

story:
A Map to You Art|Shop Artisanal Trading Post & Exhibition is a shop, gallery & platform provided to some of Los Angeles' most gifted artists, textile artists, craftsmen, and handmade vendors. Its a space which allows our local residents to get exposed to innovative and affordable art, creative and diverse perspectives, and to shop uniquely handmade artful items. In addition, this is also a platform of advocacy for those who have the courage to live out their creative visions and dreams, as well as extending that courage into their livelihoods and sharing it with our local community members of Leimert Park. 

Our goal with our shop & arts advocacy collective is to:

  • Build a strong network of artists who will support each other and our collaborative endeavors and project oriented goals. 

  • To actively advocate for artists from under-represented communities to continue their craft while sustaining a viable income.

  • to encourage art itself to be used as a powerful tool for social commentary. 

  • And to help preserve the creative and artistic legacy of the Leimert Park Village as it undergoes substantial community development and changes.

We ask that you support us as we renovate the store itself and prepare for our shop's launch date August 2nd, where we hope to invite all of our supporters and community members to enjoy and partake in our grand opening this summer.

story:
#PrayForPeace

The "pray for Paris" symbol created by Jean Jullien in the wake of the Parisian attacks is one that has been adopted so quickly, which we'd like to spread as a sign of global solidarity, hence the slight adaptation with its associated hashtag: #prayforpeace . 

Many people don't realise how many similar attacks are happening in other countries equally affected by terrorists and similar despicable catastrophes. Share the symbol and show your support.


Why are we doing this?

Because we care, and because we can.

We're familiar with crowdfunding, and mobile tech is our market, so we're proposing donations in return for #prayforpeace mobile phone covers.

Why phone covers? Well, they're easy, accessible, and can be seen everywhere you go. A simple yet effective way to show solidarity and fraternity to all.

Phone models to launch:

We're focusing on launching for the three top-selling phones of 2016, being the iPhone 6, Samsung Galaxy S6, HTC ONE M9. We hope to launch many more models depending on the success of the campaign, so please do let us know and we'll do out best to accommodator for everyone.


Open your eyes...

In the wake of the Paris terror attacks, discussion over terrorism and the correct response to such a tragedy has already begun.

Multiple attacks perpetrated by Isis across the French capital on Friday night have so far claimed the lives of 129 people, with more than 340 injured and many remaining in critical conditions.

But, while utterly horrific, one journalist has pointed out the terror organisation – also known as the Islamic State – has killed far more Muslims than Christians, Westerners, or minorities during its existence.

read more: most of the victims are Muslims

read more about the disasters is Pairs

read more about attacks in Lebanon

read more about Turkey

read more about victims in Syria where 140 civilians were killed in Kobani, after firing indiscriminately at "everything that moved"


Who benefits?

This campaign launches in support of charities and organisations such as Médecins Sans Frontières (Doctors Without Borders). As a non-discriminatory organisation which acts in areas of conflict, and first responders to global tragedies; an honourable cause which will benefit victims of various disasters all over the world.

Where they work:


So, what's our plan?

Ultimately, to further the symbol created in the wake of the recent Parisian attacks, but moreover, increasing awareness of other recent disasters that haven't received similar media attention. These attacks are global and are not contained by religion or beliefs. 
The perks are designed to carry Jean Julien's symbol around the world. The more traction we can achieve, the more we can offer in terms of phone compatibility and perks. Benefits going towards Doctors Without Borders, but we'd also like to consider other organisations, so please do let us know what you think, and who else could benefit.

story:
The Moken are the last indigenous sea nomads who have spent their entire lives on the waves up until “yesterday”.  

Today they are forcefully placed in settlements on land, and have no means to continue a livelihood on their traditional Kabang boats. The children are no longer learning the ancient wisdom of living as one with the ocean.

By providing a vessel on which some Moken once again can make a living on the sea, we can all benefit from their knowledge in our modern day challenges of ocean pollution. 


The Project Moken Team consists of a mix of Moken and people from a variety of different cultures. Read more about us here: http://projectmoken.com/the-team

--------------------


Some time after the Tsunami hit the Mergui Archipelago off the west coast of Myanmar (Burma) and south Thailand, filmmaker Runar J. Wiik made an astonishing discovery: The Moken Sea Nomads had kept their ancient secrets of how to live an entire life on the ocean, a lifestyle believed to have vanished in our modern times. But in the inaccessable islands of the Andaman sea, this unique culture had survived. 

Now, more than a decade later, Runar has made several films with the Moken, started an organisation (Project Moken) and found a way to help the Moken get back out onto the waves (Project MAP). Through Runar's work with the Moken we can all benefit from the vast knowledge of the ocean and its ecosystems embedded in the Moken culture for thousands of years. But this winter something devastating happened; the key to Project Moken's past and future success - the Vanya Catamaran, sunk during a Typhoon. 

Having alreday mortgaged his house to ensure Project Moken's future endeavors, the expense of restoring the Vanya Catamaran on top of all the other activities to help make sure we don't loose the Moken knowledge, may crumble next years efforts. And the Moken, now forcefully stuck in slum villages both in Myanmar and Thailand, will not be back on their beloved ocean. More elders will die before their knowledge can be passed on to the younger generations. 

By contributing to make sure the Moken can get back on the waves, you will be part of a unique project which uses ancient knowledge to save the coral reefs and marine ecosystems in our modern times. Read more about one of Project Moken’s future projects here:

http://www.projectmoken.com/project/project-m-a-p-moken-against-plastic/

What We Need & What You Get

Project Moken has been run and funded by Runar and his film projects about the Moken since 2006. First we needed to make sure that the world knew that the Moken knowledge of living on and in the ocean had not vanished with the rest of the crippled marine nomadic cutures, and thanks to our films' numerous awards and special screenings in everything from villages to royal quarters and the UN, to the web-based outreach projects, - this goal has been achieved. 

Unfortunately however, the living conditions of the Moken in the Mergui Archipelago has only gotten worse. Without being able to live on their beloved waves, the elders are dying and the future for the young seems hopeless. This is why Runar wants, yet again, to aid the Moken in their wish to feed their children from marine activities once again, and this he wants to do by enabling them to take part in the much needed coral rejuvenation and plastic clean-up initiatives. 

Some of the most remote islands on the planet - the Moken realm - is being destroyed by plastic and un-ethical over-fishing with dynamite and poison. With Project Moken's  Vanya Catamaran as the mother-ship of a small fleet of Moken canoes, the eco-tourist initiatives in the areas will sponsor the Moken for the first time, and ensure a sustainable lifestyle for them back on the waves. 

But everything stops without the Vanya Catamaran. Because of her unique re-design she is currently the only boat the Moken can use for this purpose. The support you give us now, will go directly to fixing the Vanya Catamaran. The work will be done by Moken from Mu Koh Surin at the Chaipattana marine workshop in the mangroves outside Kuraburi in the Phang Nga region on the border between Myanmar and south Thailand, so all contributions will sustain Moken from day one. And the Vanya Catamaran will become like their own traditional Kabang boats before sailing out to launch the Project MAP initiatives. We will proceed regardless of how much this campaign raises, but the process will be prolonged until we've gathered what is needed. The USD 42000,- will make the Vanya Catamaran ready to sail. As shown in the making of film "Kindred Spirits" and the film for this campaign, we have done this before, and can calculate our costs very accurately.

Based on all the previous work, and the nature of the fantastic Moken culture, we can offer some of the best perks in return for your contribution. You get the films, credits on our next film projects, unique Moken artisan work, training in Moken freediving with a certified instructor, and you are invited to join us on a voyage into the paradise island realm of the Moken. In addition, every contributor has a shot at receiving the top perk of voyaging in the Mergui Archipelago with the Moken, since at the end of the campaign we will randomly pick a contributor regardless of the size of the contribution, to receive the USD 5000,- perk!

To read more about our perks - please follow these links:

Moken Artisan perks: http://www.projectmoken.com/?p=1871

Top Perks: http://www.projectmoken.com/?p=1845

The Impact

When Runar travelled back to one of the off-limit military controlled villages in the Mergui Archipelago last year, he wanted to say hello to some of his friends from making the film "No Word for Worry" two years prior. What he discovered was that since then, two of the people whom had helped with the filming from the village had taken their own lives with dynamite obtained from the fishing industry. Asking why, Runar was told that they had seen no hope for the future. That is when he decided to help make sure the Moken can back on the waves. 

Most other organisations involved with Moken focus on helping them with the challenges of surviving the village life forced upon them by the modern world, but Runar tries to create a way to feed their children and stay healthy by living on the ocean again. The Moken need the ocean lifestyle to preserve their unique knowledge of the sea, and this in turn is something we all need in the tasks ahead of saving the oceans from ourselves. The Moken need the ocean lifestyle to lead meaningful lives. Now their health, both physically and mentally, is dwindling. 

When the Vanya Catamaran can bring the Moken back to their original realm, and Project Moken can continue working on an international level, the beginning of a sustainable future for the Moken, our ocean, and ultimately ourselves, will be possible.You will be part of some of todays most valuable efforts in our collective human initiatives to right some of the wrongs we have caused this planet. We need to heal to survive.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many other ways of helping us reach our goals. 

If you are unable to contribute to this campaign, please consider some of the following: 

- Learn more about the Moken through Project Moken and join our newsletter

- Sign our "One Tree Can Save A Culture" campaign

- Watch our award-winning feature Documentary

- Like our Facebook and Twitter pages (projectmoken)

- Help us SPREAD THIS CAMPAIGN through the various share tools!

Thank you!

If you have any questions, we would love to hear from you:

info@projectmoken.com

story:
Water4happiness es un movimiento que nace con el objetivo de llevar acceso al agua potable a las personas que más lo necesitan.

En México, más de 12 millones de personas no tienen acceso al agua potable y las enfermedades gastrointestinales derivadas de beber agua contaminada sigue siendo una de las principales causas de muerte en niños menores de 5 años.

El acceso al AGUA POTABLE es esencial para llevar una vida digna y de respeto a los derechos humanos.

Queremos que todas las personas en México y el mundo cuenten con los servicios básicos de abasto, purificación y disposición de agua adecuados y que al despreocuparse de cubrir estas necesidades básicas puedan desarrollar su máximo potencial.

Agua de calidad significa Felicidad.

El movimiento water4happiness está creciendo, hemos visto que cada día más y más personas como tú se  suman a dar solución a éste problema.

Por esto creamos "Happiness", Agua de lluvia, alcalina, antioxidante, libre de cloro, baja en sodio en una botella oxobiodegradable. 

Cada vez que tomas "Happiness" estas ayudando a una comunidad a tener acceso a agua limpia y segura, ya que 100% de la utilidad será destinado a proyectos de abasto del líquido vital en las comunidades que más lo necesitan, 

El movimiento water4happiness cree en la TRANSPARENCIA, por eso queremos que seas testigo de las acciones realizadas con los fondos recaudados de la venta de la botella de agua Happiness; cada botella tendrá un código QR que te permitirá conocer a las familias que estás beneficiando con el proyecto mensual.

Para esto creamos una App que podrás descargar en tu celular, en donde podrás llevar un conteo de las botellas de happiness consumidas, compartirlo en tus redes sociales y ser testimonio del impacto en las comunidades atendidas,

IMPACTO

Con tu apoyo en esta preventa de "Happiness" lograremos hacer más grande este movimiento y llegar a más personas que lo necesitan.

El dinero recaudado durante la preventa, será destinado a la construcción de la embotelladora, dentro de las recompensas está la inclusión de tu nombre en la placa conmemorativa del Recinto, boletos para la fiesta water4happiness, producto gratis y regalos w4h.

Recibirás tus botella de Happiness, aún si no se logra la meta total.

POR QUE...

El acceso al agua potable es esencial para llevar una vida digna y de respeto a los derechos humanos.

La falta de agua potable impacta de manera significativa en la salud, educación, productividad, equidad de género, cohesión social, seguridad e integración familiar.

Water4happiness A. C. orienta sus proyectos para que el recurso hídrico esté disponible, sea accesible, seguro, aceptable y asequible para todos, sin discriminación.

Desde su nacimiento, water4happiness ha tenido intervenciones en algunos estados de la República Mexicana (Puebla, Hidalgo, Oaxaca, Chiapas, Estado de México, Guerrero y Veracruz).

Las intervenciones de water4happiness tienen un abordaje del problema desde una perspectiva INTEGRAL e INTEGRADORA, que contempla los aspectos: Biológicos, Psicológicos y Sociales de las comunidades.

DESAFIOS

El problema es grande, pero las ganas de resolverlo son aún más grandes.

Súmate al movimiento Water4happiness.

Toma Agua, Dona Agua


Ayúdanos a difundir esta campaña en tus redes sociales.

Water4happiness
story_txt:
Water4happiness es un movimiento que
nace con el objetivo de llevar acceso al agua potable a las personas que más lo
necesitan.
En México, más de 12 millones de personas no tienen acceso al agua
potable y las enfermedades gastrointestinales derivadas de beber agua
contaminada sigue siendo una de las principales causas de muerte en niños
menores de 5 años.
El acceso al AGUA POTABLE es esencial para llevar una vida digna y de
respeto a los derechos humanos.
Queremos que todas las personas en México y el mundo cuenten con los
servicios básicos de abasto, purificación y disposición de agua adecuados y
que al despreocuparse de cubrir estas necesidades básicas puedan desarrollar su
máximo potencial.
Agua de calidad significa Felicidad.
El movimiento water4happiness está creciendo, hemos visto que
cada día más y más personas como tú se  suman a dar solución a éste
problema.
Por esto creamos "Happiness", Agua de lluvia, alcalina,
antioxidante, libre de cloro, baja en sodio en una botella
oxobiodegradable. 
Cada vez que tomas "Happiness" estas ayudando a una comunidad
a tener acceso a agua limpia y segura, ya que 100% de la utilidad será
destinado a proyectos de abasto del líquido vital en las comunidades que más lo

desde una perspectiva INTEGRAL e INTEGRADORA, que contempla los aspectos:

story:
We have developed Arisone Doc - the future of Homecare

A complete, user friendly and professional tool for loved ones to have access to your care records - while still ensuring the highest security of your personal information.

Your well-being and safety remains important to those close to you. You want you to be able to remain in your own home where you are comfortable. You also understand that you need a caregiver that can ensure that you remain safe and well taken care of.

You and your relatives have high expectations for the company you choose to care for you.  

  •  We want to ensure that the caregivers are reliable, reputable, and attentive to your wants and needs, and of course,
  • continuity of the same caregiver. 
  • That communication with the caregiver and the management team is exceptional, and well informed with regular updates, 
  • assurance that confidential information is kept secure at all times, and of course 
  • the ability to be involved in the care.


Our caregivers are trained by our knowledgeable and experienced management team. All of our caregivers receive customized training determined by the specific needs of the clients they are caring for. Our caregivers are also required to participate in ongoing training to ensure their skills are kept up to date.

They are subject to criminal background checks and drug screenings. We have a zero tolerance drug policy that includes marijuana. 

l of our caregiver’s wear uniforms and are provided with a care kit that include a laptop, gloves, booties, a First aid kit, and a GPS Tracker.

Each caregiver has their own Dockey – a thumb drive used to access Arisone Doc. Each Dockey is imbedded with the caregiver’s identification to ensure that there is no unauthorized access to Arisone Doc.

Family members involved in the care of their loved one will also be offered a Dockey that will allow them to access Arisone Doc from, any computer and follow the daily notes entered by the caregiver.


We strive to have a minimal number of caregivers assigned to each client. We work very hard to avoid the revolving door of caregivers that is so common in home care. We are instead creating a “team of caregivers” who are responsible for the care of one client. We stay for at least 3 hours each visit.


Arisone Doc allows for messages to be sent from loved ones directly to the caregivers and/ or manager. If you would like to get in touch with the manager, you have the ability to send a message. The manager will be alerted on their smart phone immediately, allowing for a prompt response.

The client’s service plan is designed to ensure that both their needs and wants are met. Each service plan can be customized to specify the procedure in which the task is to be completed.

We view the service plan as the “beating heart” of the care that we provide. We believe, in order to create the best service plan, that both the client and their loved ones should be involved.   If they are separated by distance, we also offer case conference using a secure video chat. 

Before an update is made to the service plan loved ones will receive an alert on their smart phone indicating a change is needed


You can assure that the caregiver was at your loved one’s residence through our GPS tracking system, which is built into Arisone Doc. The GPS tracker is attached to the care-kit. The GPS signal, in addition to the client’s signature in Arisone Doc will confirm that the caregiver was present.

Arisone Doc is also offering those involved in care of their loved one a platform of e-learning covering different diseases, possible symptoms, as well as suggestions to assist those involved cope with the physical and behavioural effects of the disease.


Security and confidentiality is our highest priority. Arisone Doc protects all information against unauthorized access, offering complete confidence that personal information is secure. Arisone Doc can only be accessed using the Dockey and a personal password.  The security is similar to a debit or credit card.


Arisone possesses the finest personal and technical security the world has to offer.* 

 In addition to our first-class security features, we have also built a revolutionary architecture that allows you, as a customer, to choose who gets what information. We grant you access to all of your documentation, and give you the ability to grant access to those that you trust and wish to share this information with. 

 You can actively communicate with the care team and view up-to-date care notes and notifications whenever it is convenient for you. We give you the control to view and manage your documentation on your own computer. 

  • Architecture – An structure and flow that really works. Based on professional experience and user feedback over more than 20 years. 
  •  Replication– Your information will always be safe in several physical locations simultaneously. We do not rely on a single server to store all of our customer’s information. 
  • Encryption – Our advanced level of encryption makes it virtually impossible to illegally access your personal information.

*Safety and Simplicity by Torgny Wennemyr, 2015

2012         - A Survey in USA about Homecare and Home Healthcare

2013        - The Concept was introduced

2014 Jun - We applied for Homecare, Class B License, in Colorado

2014 Dec - We received the Homecare, Class B License, in Colorado

2015 Jan - Our first customer!

2015 Sep - We got introduced to Crowdfunding

2015 Dec - We launched the project on Indiegogo

2016 Jan -  Project funded!

2016 Mar - “Shipping” to Backers

2016 Dec - Our first franchise sold in the Greater Denver Area

2017          - Expansion to other States and Internationally 

If our project get well funded, we will continue to develop the Home Healthcare part of the concept and the online shop with tools to make life more independent for our loved ones.


Our Caregivers

  • Provided with Carekits including laptops and uniforms 
  • Zero tolerance to drugs including marijuana and no-smoking during shifts
  • Training; in-house, customized and on-going

Continuity

  • A minimal number of caregivers
  • We are creating a “team of caregivers”
  • At least 3 hours each visit


Communication

  • As a family member, you can read daily notes made by the caregiver, where ever you are
  • Communicate / send messages to caregiver and Manager


Part of the Care

  • Service plan – “the beating heart” of the care
  • Case conferences, using a secure video chat, if you are not able to be there in person
  • Before an update is made to the service plan you will receive an alert on your smart phone 


Tracking & Safety

  • The GPS signal, in addition to the client’s signature in Arisone Doc will confirm that the caregiver was present
  • You will be able to review the tracking


Understanding

  • E-learning, covering different diseases and symptoms for family members


Security & Confidentiality

  • Our highest priority: Security and confidentiality
  • Can only be accessed using the Dockey and a personal password
  • Security -similar to a debit or credit card


The passion of Arisone's founder, Anna Nadmyr - a licensed Registered Nurse for 20+ years in her home country of Sweden - has led to the creation of this unique, consistent and compassionate homecare concept.


Together, we are an International team with decades of knowledge. We have extensive experience in the home care, home health, and information technology industries.


We have the experience, skills, and tools needed to connect the “missing link”. We are committed to make a difference in the Homecare Industry!



$12 

A HUGE THANK YOU!   We really appreciate your support. 

  • You will receive our updates about the project.

Estimated delivery: Feb 2016

_________________________________________________________

$62

A HUGE THANK YOU!  We really appreciate your support.   

  • You will receive our updates about the project.
  • We'll put your name on our Wall of Thank You.

Estimated delivery: Feb 2016

_________________________________________________________

$125

A HUGE THANK YOU!   We really appreciate your support.

  • You will receive our updates about the project.
  • We'll put your name on our Wall of Thank You.
  • You will receive an electronic Diploma, signed by the Team, always remembered.

Estimated delivery: Feb 2016

_________________________________________________________

$250       

A HUGE THANK YOU! We really appreciate your support

  • You will receive updates about the project.
  • We'll put your name on our Wall of Thank You
  • You will receive an electronic Diploma, signed by the Team, always remembered.
  • We'll put Your Name on our Software Arisone Doc´s, first page as a Supporter to Arisone Doc, always remembered. 

 Estimated delivery: Feb 2016

Please, support our project and help us get up and running in 2016. Our goal is to build Arisone in to a franchise that will allow more individuals to access this opportunity.


Risks and challenges

There are no direct risks associated with the project.
The team has been running the business for a while.
The funding will help to implement even more advanced technologies and speed up the process to get the concept franchised.
However, there are always risks, i.e. if someone in the team will gets disabled to continue, the work will be postponed. We are dependent on governmental regulations and if regulations are not “aligned with reality”, it might take time to adjust the concept.

story:
" HOW IS THE MONGOLIAN WINTER"


                                                     Risk and challenges

We may face the following risks and obstacles on the way to achieving our project goal.

  • Some of nomadic families supported may lose herds in severe winter again. To solve the challenge, we will have ongoing contact with those families and make sure whether they are doing enough preparation before winter and getting aid provision of grass and fodder by local governmental organizations;
  •  Some nomadic families may sell herds got through our project and go away. To ensure that we are reaching target group, we may work with local authorities on background research and check-up of nomadic families;

                                                               FAQ

  1. Why sheep?
  • Among 5 major types of livestock (horse, camel, cow, sheep and goat) in Mongolia, we will provide sheep through our aid program for the following reasons, such as:
  • Sheep is the most endurant and has high survival rate after harsh winter;
  • Grass and fodder required for sheep is less in size and affordable for start-up herders;
  • Sheep is more affordable. So it enables buying more livestock for more families given the limited fund to be raised;
  • High livestock farming benefit;

2.  Does this campaign for profit?

No. This campaign is not for profit, and organized by “Sustainable Nomads”, a nonprofit organization for supporting nomadic families and nomadic culture.

3.  How could it be self-financing in the future?

After the fundraising campaign on Indiegogo.com, potential nomadic families who lost livestock in the “Dzud”, a severe winter in Mongolia, will be studied for background check and will be provided with livestock (financed by the campaign) for living.

Within our fundraising target, 10 nomadic families, who lost everything in severe winter, will be supplied with 100 sheep each (total 10 families*100 sheep=1000 sheep) under the restart-up program, and another 10 families will be given 50 sheep each (total 10 families*50 sheep=500 sheep). Livestock has average annual growth rate of 50 to 95 percent rate. After a year, families got 100 sheep under our support will give back 10 sheep and ones got 50 sheep will provide back 5 sheep for next nomadic families in need. This way, payment in terms of sheep will be collected to support other nomadic families each year increasing the initial number of supported families from 20 to 46 in 10 years.

4.  What are the expected outcomes?

Considering the livestock for food (nomadic families exchange livestock for other foods, such as rice, floor etc.) and payment for next families, one nomadic family started with 100 sheep has potential to increase them to 5294 in 10 years.

As we see the graph above, we can find that how your contribution could build sustainable nomadic life source. 1500 sheep will give 20 nomadic families sustainable lives and 46 nomadic families in 10 years. The cycle could continue for long term with self-financing and more and more nomadic families could get support in the future.

5.  How did you come up the “Restart up or recover program”?


We surveyed nomadic families, and studied nomadic families, migration to cities, poverty among migrant nomads, major reasons to migrate to cities, and the “Dzud.

What we found led us to conclude that we are not only losing our nomadic life and culture, but also having more and more problems of air & soil pollution, unemployment, poverty, and shortage of energy supply and traffic congestion due to the high migration flow to city.

Our survey conducted among nomadic families shows us what they need the most during and after severe winter, and how much livestock do they need to restart or recover.

6.  How do you reach nomadic families?

This year we focus on the predefined provinces with high winter risk, such as Uvs, Arkhangai and Dornogobi provinces.

            

                    Risk assessment of winter in Mongolia, as of November 2015

                                                         Center of Weather

Local authorities of the provinces have data base with regard to nomadic families residing in the provinces and amount of livestock they own. To select nomadic families, we will do in - person screening and background checks together with local staffs.

7.  Where do you ship?

We ship worldwide! Shipping cost depending on your location will be added to perk price.

8.  How can I support nomadic families?You can support us by spreading the word! Sharing our campaign story on social media helps reach more people and ultimately support more nomadic families in needs of help.

As we see
the graph above, we can find that how your contribution could build sustainable
nomadic life source. 1500 sheep will give 20 nomadic families sustainable lives
and 46 nomadic families in 10 years. The cycle could continue for long term
with self-financing and more and more nomadic families could get support in the
future. 
5.  How did you come up the “Restart up or recover program”?

We surveyed nomadic
families, and studied nomadic families, migration to cities, poverty among
migrant nomads, major reasons to migrate to cities, and the “Dzud.
What we
found led us to conclude that we are not only losing our nomadic life and
culture, but also having more and more problems of air & soil pollution,
unemployment, poverty, and shortage of energy supply and traffic congestion due
to the high migration flow to city. 
Our survey
conducted among nomadic families shows us what they need the most during and
after severe winter, and how much livestock do they need to restart or recover.

6.  How do you reach
nomadic families?
This year we focus
on the predefined provinces with high winter risk, such as Uvs, Arkhangai and
Dornogobi provinces.
             


                    Risk assessment of winter in Mongolia, as of November 2015
                                                         Center of Weather



Local authorities of the provinces have data base with
regard to nomadic families residing in the provinces and amount of livestock
they own. To select nomadic families, we will do in - person screening and
background checks together with local staffs.
7. 
Where do you ship?
We ship worldwide!
Shipping cost depending on your location will be added to perk price.
8.  How can I support
nomadic families?You can support us
by spreading the word! Sharing our campaign story on social media helps reach
more people and ultimately support more nomadic families in needs of help.

story:
Short Summary

We are intentional.  We are a loving and supportive husband and wife team, nurturing, teaching, and being examples for our four beautiful children. We both graduated from Florida A&M University. We are lovers of the people in our community. We study global financial markets and connecting global market economics to transforming, revitalizing, and serving the needs of our community through the leverage of capitalism, group economics, and economic sustainability.  Our professional background is in environmental sciences, public health, retail, video editing, and computer technology.  We are Vanguards.  We are on purpose.  Our small business is the Urban Apple Natural Market. 

The Urban Apple Natural Market is a mobile produce and natural market.  The goal of the project is to successfully implement this business as a solution for food access, food deserts, food justice, and food security.  The project is innovative and creative based on its “pop-up” style, the fact that it’s on demand, all while meeting market needs.  Ultimately we want to create a successful business model for replication in other food deserts in Jacksonville, FL; the Northeast region; throughout the United States; and Worldwide.

What We Need & What You Get

We are fundraising for $150,000 that will go to purchase the mobile market truck, stock and inventory, administrative cost and business set up, and to hire one employee, to start.  If the entire funding amount is not raised we will use any funds that we have raised based on the following priority: business setup, truck purchase, administrative cost, inventory, and employees. 

Our unique perks include: T-shirts, Nutrition Classes, Breastfeeding #FirstFood Classes, A Full Local, Healthy Meal Prepared by the Owners, A Full Batch of the Healthiest Chocolate Chip Cookies; and handmade friendship bracelets and keychains made by our children. 

The Impact

This project is important because it’s a solution to a social ill.  We are passionate about it because this project impacts one of our most human and basic needs, food and nutrition.  We often say, “ We gotta Eat?”. 

On March 24th, 2016 we were presented with an opportunity to purchase mobile market truck from an amazing organization, Pie in the Sky, located in our region.  The Urban Apple Natural Market has just started purchase process talks with Pie in the Sky, but we are looking forward to a lifelong of  learning from them,building a great relationship, and carry on a vision of providing healthy and local food in the Northeast Florida region, and carrying on momentum of the local food revolution.

Risks & Challenges

We are set up for success because we live in a food desert and have often discussed solutions.  We have years of market research on food deserts, community revitalization, entrepreneurship, group economics, and mobile markets.  We expect success because the organization that we are planning on acquiring the mobile  market truck from is willing to share their business processes, contacts, and lessons learned. 

We have faced many obstacles, setbacks, and detours over the years, just to make it to this point.  Life happens to all of us.  We plan to approach each risk with educated, informed calculation.  We plan to take each challenge as a time to pause, reflect, learn and adjust. We remain constantly fluid, and always for forward progress and momentum. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You should fund this campaign because The Urban Apple Natural Market touches our most basic need, healthy food, nutrition, and lifestyle.  We all have to eat, and if there is a solution that provides healthier food options through a rebirth of an old concept then, why not?  Everyone can connect with food access, food security, and food justice, but you may not be able to support our campaign with money.  No problem, the time that you take to spread our campaign to your friends, family, and network is valuable and appreciated.

story:
SUMMARY

Passionate contributors,

My name is Milan Milenkovic. I am from Belgrade Serbia, and I am in apartment rental business for the last four years. For twenty years I worked as a DJ, so I do have a lot of experience in nightlife and I apply it so that my guests get the best conditions in night out in Belgrade. My team and I are starting this campaign because we want to renovate the building where the apartments are located, and to raise the service we provide to the next level.

My apartments are located in Savamala, the old part of Belgrade and Belgrade’s hot spot, which dates back to the 19th century, to the period of Austro-Hungarian rule, so the building itself is the legacy and part of historical heritage. 

Serbia has the rich historic and cultural heritage because it has been at the crossroads of East and West for centuries. In the past decades our country was very badly presented in  international media and whoever was staying here could not believe that he came with such prejudices. Given that young people come to Belgrade primarily because of the nightlife, we want to show them real values not only of Belgrade but the whole state of Serbia. We wish to promote Serbia throughout, gastronomy, drinks, culture, historical sites, museums, excursions and night life.

http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

The most common guests are the groups for Bachelor or Hens weekends and generally party weekends. Often, there are family groups on trips and people who want, beside new places, to get to know other cultures and customs. Since Belgrade is declared for the party destination, for several years already, also we want to provide all-inclusive VIP service for future guests.


http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

THE IMPACT

Our project is very important (we are the pioneers in this business) and is distinguished by the fact that we are the only ones in Belgrade who provide complete service. Beside accommodation and capacity of up to 40beds, we offer 24 hours service transport - airport transfers (arrival-departure) and city transfers, reservations for tables and lounges in restaurants, bars and taverns, entrances booking tables and VIP lounges in clubs, sightseeing tours by open bus, boat or cars, museum tours, cultural-historical tours, wine tours, traditional tours, sport days, shooting range tours, VIP yacht river cruising tours, cocktail class and bicycle days. 
In short, our experience can provide our guests to be at the right place at the right time.
http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

TOURS

*Full service – BforBelgrade Apartments booking, airport transfers (arrival/departure), city transfers (maximum 4 rides per day), reservations for tables and lounges in restaurants, taverns and bars, entrance and Vip lounge tables in premium clubs (all free of charge).

1) Nightlife tour - discover why Belgrade never sleeps and why it is called ‘the party capital of Europe’, meet true Belgraders throughout warm up bars, restaurants and gastro pubs, or after parties with folk music in taverns and visit unique clubbing on the rivers or open air clubs in the fortress till sunrise, or the most popular Savamala district.

http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

2) Sightseeing tour - panoramic view of Belgrade for  (by mini-van in the winter season or open-top bus in the summer season).

3) River boat sightseeing - in the summer season.

http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

4) Museum tour - visiting Nikola Tesla museum, Military museum, Kalemegdan fortress, Manak’s house, St. Sava Temple, Parliament & National Assembly, Belgrade’s underground, National Library and Gardos tower.

http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

5) Cultural-historic tour – visiting ancient archeological sites and natural wonders of Serbia (Vinca, Viminacium, Felix Romuliana, Mediana, Sirmium, Lepenski vir, Djavolja varos, Rtanj pyramid, Golubac and Trayan’s board).

http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

6) Sports day tour - (Balloon football, free climbing, bungee jumping, zip line and water skiing).

http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

7) Traditional tour – traditional Serbian breakfast, Serbian medieval knight skills (sword fight, mace fight, bow and arrow, spears, axes, knifes and optional - ride on Danube river on 1000 years old replica boat).

http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

8) Wine tour - visiting local wineries in several Serbian wine regions with tasting of local brands + lunch and dinner included.

9) Cocktail class - welcome shots, theory of cocktails, cocktail tasting, make your own cocktail,  make cocktails for your friends, exam and shooters for grades.

http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

10) Shooting range tour – paintball arena, indoor shooting range (gun, shotgun, AK 47 – Kalashnikov, sniper) or outdoor shooting range (gun, shotgun, AK 47 - Kalashnikov, sniper + traditional lunch)

http://www.bforbelgrade.rs/

11) VIP yacht river cruising tour - 3-4 hours ride on Sava and Danube river with private boat-yacht with VIP treatment (private waiter, skipper, DJ etc).

12) Bicycle day – amazing ride through streets of Belgrade. Stunning views of Belgrade’s architectural diversity and rivers from the bridges that connect old and new parts of Belgrade.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you are inspired by this project and would like others to be involved please pass this message along via Facebook, Twitter, Gmail, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc!

We appreciate any assistance you may be able to provide. Thank you!

story:
Our Lease is Ready to Rock - Help Open our Doors & Be Part of Purcellville's First Parisian Bakery + Creperie + Coffeehouse

A Piece of Paris on Mainstreet USA

Purcellville, Virginia: charming main-street town in the #2 wealthiest county in the United States {via Forbes}. Despite the epicurean population, the dining landscape is lacking in quality quick-service operations. Fine dining and mid-tier dining exist, but there currently does not exist a venue which provides an all-day epicurean experience; a comfortable, warm place to gather with friends, linger all day on a computer over coffee then lunch, a simple date night of chocolate and wine or a place to take kids for a storybook tea time. 

Petit Lou-Lou will capitalize on the unrivaled performance of bakery cafés, the evident hole in the comp set and proficient hospitality talents of  tenured ownership to deliver a concept which will elevate the epicurean conversation in Loudoun County


About Petit Loulou

A piece of Paris in Loudoun County, Virginia. 

  • Walking into Petit Lou-Lou is akin to stepping out of Loudoun County and into a corner cafe on the streets of Paris. The inviting, warm aromas of fresh chocolate croissants baking and freshly ground Counter Culture coffee greets guests all morning, an all-day menu of bubbling French onion soup, fresh baked quiche and crusty baguette sandwiches provide a comforting culinary experience and an evening program of Champagnes, wine + beer and cheese are an unmatched evening experience. The showpiece of the culinary program at Petit Lou-Lou is a menu of sweet and savory crepes {hailed as the largest East of Paris}, all customizable using a myriad of chef-crafted ingredients and house made batters. 

  • The Space: The space at Petit Lou-Lou is as carefully curated and critical to the experience.  The visual distinguishment of the restaurant begins outside as guests are greeted by a marquee light lit menu board, brightly colored wood paneling and gold window lettering reminiscent of beloved Parisian corner bistros. Inside a mix of antique black and white floor tiles and white washed wood floors support a dining room featuring comfortable bistro tables + chairs and vintage settee sofa seating. 

  • The Food: We offer an all-day menu featuring a variety of handmade croissants baked fresh every hour, varieties of quiche, baguette sandwiches, salads, a winter hot chocolate bar featuring our signature housemade marshmallows, an expertly trained coffee program featuring Counter Culture coffee and of course, crepes. The largest crepe menu east of Paris to be exact, featuring a variety of selections from the simple Crepe Suzette to the more interesting Philly Cheese Steak & Proscuitto Pesto crepes. All crepes are customizable, made from housemade buckwheat, flour and gluten-free batters. 
  • Signature Menu Items Include:
  •  A selection of six daily croissants baked daily, on the hour including signature varieties such as the banana coconut croissant, proscuitto cotto & brie croissant, preserved fig croissant and expertly baked traditional varieties including a pan au chocolat, almond croissant and sweet cheese.
  • An overflowing pastry case showcasing an impressive presentation of authentic French pastries including eclairs, napoleons, cream puffs, tarts and a variety of creme brûlée. 
  • Selection of sandwiches made on fresh-baked baguette, soup, salads. An evening program of cheese, charcuterie and a selection of regional Virginia and French wines. 
  • The largest crepe menu east of Paris featuring perfectly artistically prepared sweet and savory crepes made with handmade buckwheat, flour and gluten-free batters and a unique repertoire of chef-crafted ingredients. 


The Money + The Love

  • Petit Loulou has a start-up budget of $215,000. We have secured the majority of our funds, however need another $30,000 to open our doors. We are hoping our friends and community will rally to support. 
  • The money raised from our campaign will contribute to securing permits, architecture and equipment purchases. 
  • All supporters will be given first-right opportunities on new openings. 

We are a family-run operation, combining the talents of a lauded chef and a tenured public relations and branding professional. Moreso, we are parents and residents of Purcellville . . .our kids want crepes, we want to impact the town and enhance Main Street USA. Our goal is to contribute to the fabric of the town by creating a unique space and outlet, contributing and giving back to our community and grow the Petit Loulou brand into a national concept. We hope you will join us on this journey!

story:
160 Jahre Traube Bellenberg


Liebe Freunde, Traube Stammgäste, Traube Fans und Gönner !!

Ich fühle mich verpflichtet dieses beachtliche Jubiläum gebührend zu feiern. Seit Monaten plane ich alles und mir ist es gelungen die Gemeinde Bellenberg davon zu überzeugen, dass ich für meine Hirngespinste mehr Platz brauche und tatsächlich wurde die Sperrung der Bahnhofstraße genehmigt :-) Nun ist es amtlich:

Vom 13. - 15. August 2016 steigt der 160th Birthday Bash

3 Tage Jubiläum - 3 Tage Live-Musik - 3 Tage Unterhaltung.

Ich will Vollgas geben! Wer mich kennt weiß, dass ich dazu neige ;-)

Dies soll ein Event/Festival/Open Air/Straßenfest werden, welches das Illertal noch nie gesehen hat, mit 3 Bühnen (im Lokal, im Biergarten und im Zelt auf der Bahnhofstraße), nationalen und internationalen coolen Live-Acts und Rundumshaus-Bewirtung von morgens bis in die Nacht.

Ein Fest für jedermann o h n e Eintritt!

_____________________________________________________________________________ Warum diese Kampagne?

Weil des a Schweinemünz koscht!! Selbst wenn ich mit "0815" Bands fahre und den Ball generell flach halte, ist dieses Vorhaben mit dem Umsatz allein nicht zu stemmen.

Und himmelherrgottsackradinommolabrauleggedmedochälleamarsch - 160 Jahre des isch doch ebbes. So was muß doch richtig gefeiert werden.

Die Traube überlebte den 1.Weltkrieg, den 2. Weltkrieg und das Kneipensterben in den letzten 15 Jahren, hier bekam man die erste Coke, vielleicht war hier dr Benz persönlich mit dem ersten Automobil beim Einkehren, vielleicht hat der Einstein, als er seine Geburtsstadt Ulm besuchte, erst amol a Bierle in dr Traube gezwitschert und dabei die Relativitätstheorie ausgetüftelt, hier brannte wahrscheinlich schon eine der ersten Glühlampen, hier stand mit Sicherheit auch einer der ersten Fernsprechapparate und hier lief der Bolero noch von einem Phonopraphen :-)

Und nun würde ich am Ende nur ein Pobelfescht auf die Beine stellen? Niemals!

Drum brauch i euch :-*

Mit eurer Unterstützung entscheidet ihr, in welchem Umfang das ganze stattfinden soll. Sekt oder Selters? Wurschtwegga oder Spareribs? 3 Bands oder über 10? Das Programm steht bereits in meinem Kopf und will raus! Internationale Künstler warten auf meine Zusage und je nach Budget stelle ich euch eine Mega Band Line-up zusammen und diverse Showeinlagen. Da wird für jeden Geschmack etwas dabei sein und die Party wird unvergesslich. So wie es die Traube verdient.

Mit eurem Sponsoring gebt ihr mir außerdem Rückendeckung bei den anfallenden, immensen Kosten wie z.B.

  • Zelt und Bühne (auf der Bahnhofstraße!) 
  • PA (Licht und Ton)
  • Künstlergagen
  • Hotelübernachtungen
  • Catering
  • Security
  • Absperrzäune
  • Gebühren
  • Reinigungsfirmen
  • usw

Eure Unterstützung wird 1:1 in die Umsetzung und Ausführung gebuttert.                 Nix in mei Tasch! Sollte wider Erwarten was hängen bleiben, so wird dies in den Erhalt der Traube gesteckt - jeder Cent!

Und da wir im Schwobaländle sind, biete ich euch für eure Unterstützung auch sogenannte  Perks/Gegenleistungen an! 

Diejenigen, die nicht online spenden möchten oder kein Paypal Konto haben, können gerne in der Traube was abgeben. Hier habe ich ab sofort ein Spendenschwein aufgestellt.

Mundpropaganda ist angesagt. Also diesen Link bitte fleissig teilen. Mobilisiert eure Partner, Kumpels und Freundinnen und helft dabei, ein unvergessliches Event auf die Beine zu stellen.

Auf Facebook postet ihr sonst doch auch jeden Scheiß ;-)

DANKE DANKE DANKE

Eure Chrissy mit Team
story_txt:
160 Jahre Traube Bellenberg
Liebe Freunde, Traube Stammgäste, Traube Fans und Gönner !!
Ich fühle mich verpflichtet dieses beachtliche Jubiläum gebührend zu feiern. Seit Monaten plane ich alles und mir ist es gelungen die Gemeinde Bellenberg davon zu überzeugen, dass ich für meine Hirngespinste mehr Platz brauche und tatsächlich wurde die Sperrung der Bahnhofstraße genehmigt :-) Nun ist es amtlich:
Vom 13. - 15. August 2016 steigt der 160th Birthday Bash
3 Tage Jubiläum - 3 Tage Live-Musik - 3 Tage Unterhaltung. 
Ich will Vollgas geben! Wer mich kennt weiß, dass ich dazu neige ;-)
Dies soll ein Event/Festival/Open Air/Straßenfest werden, welches das Illertal noch nie gesehen hat, mit 3 Bühnen (im Lokal, im Biergarten und im Zelt auf der Bahnhofstraße), nationalen und internationalen coolen Live-Acts und Rundumshaus-Bewirtung von morgens bis in die Nacht.
Ein Fest für jedermann o h n e Eintritt!_____________________________________________________________________________
Warum diese Kampagne?
Weil des a Schweinemünz koscht!! Selbst wenn ich mit "0815" Bands fahre und den Ball generell flach halte, ist dieses Vorhaben mit dem Umsatz allein nicht zu stemmen. 
Und himmelherrgottsackradinommolabrauleggedmedochälleamarsch - 160 Jahre des isch doch ebbes. So was muß doch richtig gefeiert werden. 
Die Traube überlebte den 1.Weltkrieg, den 2. Weltkrieg und das Kneipensterben in den letzten 15 Jahren, hier bekam man die erste Coke, vielleicht war hier dr Benz persönlich mit dem ersten Automobil beim Einkehren, vielleicht hat der Einstein, als er seine Geburtsstadt Ulm besuchte, erst amol a Bierle in dr Traube gezwitschert und dabei die Relativitätstheorie ausgetüftelt, hier brannte wahrscheinlich schon eine der ersten Glühlampen, hier stand mit Sicherheit auch einer der ersten Fernsprechapparate und hier lief der Bolero noch von einem Phonopraphen :-)
 Und nun würde ich am Ende nur ein Pobelfescht auf die Beine stellen? Niemals!
Drum brauch i euch :-*
Mit eurer Unterstützung entscheidet ihr, in welchem Umfang das ganze stattfinden soll. Sekt oder Selters? Wurschtwegga oder Spareribs? 3 Bands oder über 10? Das Programm steht bereits in meinem Kopf und will raus! Internationale Künstler warten auf meine Zusage und je nach Budget stelle ich euch eine Mega Band Line-up zusammen und diverse Showeinlagen. Da wird für jeden Geschmack etwas dabei sein und die Party wird unvergesslich. So wie es die Traube verdient.
Mit eurem Sponsoring gebt ihr mir außerdem Rückendeckung bei den anfallenden, immensen Kosten wie z.B.

Zelt und Bühne (auf der Bahnhofstraße!) 
PA (Licht und Ton) 

Künstlergagen 

Hotelübernachtungen 

Catering 

Security 

Absperrzäune 

Gebühren 

Reinigungsfirmen 

usw 


Eure Unterstützung wird 1:1 in die Umsetzung und Ausführung gebuttert.                 Nix in mei Tasch! Sollte wider Erwarten was hängen bleiben, so wird dies in den Erhalt der Traube gesteckt - jeder Cent!
Und da wir im Schwobaländle sind, biete ich euch für eure Unterstützung auch sogenannte  Perks/Gegenleistungen an! 
Diejenigen, die nicht online spenden möchten oder kein Paypal Konto haben, können gerne in der Traube was abgeben. Hier habe ich ab sofort ein Spendenschwein aufgestellt.
Mundpropaganda ist angesagt. Also diesen Link bitte fleissig teilen. Mobilisiert eure Partner, Kumpels und Freundinnen und helft dabei, ein unvergessliches Event auf die Beine zu stellen.
Auf Facebook postet ihr sonst doch auch jeden Scheiß ;-)
DANKE DANKE DANKE
Eure Chrissy mit Team

story:
Just to make things clear, the staff at The Perfect Dump™ do not necessarily enjoy the frequent discussion of going to the bathroom. We don’t spend all our time online looking at pictures of poo or shopping for supplements or anything like that. But what we do enjoy is feeling our best. And there’s nothing that makes us feel better than taking a perfect dump in the morning, wiping once, and then going about our day.

That’s why we’ve adopted a completely no-nonsense approach to supplements and going to the bathroom by providing a straightforward, 100% all-natural, high-fiber powder with no chemicals added that is guaranteed to satisfy your needs or your money back does what it says it does. When the user mixes two scoops of our Perfect Dump™ supplement powder in with the beverage of their choice and they will experience the best dumps money can buy. Period.

The truth is most people don’t think about fiber supplements and taking the best dumps until it’s too late. They eat a bunch of crap for a few weeks in a row, managing out messy dumps that require tons of wipes. This can lead to dietary problems like constipation or diarrhea. To quickly resolve the issue, they run online and buy extreme supplements, laxatives or subscribe to colon cleanse powder diets. While these mixes and supplements might temporarily fix the problem, they often do so at the expense of the best day. Typical users can expect additional dietary issues like stomachaches and frequent visits to the bathroom.

The Perfect Dump doesn’t make the user go to the bathroom like a laxative, it makes it better when the user goes to the bathroom. The Perfect Dump’s unique blend prevents the need for extremes by regulating bowel movements before problems arise by filling out an inferior bowel movement with lubrication, texture, and substance.Even while binging on fast food it will compensate for the difference.

Everybody knows that everybody poos and that some poos are better than others. All someone has to do the next time they are online is click a few buttons and give it a try. After the user mixes two scoops of The Perfect Dump™ for two nights in a row, he or she experiences the best bowel movements the body can muster.

A note to users: while The Perfect Dump™ contains no known allergens or chemicals it should be still taken in moderation, specifically when a diet is lacking insoluble fiber. The Perfect Dump™ should be taken with at least 8oz of fluid and mixed thoroughly. First-time users should take The Perfect Dump™ for two nights in a row to experience the best results.

story:
Baker/Photographer   CLT.NC

I am Kacie Smagacz.  I am passionate about my community in Charlotte and I am passionate about baking.  I believe that food is a powerful love language and I want to spread that love by networking with area nonprofits, organizations and individuals who also seek to see Charlotte, North Carolina thrive.  
I have been in the baking industry for almost ten years now, starting at a local cookie shop back home in Omaha, Nebraska.  I then entered the coffee industry and sparked my love for creating coffee and tea based beverages.  While I established my photography company in Omaha, I was given a job as a baker at a bakery downtown in the heart of Omaha's Old Market.  It was at this bakery that I started diving into recipes based off of dietary restrictions and preferences.  I found myself wanting to conquer every allergy that someone had and to make the little boy's dream of tasting a chocolate cake again come true, despite his allergy to soy, dairy, peanuts and corn--(not to mention his reactions once refined sugar entered his system!)  After that and falling in love with many people who are passionate vegans, I became invested in vegan baking.  I went on to work at another local coffee shop where I was surrounded by really amazing humans-many of whom are vegan.  I began to see even more clearly the need for healthy AND *delicious* vegan baked goods-therefore my menu is vegan-centric, but not strictly vegan.  I source as locally as possible.
I actively study nutrition and apply it to my life.  I want to be able to provide high quality baked goods in a nutritious way.  I want to be able to give people something they love, that won't deplete their body of nutrients at the same time. 
I believe that the world needs more people who get OBSESSED with what they love.
I believe that the world needs more people who use that obsession to share knowledge and to try to sew seeds of beauty back into their world.
Sometimes that looks like a mentor.  Sometimes that looks like a safe-place for people who are recovering from domestic violence.  Sometimes that looks like a camp that's made for young females to come learn confidence through music.  I believe that sometimes that means giving a nutritious lunch to someone who is hungry and I believe that sometimes that means sharing a cookie after one of those days that make your brain really heavy.  
That's why I have started Move That Dough Baking Co.  I don't know exactly where we will go from here, but the wheels are turning!

Sugar. Spice. Everything Nice!

Here's the idea for raising funds...

  • Funds raised through this time will go directly, and solely, to the building of the business of Move That Dough Baking Co.  
  • We need to renovate the Travco. We need to outfit it for vending.  We need to assemble the team.  We need to get our safety courses taken care of and we need to be able to start engaging the community AS we build...which is why I am starting this campaign.
  • THE BEST PART...is that you're not just giving money away.  You're ordering things.  DELICIOUS things.  Cookies, the flavor you choose, delivered to your door.  Vouchers for cakes, tangible hand-made items made by me, or local artists-from aprons to dishes to personal RECIPE booklets including step-by-step photo tutorials!  It doesn't stop there... 
  • I am offering PHOTO SESSIONS.  I was the sole proprietor of Good Morning Dear Photography LLC based out of Omaha, NE.  I specialized in weddings and portraiture, with food photography as an underlying current.  One, two and a six hour wedding package are offered!
If you decide to place an order through this site, your money is going directly into establishing this business as a resource for the area of Charlotte, NC.  I have a fire going and it's not about to be put out, so I might as well let it blaze.  If you want some cookies and have been looking for an excuse to indulge?  Look no further.  If you know you have a wedding or engagement coming up and need photography work?  That is an option too. 

IN THE MEAN TIME

I have been meeting with a team of mentors through SCORE Charlotte to build a business plan and to continue building the business on paper.  I am developing a board, with whom ideas are shared, questioned and refined, also ensuring integrity behind every step. I AM BAKING UP A STORM and refining recipes for menu items, to provide consistency in quality.  I am meeting with fellow start-ups to gain insight through their experience.  I am meeting with organizers from nonprofits and groups who engage the Charlotte community for the better-through these meetings I am developing a forecasted schedule of the people I will be working with.   The idea is to pair monthly or as often as we can, to raise awareness for that specific cause or organization.  I aim to provide a specialty crafted baked good in that organization's honor throughout that month, proceeds from which will go directly to said organization.  It's kind of like Robin Hood but without actually stealing...and with a lot of really really good food.

story:
Namaste,

We are a promotional team located in Naples, Florida, and through the power of social media and good vibes we created a collective of artistic youths. Last year we hosted our very first concert, "Save The Youth" bringing in 250+ showcasing all of our local talent. This year we want to do it again but bigger, better, and FREE.

All Ages. All Talent. All Love.

It's what we're about. We started this "movement" last with the idea of bringing together like minded individuals that want to express their creative passions (music, photography, videos, painting, graphic designing, and fashion designing) but are held back by social stigma. Since then, we've created special bonds and witnessed exponential growth in the artists we support and are meeting new, bright faces along the way. Any money gained doesn't go in our pockets, not even from our website shop, we work for the community that raised us so the kids of the future can experience what most of us haven't. 

This is what The CommUnity Festival is about; coming together as a whole and making a plan to make our homes, and subsequently the world, a better place (whilst enjoying the electric creativity of young, bold artists expressing themselves the only way they can).

Peace&Love,

The Hippie Circle

thehippiecircle.com
Twitter: @thehippiecircle
Instagram: @thehippiecircle

story:
What is Grow Your Roots?

Grow Your Roots started out in May 2014 as a small Food Vendor at the Carp Farmers’ Market in Ottawa Ontario. Our biggest sellers were our flavourful doughnuts and our famous Deep Fried Avocados, along with our handmade Vegan Burgers & Sausages. Word quickly spread around Ottawa and before we knew it we were selling to local restaurants & doing 100% Vegan Catering for charity events & special occasions!

What are our Plans?

We adore the Farmers’ Market; however, our initial goal has always been to open a full-service Vegan Restaurant in Ottawa’s west end -- a place for anyone to come and enjoy a healthy, made from scratch breakfast, coffee or tea, lunch, snack or treat! A vintage, industrial style spot where you can sit down for a meal, work on projects and have meetings in a comfy lounge style spot by the window, or make a quick stop in for some take out lunch (or even freezer style meals for at-home family dinners). And of course, a quality, trustworthy company you’ll hire to cater your wedding, corporate events or any special occasion.

Why ‘Grow Your Roots’?

Recognized as a beautiful wild Dandelion, the Grow Your Roots logo and name is built upon the idea of Growing Your Roots deeply and passionately into a life that’s for the good of our health, the earth and every being among it. It’s about doing things in life that are ‘bigger than ourselves’.

Not only do we want to open a Grow Your Roots restaurant, but we want it to be based on something bigger than just a restaurant. We believe in a lifestyle that’s based on healthy eating, and compassionate and sustainable living. That’s why we are 100% vegan, offer nutritious menu items (with the odd indulgence), and use ingredients that are sustainable, locally sourced and organic whenever possible.

Join us in not only supporting our campaign, but building a community around Grow Your Roots. A community that cares about its members, supports other local businesses, raises awareness about a compassionate lifestyle for the animals, and a community that educates and supports a healthier body for us all.

What do We Need Funds For?

As GYR will be a full-service restaurant, we require quite a bit of equipment and restaurant furniture to get up and running.

We’ve been great-fully provided with a stovetop and two fridges at a great price from friends of the owner of Grow Your Roots; but, we still need lots more. A convection oven for baked treats, deep fryers for fresh cut fries and deep fried avocados, prep tables, a panini press for made to order sandwiches, a Vitamix for house made vegan cheese and smoothies, an espresso machine for fresh coffee that’s locally roasted and fair trade organic, display cases for our delicious vegan desserts and takeaway lunch and dinner options, and of course, a wine & beer fridge for locally crafted brews and Canadian wine.

The less money that we have to pay off from costs of restaurant, the quicker we can start building our community and putting proceeds towards events and causes that mean the most to us. Hosting charity events is our favourite thing to do, so help us by donating so that we can hurry up and get some of these awesome events going to support local charities and animal rescues!

Connect With Us!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/growyourroots.veganeats

Twitter: GrowYourRoots_

YouTube: Grow Your Roots Vegan Eats (Channel)


About our “perks”

$5   Thanks and gratitude

Thanks for supporting Grow Your Roots -- your contribution makes a HUGE difference.  

$25   Free appetizer

Join us after we open to enjoy one free appetizer of your choosing.

Might we suggest our famous Deep Fried Avocados ;)

$50   Farmer’s Market Tote

The perfect bag to take with you to a local farmer’s market, for carrying your favourite veggies, or picking up one of our delicious take-home desserts.

$50   Soft organic tee

Show Your Support with our organic tee -- wear it around town, or gift it to a friend. So nice you’ll want to own more than one.

$75   Get Our Secret Recipe

Always wondered how to make the perfect <what goes here?> -- just like ours? Wonder no more. This perk gets you your very own copy of this otherwise secret recipe.

$100   Thank You Wall

Have your name and photo included on our wall of thanks - we couldn’t do this without you!

$100   Lunch for two

Bring a friend for a leisurely lunch - and enjoy a complimentary appetizer and main course from our menu.

$200   Time to celebrate!

Special occasion? Time for a bit of a treat? This perk entitles you to a 3-course meal for one -- we’re already looking forward to your visit!

$500   Hands on cooking class

Join us at one of our hands on, plant-based, vegan cooking classes in our new space to learn everything you need to create a delicious healthy vegan meal at home.

$1000   Choose A Charity

Every month we’ll be donating 15% of dessert proceeds to a charity of our choosing. With this perk? You can help! You’ll get to select a charity close to your heart to benefit during one month in the calendar year.

$2000   Join us at our soft launch

A soft launch is where we work out all the kinks - join friends, family, and other supporters of Grow Your Roots at this invite only event. This perk includes an exclusive invite for you and one guest.

$5000   Exclusive VIP event invite

We plan to host a variety of fundraising and community events in our new space -- get an exclusive VIP invite to one of them!

$5000   Your own private dinner

Sometimes you just want the place to yourself -- right? This perk will give you exactly that -- enjoy a three course meal for you and eleven of your favourite friends. *alcohol excluded

$10000  Free food for life!

The name of this perk says it all -- you’ll enjoy all the perks of being a Grow Your Roots star supporter and celebrity -- free food for you and you alone! -Oh yeah!

This perk gets you your very own copy of this otherwise secret recipe.$100   Thank You WallHave your name and photo included on our wall of thanks - we couldn’t do this without you! $100   Lunch for twoBring a friend for a leisurely lunch - and enjoy a complimentary appetizer and main course from our menu.$200   Time to celebrate! Special occasion? Time for a bit of a treat? This perk entitles you to a 3-course meal for one -- we’re already looking forward to your visit!$500   Hands on cooking classJoin us at one of our hands on, plant-based, vegan cooking classes in our new space to learn everything you need to create a delicious healthy vegan meal at home. $1000   Choose A CharityEvery month we’ll be donating 15% of dessert proceeds to a charity of our choosing. With this perk? You can help! You’ll get to select a charity close to your heart to benefit during one month in the calendar year. $2000   Join us at our soft launchA soft launch is where we work out all the kinks - join friends, family, and other supporters of Grow Your Roots at this invite only event. This perk includes an exclusive invite for you and one guest. $5000   Exclusive VIP event inviteWe plan to host a variety of fundraising and community events in our new space -- get an exclusive VIP invite to one of them! $5000   Your own private dinnerSometimes you just want the place to yourself -- right? This perk will give you exactly that -- enjoy a three course meal for you and eleven of your favourite friends. *alcohol excluded$10000  Free food for life!The name of this perk says it all -- you’ll enjoy all the perks of being a Grow Your Roots star supporter and celebrity -- free food for you and you alone! -Oh yeah!

story:
We're the Real Jerks

Almost two years ago two long-time friends took a coveted family recipe for a Caribbean Inspired Jerk Sauce and bottle it.  

Real Jerk Original Marinade sure has has grown from then.  We're on the shelves at Glen's Garden Market, Magruder's, and Rodman's.  You can find us at several local farmers markets every week, including Capital Harvest on the Plaza and the Brookland Farmers Market.

Everyone who tastes our products agree: our sauce is an awesome sauce.

So good, in fact, that we think that we can bring home the Blue ribbon at the Safeway National Capitol BBQ Battle on Pennsylvania Avenue this June with Pitt Boss Rich Gunter of operation:eatery.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help.  We're raising $10,000 to help cover our expenses in preparing to compete in one of the nation's toughest bar-b-que battles.

We need to practice smoking ribs, chicken and brisket three times before we hit the playing field.  We've also got to handle all of the logistics of sending a team to the BBQ Battle, including equipment rental, supplies, and staffing.  Finally, we need to engage in some serious PR to tell the story of Real Sauce Company and how the Real Jerks are DC's own "Little Engine That Could."

We're offering some pretty sweet PERKS-- from Real Jerk apparel and gift sets to an invitation to the Judges table at the final practice run to a Behind-the-Scenes one-of-a-kind experience in our competition tent.

We're really hoping to reach our goal of $10,000.  If we don't, your small business investment will still help us to buy the practice meat and cover our team on-site at the Safeway National Capital BBQ Battle.


Why Help Some Real Jerks?

We're part of the DC local food renaissance.  We're in a tribe of local producers lovingly making handcrafted products in small batches.  We're on a mission to replace the national brands on the grocery shelves.  (They're full of sugar and preservatives, anyway!)  

Real Sauce Company has been making an impact by participating in Farmer's Markets, Holiday markets, and In-Store Demos.  We're fiercely determined to share the Real Jerk line of products with anyone passionate about food and cooking. 


Real Challenges

What we lack in business capital, we make up for in moxie.  We maximize every opportunity, resource, and partnership to realize our dream of becoming a sustainable producers of world-class marinades, sauces, and dry-rubs.

We're also getting some great help in strategy, marketing, and operations from operation:eatery.  It's Nice to Have Friends in the Industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute to our Campaign, you can help.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about the Real Jerks and participation as a contestant in the BBQ Battle.
