story:
Hello! I am Shayla, a mom with an "empty nest" and ready to start flying a bit. I started dyeing yarns in January 2010 and launched Alina Shea Creations. I’ve recently added embroidered items and distance healing to my list of creations.

I have the most awesome customers all over the world and I’d like to start traveling to see the ones in this country. Well, in the places I can drive to. Ravelry meet-up, anyone? I plan to attend the wonderful fiber shows and festivals along the way, too.


Your contributions will help with:

Motor Home: I’m currently looking for a small to mid-sized Class C that has a strong engine and solid body. I will remove the standard furniture and install the yarn equipment, embroidery machine, shelves, and bins.

Rocket Stove: This will allow me to dye yarn outdoors during warmer months so that I don’t heat up the motor home too much.

Solar Panels: These will allow me to keep the electricity running wherever I am so that I can keep the business running smoothly at all times.

Yarn, threads, and supplies: I will stock up on the items that I’ll need to keep everything running smoothly. This includes citric acid powder, extra yarn, fabrics and other items, while I’m still in a location where I can gather them easily.

Miscellaneous Equipment: While I already have ways to store yarn now, I want to make sure that I’m able to keep the skeins and other creations free from “road dust” while I’m traveling. I also plan to get updated drying racks, a small screen tent (to keep the yarn safe from birds & other flying critters).


While traveling, I will be doing as much “boondocking” as possible. What this means is that I will be staying in free or low cost places without the standard electric and water hookups. This will allow me to keep the expenses as low as I can so that I can focus more on the dyes, threads, and customers.

The Perks are a variety of yarny goodness, embroidered items, hand-knit items and distance healing (Reiki & crystals). I’m hoping to have a little something for all of you. For those that require shipping, the cost is already calculated in the price and this includes international packages.


I have been researching life on the road for a couple years and I’m mostly sure that I’ve thought of everything I can while I’m still living in an apartment. once I’m actually on the road, I do know that some things may come up and any funds that haven’t gone toward the equipment and such, will be set aside in case I need a different kind of drying rack or something along those lines.


Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Konso-Organic is a Berlin (Germany) and Addis Abeba (Ethiopia) based organisation who aims to help through humanitarian actions in the southern regions Ethiopia, specifically in Konso. This Woreda, what we call province, is already part of a 5 years project run by the Ethiopian government targeting the development of the poorest areas in Ethiopia. The area suffers from food insecurity, water scarcity in addition to bad road networks leaving its population isolated from a possible outsider trading.

I spent in the early 2015 one month in Konso helping this overwhelming society and when I left my soul remained there. It was then not a coincidence that I met Semenh, a friend and current associate, who had dedicated his last three years to the development of rural areas in his country.

Why we chose tricycle bikes for our project is an easy answer. Myself, I ride a bamboo bike whose frame I manufactured on my own. A bike is the most useful, ecological and easy reachable solution for rural communities’ mobility. If there is wood, there could be a bike.


WATER PROBLEM in Konso

The shortage and scarcity of safe water sources are very severe in Konso due to its geographical setting; rugged topography with limited flat land and unreliable repeated shortage rainfall of 750 mm per year.

An increasing population, low productivity of the land and less access to safe water, sanitation facilities and hygiene practices are the main factors that have been extensively aggravating food insecurity and poverty in the area. Without queuing time of about 30 minutes, women spent 4 or 5 hours a day on travelling to collect water from unprotected or unsafe sources. Donkeys are even non-existent in this area and women carry as a result, water jerry can on their shoulders. Access to sanitation facilities is very low and those existing are poor in quality. Awareness of the community about sanitation is very poor. Open defecation is common, people don’t practice hand washing and washing faces is also not common in the villages. Washing the body and cleaning clothes is usually considered as luxurious and not as health issue and this is because of low awareness about hygiene. As a result, the prevalence of water, sanitation and hygiene is related to diseases in the villages like diarrhoea, trachoma, intestinal parasites, typhoid, typhus, and others. Therefore girls’ school attendance is very low because the parents need their labour to collect water from distant areas.


Tricycle Project

The local non-profit organisation, Konso Development Association (KDA), has taken awareness of the problem through a WaterAid Project being carried on, however the water scarcity will not disappear in a close future. Our tricycles will have an immediate impact. Collecting water commuting time will be shorten in addition to avoid those women charging litters of water on their back.

The project is supported and supervised by one of the most respected clan chiefs in Konso, Sir kalla. Next to him, we will supply 100 cargo bikes to those families in more need and in return, they will school young members in the family and the bikes will be used for the good of the community. In collaboration with the local non-profit organisations, Konso Development Association (KDA) and Trees for the Future, a storage room is planned to be built to stack local reserves for Konso’s own self-efficiency. It will be run by women and our tricycles would be then one of their labouring tools. If row materials surplus after harvest, they will be educated to an outside trading with the neighbour provinces to boost the local per capita income.

  

Possible Inconvenients

We acknowledge the mountainous topography of Konso. Bike ridders will save anyway a lot of time in the collecting water daily task. It is anyway easier to push the bike with the water cans on up the hill than carrying them on their shoulders. To avoid the improper use of the bikes, benefiting families will be committed to school the young members in the family and to use the tricycle for the good of their close community. We will employee those women in our community activities where tricycles would be most useful.


What we need

Our tricycle provider has taken into consideration the non-profit aspect of project and offers each tricycle for only 75,50$. Kalla's organisation in Konso will receive the shipping to avoid any toll difficulty. Total amount needed, 8500$ or 6850€, from which. 

If enough money is collected we will think the possibility of a 6 gear bike for $115,50$ / unit.


Tricycle description

  • Trailer size: 74 x 50 x 22 cm.
  • 100-120kg can be transported on each
  • One gear

Why tricycles?

Konso people have basically never ridden a two wheel bike. Three wheels will make easier the ride in addition to provide an extra charge capacity. Bikes don’t consume energy. If the project succeed, the own local community will want a bike and we could educate them to manufacture theirs.

story:
Welcome to my campaign!

In 2010 I rekindled my passion in collecting vinyl records, unfortunately I found buying from charity shops and markets proved to be a waste of money as they were badly scratched and un-playable. I was left in a dilemma should I donate them to a charity shop and let someone else go through the same thing, or take them to the local tip for land fill.

After some deliberation I decided to put them to use and started Livanupcycle in 2012, making use of the great artwork found on album covers. The first item I made was wall clocks from the covers, but still found myself with the problem of having the vinyl to dispose of. Over the years I’ve managed to re-use all the bad records purchased, the parts taken from old computers and even the odd tin can into clocks, notebooks and jewellery.


Handmade Calabash lampshade

Since starting I’ve mainly worked on the kitchen table and in the back yard, but now I would like to increase the product range that I produce.  I have designs for Perspex and Wood to take to the manufacturing stage but am limited with working space. Starting this month (July) I’ve managed to secure a workshop for the next year, but now need to purchase the correct tools to move forward.

I have worked out exactly what equipment is needed to take my products to another level. The amount I hope to raise through this campaign is £2,880.00. This will go towards the following:

The major item that will be purchased is a laser cutter, which allows me to broaden the range of products using vinyl records along with Perspex and Wood, the second highest spend is on marketing for the Christmas market, which has always been my best sales period.

In keeping with the nature of my business, stock purchases are waste or offcuts from my local Perspex fabricator and timber yard.

I have put together a list of very exciting perks for your contributions and hope this will entice you to contribute towards making my expansion dream a reality.

My goal of £2,800 is set at this amount, so that I can afford to buy all the equipment needed to make an immediate start. I decided to use the flexible funding format to allow for purchasing of equipment that will help towards moving forwards.

Of course, if all goes well and I end up reaching, or exceeding my goal, I will buy in everything I need right away. If I do exceed my goal, I will be able to start moving on to the other products that I plan to add in the future, sooner.

Because Upcycling is a great way to reuse materials and reduce our footprint.  


There are two ways to support the upcycling movement. Sort through your cupboard or recycling bin and create items yourself or purchase ready-made items from upcycled materials. Both make a positive impact on the environment  rewarding you with something beautiful and useful.

Past Products

From my first market, I realised that my products offered a uniqueness to the consumer. The general response was one of nostalgia, with compliments for the creativeness in a world dominated by mass produced, soulless, disposable products and praise for saving such iconic items of the past. Since starting by turning album covers and computer parts into clocks, I have been commissioned to make lampshades from Calabash & TV stands from old wooden greenhouse plant stands.

Setting up the Workshop...

I believe by securing the workshop space, it offers me the opportunity to expand my creative ideas, be it producing items for personal wear or for the home. In today’s economic climate, small businesses are a vital addition to the economy. By supporting small businesses, you are ensuring that creatives and professionals who choose to go the route of self-employment, are able to continue offering their products and services to the world and support themselves and their communities by doing so.

This is my first foray into the world of crowd funding and I am very excited to see how it turns out, your support is greatly appreciated and I can’t wait to make a start and begin delivering the new products. I am immeasurably grateful to those who choose to patronise my business and cannot express how much every purchase, custom order and commission means.

While there are certainly challenges that may slow down the production timeline for me, through our perks, there is no risk to your contribution. The only problem I envisage is getting used to using the Laser Cutter as most of my designs are quite intricate, but from prototypes I’ve had made the flaws have been ironed out.

Please note that most of my Perks are scheduled for September delivery, so don’t be alarmed if  your item seem to be taking a long time to arrive, any concerns do not hesitate to contact me.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't! If you wish to help me out but cannot afford to make a contribution to my campaign, please consider the following:

  • Get the word out to your friends! Tell people about my campaign! Use the hashtag #livanupcycle to talk about what I'm trying to do.
  •  Facebook, twitter, tumblr, instagram... it's all good and it all helps.
  • Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you SO much for reading. Please let me know what you think, whether you choose to contribute or not!

story:
The Idea

The idea of producing smooking-wood came to my mind 2 months ago. I have a small coppiced-chestnut-wood, 3,2 acres (1,3 Hectares). There is a dense population of chestnuts stumps, and each one has dozens of trees of different age. Every ten years a coppiced-wood needs to be cut in order to start a new vegetative cycle. 

Motivations
Usually 99% of this trees are turned into firewood or fence-posts. But I thought: "There must been a more noble way to use this nice trees!". So since I love smoking food with chestnut logs - and this kind of trees are totally missing in many areas of the world - I thought it could be a great idea making chestnuts-woodchips and sell them worldwide through the Internet.

Smoking Qualities
Chestnut wood produces a medium weight nutty smoke, its coaling qualities are also medium. It gives the smoked meat very nice red colour and quite a unique characteristic taste. Use it to smoke fish, all meats, cheese and also vegetables. Can be successfully mixed with other woods.


What I Need for the Start-Up

                                                ITEM /SERVICE                                                  COST IN €
Professional Wood Chipper (wood chipping machine)      5.300
15 Kg of Plastic Bags to create the selling packages          900
Plastic bag sealer             45
5000 Sticker labels for packaging in 3 languages (English, Spanish Italian)           750
Web Site with "Online Selling Section" in three languages (English, Spanish, Italian)           550
Registration and Administration fees at the Chamber of Commerce.           230
Total without VAT        7.775
Italian VAT 22%          1.710

Total needed		         9.486


The Impact

The business is 100% eco-friendly and gives a second life to thousands of chestnuts trees, they have to be cut anyway because they grow in a coppice-forest. Moreover this business will have a positive impact on the surroundings and it will offer a new way to use this kind of wood.

For the smoking-food-lovers overseas this is a great chance to discover a new flavour. Chestnut wood can be succesfully mixed with other kind of wood and the possible combinations are huge. 

Risks & Challenges

The risk is almost close to ZERO, since I already own all the raw material I need. According to my calculation, with the current production I am able to sell 150-170 Tons of wood in the next three years. While I will be using the current biomass, a new vegetative growing cycle will bring new plants to maturation.

After 3 or 4 years I will probably need to buy a new piece of land. Chestnut forests are very common in my area and they are affordable.


Some Rewards include Pyrography Works:

Some Rewards include Chestnut Leaves for herbal-infusions:

story:
The Women's Fund in Georgia is launching an urgent fundraising campaign under the name “Women for Tbilisi Relief”. This campaign aims to mobilize resources to meet urgent needs and to maximize the efficiency of initiatives working to recover from the deadly flooding in Tbilisi, Georgia. On 13 and 14 June 2015, a devastating flood in the heart of Georgia's capital claimed the lives of at least 19 people, leaving dozens of families without housing, and killing most of the animals in Tbilisi Zoo and the city dog shelter, leaving the rest loose in the city without food or homes. A lack of appropriate city-planning, the neglect of environmental concerns and limited awareness of ecological issues, as well as a lack of preparation from the state itself – all of these issues contributed to this terrible catastrophe.

With the funds that they raise from this campaign, the Women's Fund in Georgia will provide small grants to support women's initiatives that can put in place long-term, effective mechanisms to help the post-flooding processes of rehabilitation. These include the provision of psycho-social, health and legal support for the survivors, appropriate living conditions for the victims of the flooding, ecological initiatives, and support for the surviving animals.

Any contribution to this cause is vital, and those working to minimize the long-term damage of the flood to the lives of people and animals will be grateful for any support that you are able to give.

Photo by Nino Tarkhnishvili, RFE/RL

story:
My Story

My name is Kevaughn Bonner. I was born in the community of Ritchies, Clarendon, Jamaica. The main source of income in my community is traditional farming. In my community, exists a situation where finding employment is sometimes an issue for both, young and middle aged members, as a result I thought of an idea that could help resolve this problem. My idea which can help with this situation is HydroFarmz, an idea I developed while studying at EARTH University, in Costa Rica. 


HydroFarmz is based on hydroponic production, where there exists the production of vegetables within an adjusted greenhouse environment. It's a great option for my community because a lot of land is not required for production in this system and training for community members is very practical.

What is Hydroponics?  Hydroponics is a technique used to grow plants in water that is enriched with essential nutrients and there is no use of soil in the growing process. Hydroponics: reduces water usage by 90% in comparison to traditional agriculture, uses little or zero pesticides,  reduces the use of fertilizers and reduces energy consumption. 

                                    

                                       (Hydroponics Nutrient Film Technique)

This initiative is of extreme importance because it will help me to fulfill my dreams of creating job opportunities and improving local and national agriculture.

The great minds that contribute to this initiative, will help to improve agricultural production in Jamaica and most importantly, improve employment rates within the community of Ritchies, Clarendon, Jamaica.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We hope to raise our target funding of $15000 through Indiegogo, which is required to initiate the construction phase and begin production.
  • The contributions will be used to purchase:
  1. A pH meter
  2. An electrical conductivity (EC) meter
  3. A total dissolved solids (TDS) meter
  4. A temperature meter
  5. Construction materials
  6. Net pots
  7. Water pumps
  8. Nutrients solutions for the system
All of the meters are required to ensure the production of high quality plants.

There are some interesting perks that you receive based on your contribution.

  • My favourite perk is the slogan competition, where contributors who donate $25 get a chance to create the winning slogan, which will become HydroFarmz official slogan.
  • Another nice perk is "Get a growbed named after you" - your name will be placed on the grow bed by using wood pyrography.

          
"Wood pyrography"
  • ALL contributors will have a dedicated page on the project's website (with their permission).
The Impact

Your contribution will certainly:

  1. Help to make a positive change in the community of Ritchies, Jamaica.
  2. Open employment opportunities for the youth of Ritchies.
  3. Help to fulfil my dreams of seeing Jamaica improve agricultural production.
  4. Begin to change the negative thoughts towards agriculture in the minds of Jamaican youth.
Risks & Challenges

  • The demand of quality product - This will be controlled with the integrated knowledge and experience gained at EARTH University.
  • The constant supply of product - This will be ensured with a planned scaled production schedule.
  • Pest Invasion  - The use of biological control methods, allelopathic plants and physical barriers  will permit a pesticide free vegetable production.

Photo: A small experimental plot at school


                        Other Ways You Can Help

Become an advocate of HydroFarmz and help fulfill this dream. Please contribute & help to spread my dream so together, HydroFarmz becomes a reality.


*NB. The pictures that you see here and in the gallery are pictures of my personal experiments at school.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST IN HYDROFARMZ!!

Contacts: hydrofarmzjm@gmail.com OR Facebook: Hydro JM Farmz

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help promote this initiative!

story:
Click here to share on your Facebook   ||   Click here to Tweet on Twitter

Open Avenue: Change a life.

Imagine an easy and efficient way to help those in your community. Open Avenue is a new P2P (peer to peer) charity that allows you to send donations directly to individuals within your community through our online mobile-app or website. Donors can send gift cards in the form of groceries, clothing, books, coffee, or a night out to their recipients. Donors can also help pay for education, housing, or transportation costs. 

Why Open Avenue? Sometimes it can feel like your charitable donations get lost in the system or become so diluted that they don’t really have an impact on those you are trying to help. Open Avenue lets you make a concentrated and direct donation to an individual so that you will see a noticeable change in their life.

With your help Open Avenue can become a registered charity so that every donation you make will be eligible for tax credits. Check out some of our unique project perks and help open an avenue in your city today!

Our Team - All successful projects start with a good idea and a great team. The Open Avenue Team is comprised of family and several close friends from university. Our team members have a variety of university backgrounds and are all highly motivated philanthropists! (That's me, Dylan, in the middle!)


How did it start? One day while sitting on a 102 year old tree stump I came up with this simple philosophy.

Improve your life by improving the lives of others.

With this philosophy in mind, I successfully defended my thesis, reduced to part-time hours at my job, lent out all of my belongings and moved to Europe with only a laptop and a suitcase to start a new philanthropic routine.

It is surprising the freedom that comes with freelance part-time working hours.  I now get to work on my projects that are important to me. For example, every month I travel to a new European city to set up a different altruism focused event. In addition to this, I have had time to develop Open Avenue, an idea that first came to me on ol' stumpy in Montreal a couple years ago. 
A goal in my life is to become a full-time philanthropist and I feel that the Open-Avenue charity is one of the first steps in accomplishing my goal. I don't desire material wealth, prestige, or power as I have seen these paths lead to unsatisfied lives of always wanting more.  

PROJECT PERKS - Two for One-FIRST WEEK ONLY!

We are on Indiegogo because we need to pay for the legal and accounting costs associated with registering a charity. The process can take up to a year and every donation helps.

For every donation you make you get to select one bonus perk below your donation value! Two for one perks!! For example, if you donate $500 you get to select any perk below $500 (i.e., Open Avenue Founder Pocket Watch, buy a nice meal,  personal rap or thank you video, or personalized family crest and motto). More information below! 



$5  +1 Karma - Increase your Karma. Your donation will lead to a life of prosperity and fortune. Karma, Yay! 


$10  +2 Karma - Double the Karma and a personal thank-you from us to you on our social media websites!


$25  Personalized Family Crest (GoT)

Have you ever wanted your family name and motto to go down in history? With a $25 donation a personalized graphic and motto from a professional graphic designer will be yours!  



$40  Personalized Message or Rap Video Performed by one of these great puppets! 

You will get one of the following puppets to act out a personalized message (you can provide a script) or personalized rap video. Great for birthday wishes, special occasions, or just for a laugh.





$100  Buy a Stranger a Warm Meal +100 Karma

We will buy someone living on the street a nice warm meal in your name. We will capture the moment and send you the photos. We will let the random recipient choose the restaurant and we will tell them that you covered their bill. 

 

         


$250  Open Avenue Founder's Pocket Watch

Join the Founder's Club! With a donation of $250, you will receive a stylish Founder's pocket watch and chain. You are now an Open Avenue Co-Founder. 

                                                 


$500  Bring Open Avenue to a City of Your Choice.

Become an Open Avenue Representative for a new city and be involved as much or as little as you want with the project. We will do all the heavy lifting and distribute the advertising materials to get the word out in your new city.


$1000  Position on our Board of Directors, Select a new city, Founder’s Pocket Watch and a Family Crest

The full bundle! $1000 donations are for those that want it all. You can join our Board of Directors where you will get a chance to be involved at the heart of the charity operations. Additionally, you will get all of the other perks listed above! 


Don't Forget! For every donation you make you get to select one bonus perk below your donation value! That is two perks for the price of one!




PROJECT COSTS -  how your donations will help

                                 


Legal billable hour costs -  $7,500 - Will cover the costs associated with billable hours relating to hiring a lawyer specialized in charity law. Hiring a specialist will ensure the process is as accurate and efficient as possible. 

Annual Accounting costs $1,500 x 2 years - Annual finance reports are required for Canadian Charities 

Promotion Material costs for New Open Avenue Cities - $2,500 - This project needs a strong relationship with the shelters and organizations that help the street population in each city. Providing advertising and printouts for these organizations will be key to spreading the word about Open Avenue in every new city.

Website Development and Maintenance: $1,500 - This will pay for the costs associated with hosting and development of the website platform for Open Avenue. 

___________________________________________________

OpenAvenue.ca BETA Website

Beta Open Avenue Donation website. 




**You can help Open Avenue grow by sharing our project on your social media pages ** 

:)

Click here to share on your Facebook   ||   Click here to Tweet on Twitter

story:
ENG - ITA


My name is Michele Valleriani, I am 23 and I live in Amandola, Marche(Italy); I organize and coordinate Basketball for Africa, an event that combines basketball and charity. Every summer we organize a 4v4 basketball tournament, with the aim to collect funds for the charitable association Sports Around the World, established by the pro basketball coach Stefano Bizzozi. It aims at building and managing basketball courts in several regions and Countries in Africa, where life conditions are rather unstable. We support these guys by giving them the chance to have fun and take their minds off daily routine; we try to teach them basketball foundamentals, the virtues of sports in general and, above all, we try to give them the chance to dream about a better future. The fourth edition of this event will take place in Amandola, from the 27th of july until the 7th of august. 

We need money(2000 €) for the tournment in Italy and for build and manage other courts in Africa.
We can send our t-shirt to the person that helps us.

 During this period many basketball clubs and players have embraces our project, such as: Gallo fan club, Pietro Aradori, Luca Vitali, Gek Galanda, Marco Cusin, Matteo Imbrò, Diego Monaldi, Manuel Vanuzzo, Leonardo Ciribeni, Giuseppe Poeta, Sutor Montegranaro, Olimpia Milano, Aurora Basket Jesi, Pallacanestro Varese, Pallacanestro Reggiana, Dinamo Sassari and Los Angeles Lakers. Furthermore, in the previous editions, we had the pleasure to host some important italian basketball personality such as: Marco Calvani, Luigi Gresta, Cesare Pancotto, Matteo Boccolini, Flavio Tranquillo, Fabrizio Della Fiori, Federico Gallinari e Giuseppe Cagnani. We are concretely collaborating with these brands: “il Centimetro”, “Silverskin” “Quota CS Sport”, “Alpitour” e “Champion”.  Our organization is constantly followed by some local and national sport media such as La Giornata Tipo, Dailybasket e Basketinside, Game six e Pick ‘n Roll.

 If you are interested in our conduct we can follow us and add us on:

 Facebook, " Basketballforafrica Amandola"

Twitter, Bfa_Amandola

Instagram, basketballforafrica_amandola

" For any info you can contact us at +39 3409484961 ( Michele ) or by sending an e-mail to michele.valleriani@hotmail.it or basketballforafrica.amandola@gmail.com

Michele Valleriani, via Treggiari 20, Amandola(FM) 63857, Italy

Mi chiamo Michele Valleriani, ho 23 anni, vivo ad Amandola(FM) e sono uno degli organizzatori di Basketball for africa, manifestazione che coniuga pallacanestro e solidarietà. Organizziamo un torneo 4v4 con l’intento di raccogliere fondi per l’associazione Sports Around the World dell’allenatore professionista  Stefano Bizzozi, che si propone di costruire e gestire campi da pallacanestro in varie zone dell’Africa, dove le condizioni sono spesso precarie. Sosteniamo i ragazzi meno fortunati di noi per farli divertire imparando i fondamentali di questo meraviglioso sport, oltre che ad educarli ad essere una squadra, facendo loro coltivare il sogno di un futuro migliore.

 La quarta edizione della manifestazione si svolgerà ad Amandola dal 27 Luglio al 4 Agosto 2015. Raccogliamo fondi per SATW tramite aste e lotterie nel periodo di svolgimento del torneo, oltre che attraverso le quote d’iscrizione e le donazioni di aziende, enti o privati. Ad oggi siamo riusciti a ricavare circa 4500€ devoluti interamente ed esclusivamente a SATW. 

Dal 2012 Molti giocatori professionisti e squadre importanti si sono impegnati ad inviarci materiale tecnico da poter mettere in palio nel corso delle lotterie e aste che si concretizzano giornalmente nel periodo di svolgimento della manifestazione. Durante il triennio di attività hanno collaborato con noi, sposando e credendo fermamente nel progetto: Gallo fan club, Pietro Aradori, Luca Vitali, Gek Galanda, Marco Cusin, Matteo Imbrò, Diego Monaldi, Manuel Vanuzzo, Leonardo Ciribeni, Giuseppe Poeta, Sutor Montegranaro, Olimpia Milano, Aurora Basket Jesi, Pallacanestro Varese, Pallacanestro Reggiana, Dinamo Sassari e addirittura i Los Angeles Lakers. Inoltre nelle edizioni precedenti sono stati nostri graditissimi ospiti Marco Calvani, Luigi Gresta, Cesare Pancotto, Matteo Boccolini, Flavio Tranquillo, Fabrizio Della Fiori, Federico Gallinari e Giuseppe Cagnani, presidente del Gallo fan club. Concrete sono state le collaborazioni con marchi come “il Centimetro”, “Silverskin” “Quota CS Sport”, “Alpitour” e “Champion”. La nostra manifestazione è seguita costantemente dalle testate giornalistiche online La Giornata Tipo, Dailybasket e Basketinside, Game six e Pick ‘n Roll.

Puoi seguirci su:

www.facebook.com/basketballforafricaamandola

www.sportsarountheworld.org

 Contatti: basketballforafrica.amandola@gmail.com

michele.valleriani@hotmail.it

cell 340 9484961
story_txt:
ENG - ITA


My name is Michele Valleriani, I am 23 and I live in Amandola, Marche(Italy);
I organize and coordinate Basketball for Africa, an event that combines
basketball and charity. Every summer we organize a 4v4 basketball tournament,
with the aim to collect funds for the charitable association Sports Around the
World, established by the pro basketball coach Stefano Bizzozi. It aims at
building and managing basketball courts in several regions and Countries in
Africa, where life conditions are rather unstable. We support these guys by
giving them the chance to have fun and take their minds off daily routine; we
try to teach them basketball foundamentals, the virtues of sports in general
and, above all, we try to give them the chance to dream about a better future.
The fourth edition of this event will take place in Amandola, from the 27th of
july until the 7th of august. 

We need money(2000 €) for the tournment in Italy and for build and manage other courts in Africa.
We can send our t-shirt to the person that helps us.


 During this period many basketball
clubs and players have embraces our project, such as: Gallo fan club, Pietro
Aradori, Luca Vitali, Gek Galanda, Marco Cusin, Matteo Imbrò, Diego Monaldi,
Manuel Vanuzzo, Leonardo Ciribeni, Giuseppe Poeta, Sutor Montegranaro, Olimpia
Milano, Aurora Basket Jesi, Pallacanestro Varese, Pallacanestro Reggiana,
Dinamo Sassari and Los Angeles Lakers. Furthermore, in the previous editions, we
had the pleasure to host some important italian basketball personality such as:
Marco Calvani, Luigi Gresta, Cesare Pancotto, Matteo Boccolini, Flavio
Tranquillo, Fabrizio Della Fiori, Federico Gallinari e Giuseppe Cagnani. We are
concretely collaborating with these brands: “il Centimetro”, “Silverskin”
“Quota CS Sport”, “Alpitour” e “Champion”.  Our organization is constantly followed by
some local and national sport media such as La Giornata Tipo, Dailybasket e
Basketinside, Game six e Pick ‘n Roll.
 If you are interested in our conduct we can
follow us and add us on:
 Facebook,
" Basketballforafrica Amandola" 
Twitter, Bfa_Amandola
Instagram, basketballforafrica_amandola
" For any info you can contact us at +39
3409484961 ( Michele ) or by sending an e-mail to michele.valleriani@hotmail.it
or basketballforafrica.amandola@gmail.com
Michele Valleriani, via Treggiari 20, Amandola(FM)

story:
All in one information app for tourists and natives. 

Every piece of information you need is scattered in a different place and there is no way way to access it all from at the same time in an easy way. Makom brings all this to the table and more. not just will you have access to all the information with the tap of a finger, it will be connected socially so you can get to know your surrounding with friends and family.

-

Whether you are on an holiday or your just living in your country this App will change your life on a day to day basis!

       


Makom WILL revolutionize the way we experience our surroundings.

WONT YOU HELP US?

In order to finish the development of this app we need some minimal funding. Please give what you can in order to help bring iMakom to the app stores. We promise to put it to good use!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Melinda MacKenzie and I am an international educator, a world traveller and someone who wants to help others. I was the Tanzania Project Coordinator at Munich International School (MIS) until July 2015 when I moved to Phnom Penh, Cambodia where I'm currently living. In this role, I visited Tanzania this past summer for the second time and saw to a number of projects (along with two other staff members and 10 students) supported but the MIS community. Tanzania is an incredible place full of friendly, humble people...but many of the people I meet and interact with need help. Just because I am no longer in my coordinator role, does not mean I will stop trying to help these people. 

After my Tanzania trip in June/July 2015, and after seeing the hardship being experienced by the Maasai people in Maasailand, Tanzania, I had to do something more. My project contact, Dr. Ole Kuney (Maasai Chief), has been writing with growing concerns of the lives of the people in his extensive tribe; since our visit in July, at least 95 people have died because of lack of basic food for survival. The cost for a 100kg bag of beans or maize is 135Euros but any amount you can donate will make a difference. To learn more about the MIS Tanzania Project, please visit:
http://blogs.mis-munich.de/tanzaniaprojects/

What We Need & What You Get

  • 100% of the funds raised (that don't go to Indiegogo) will be sent to Dr. Ole Kuney in Tanzania to help his people. You can learn more about Dr. Ole Kuney, an incredible human being, at this link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hPiQiy8rcKY
  • The only perk or incentive I can offer you is a lifetime of gratitude from me and the Maasai community you're supporting. You'll literally be saving lives!

    The Impact

Many people say they can't/won't support the Maasai people because of their cultural differences. This is a culture that doesn't support homosexuality and they still practice acts of genital circumcision that are deemed as cruel and inhumane. No, you don't have to support this...I don't support this...but I refuse to turn my back on the people of this culture who do not know any different and who need our help. I will never understand why they practise things they practice...and they will never understand why 'Mzungus' live the way we live with elective surgeries and a necessity for material things to show our wealth. We're different. To add more to this, please refer to this statement by Grade 12 student, Isabelle Lanzrein, from Munich International School whilst on the trip:
This was truly an overwhelming experience for the whole group and personally, it was a highlight of the whole trip. The Maasai are a marginalized society who are not accepted by many people due to a difference in beliefs. Although there is clearly a difference in ours and their culture, all of us are still human and the Maasai need our help in these difficult times. We were all overwhelmed at how accepting they were of us, although we come from a culture that looks down upon and makes judgments of their culture. Despite our vast differences, the Maasai people we met and encountered bared no resentment towards us and were incredibly welcoming.

At the end of the day, people are people. If you're in a position to be able to help, why wouldn't you?

Risks & Challenges

Well, unlike a start-up project or business idea, I have nothing to lose and everything to gain. I am a teacher still paying student debt in Canada (wouldn't it be nice if that student loan money could help abroad?) so I can't do this all myself. I know there are situations that need monetary attention around the world so you want to know why you should help these people? Well, I can say they were nothing but welcoming to us and completely accepting despite the vast differences in our cultures and lifestyles. I'd go as far to say they'd do the same for us in a similar situation. Or if the world continues as it does and we need to go back to the basic needs of life, they'd be able to show us how to do this.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help yourself, then please share this campaign and help give these Maasai people a fighting change. Asante sana.

Thank you for your consideration!

story:
Help us to save Farwell's Mill and Store: Resurrect a community; revive a ghost town. 

Our town was once a hub of agriculture and commerce for the entire county. The railroad connected Thorndike to Maine cities and towns hundreds of miles away. When the last Farwell brother died in 1961 with no heirs, the store closed its doors and the domino-effect took place.  The railroad stopped running, the department store, car dealerships, cheese factory, woodworking shop, lumber mill closed; local artisans no longer had markets for their goods.  Today, we have empty storefronts and a populace that struggles with employment and even literacy.
After resurrecting the buildings, we will open as Farwell's Museum & Store, with workspaces and studios for people to learn skills and produce goods for sale in-house and to the bustling coast, only 20 miles to the east. Collaborating with us, the railroad has plans to re-emerge as a tourist train to bring coastal visitors to our door. The Thorndike train to Common Ground Country Fair, which attracts over 50,000 visitors annually, boards at our doorstep.
Classes and studios will help develop expertise in the fields of literacy, woodworking, sewing, weaving, basketry, boat building, printing, bookbinding, metal smithing, shingle milling, box building, instrument-making, cooking, and sensible eating.  Our open spaces will host community activities such as senior exercise, dancing, storytelling, and concerts.
Local interest brings us willing volunteers, and much material has been donated.  We seek $200,000 to complete mortgage payments, professionally rebuild the foundations of the Mill and Store, create handicap-access to performance spaces, and to begin to stock our general store with "Products for a Healthy Homestead."


Short Summary

Most of our group has lived in Maine for over 40 years and watched the demise of small-town economies as the coastal areas fill up with second-and-third homes for summer visitors and shops full of non-essentials. Meanwhile, all our taxes continue to rise.  Rural residents turn to public assistance and have few options for local employment or education in a skill.  

Among us, we have a letterpress printer; retired teachers in the fields of math, arts, woodworking and mechanics; a chef who specializes in nutrition of local and wild foods; a wooden boat builder; a furniture-maker; literacy volunteers; an artist/restorer of precious artifacts; an economist.  In addition, our studios-to-be are already sought by other local artisans.

  • Goal #1 - to clean all the buildings and find the treasures.  Museum creates itself as we discover articles of historic interest.  This is almost done.
  • Goal #2 - to catalogue the collection of over 4,000 old books (purchased by us separately); to establish their values; to create a reading room/ library of rare books, Maine authors and manuals of historic hand skills. This is almost done.
  • Goal #3 - to finish paying our mortgage ($45,000+) and secure ownership of the buildings.
  • Goal #4 - to straighten the sunken buildings, construct new foundation and sills as needed; to make the buildings accessible to the public. Mill building has already been righted and repaired, thanks to dedicated volunteers.
  • Goal #4 - to create year-round artisanal studios on 2nd floors; to create an inviting private studio for visiting resident artists and craftspeople.
  • Goal #5 - to invite local people as interns and apprentices to these skills.
  • Goal #6 - to create an inspected kitchen that can produce 2-3 signature food products for sale.


What We Need & What You Get

  • This phase of the project is about making the four buildings safe for the public and accessible by those with special needs. 
  • We can offer railroad excursions, railcycle trips, farm suppers, wilderness trips, fair admission, classes, visiting residencies in exchange for your help.  We can custom-fit our offerings with your needs, desires and abilities.
  • All funds raised will go towards securing ownership, restoration, and opening the museum, store and studios to the public.  No one involved with the project (except local contractors hired through bid) has been paid.  None of these funds will go toward wages or salaries of workers who come from our Board.

The Impact

  • If you have never ventured to Maine for a vacation or an adventure, you are missing out on some valuable history, natural and human-made.  If you can come and take part in our project, we welcome you, as a writer, painter, carpenter, historian, archeologist, to delve into these tasks with us.
  • If you can't come to visit, your help with a donation will help bring a lonely community back to life.
  • This is the first project of such scope we have undertaken as a group.  Our varied backgrounds in the local community and organizing have helped us gain following and support from people and institutions.  
  • We are all grass-roots, down-home people, who have no aspirations toward wealth and fame.  We are not a pretentious or privileged  Board, simply a group of hands-on workers who are tackling this job because it can mean a huge difference to the economic future of our area.  Many people have had desires to raze these buildings and sell the solid timbers and contents to out-of-state markets.  We have worked earnestly for years to prevent this from happening.  Now, after forming the organization and purchasing the buildings, we hope to make a difference for the extended community.

Risks & Challenges

  • From day one, we have all pitched in with any jobs needed.  Now we have a job that's beyond our expertise and physical abilities..  We DO have a very qualified local contractor who wants to do the job for us, and we trust him to do it for as little as possible. Estimates at this time are $50,000-90,000, and we know that other costs may arise in the process.
  • Our biggest challenge is time, in that we need to generate income to pay our mortgage, insurance, taxes, small repairs and plan future projects. Creating the studios, collecting rent and having yard sales will suffice for some of these needs, and the Museum Store will begin to attract shoppers as we establish a unique product line.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate in dollars, please consider coming to get involved, and let your friends know about our little project to revive a ghost town!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Picture yourself a few short months from now being ushered into a new gourmet restaurant — Galerie 23. As you enter, the decor, the music, the aromas beckon you to a fine dining experience.  As the host seats you, your mouth waters with the anticipation of a delicious meal created by me, Chef Rob Sevcik — and you.    

Yes, I conceived, designed and created your meal, but without you none of this could have happened. You helped by backing Galerie 23, earning a place for yourself as a founder.

Who am I?


        You may know me as a contestant on the food network's popular show "chopped". Or as the chef de cuisine of "Rovers" restaurant, or from the local news and media. You may have tasted my food at the award winning restaurant "Loulay" where  I designed the menus and led the kitchen to a "restaurant of the year" award in 2014. Or even from my yearly appearance at the bite of Seattle. My name is Rob Sevcik. I am a 38 year old chef in Seattle, WA. I have been cooking for 21 years. It is all I have ever done. I have had the privilege of working in and running some of the finest kitchens in the pacific north west and now I want to bring my cuisine to the next level.I have located the perfect "studio" where I can craft endlessly. I have hand picked a team of some of the best talent Seattle's restaurants can offer and together we will work to elevate the standards of excellence for dinning in this city.

This has been my dream for as long as I can remember. Originally from Wisconsin, I started as a young man washing dishes and chopping vegetables. From there I worked my way to the west coast gaining  years of hands on training from some truly fantastic chefs. I have spent days cooking over hot stoves and nights reading cookbooks until dawn. 
With this project I can begin to fashion my true vision of what I believe cuisine can and should be. I can design not only flavors and textures on a plate but I will be able to orchestrate whole compositions of smells, sounds, sights and service that begins when a customer crosses the threshold.

What I need is a sum of $325,000 dollars to purchase a local restaurant that is for sale. I have searched and searched and this oportunity is perfect. It is the right size, has the correct equipment and is located perfectly. I know I will be able to accomplish some truly amazing things with this space if contributors can help me achieve the purchase.

from now being ushered into a new gourmet restaurant — Galerie 23. As you enter, the decor, the music, the aromas beckon
you to a fine dining experience.  As the host seats you, your mouth waters
with the anticipation of a delicious meal created by me, Chef Rob Sevcik — and you.    
Yes, I conceived, designed and created
your meal, but without you none of this could have happened. You helped by
backing Galerie 23, earning a place
for yourself as a founder. 
Who am I?
        You may know me as a contestant on the food network's popular show "chopped". Or as the chef de cuisine of "Rovers" restaurant, or from the local news and media. You may have tasted my food at the award winning restaurant "Loulay" where  I designed the menus and led the kitchen to a "restaurant of the year" award in 2014. Or even from my yearly appearance at the bite of Seattle. My name is Rob Sevcik. I am a 38 year old chef in Seattle, WA. I have been cooking for 21 years. It is all I have ever done. I have had the privilege of working in and running some of the finest kitchens in the pacific north west and now I want to bring my cuisine to the next level.I have located the perfect "studio" where I can craft endlessly. I have hand picked a team of some of the best talent Seattle's restaurants can offer and together we will work to elevate the standards of excellence for dinning in this city.
This has been my dream for as long as I can remember. Originally from Wisconsin, I started as a young man washing dishes and chopping vegetables. From there I worked my way to the west coast gaining  years of hands on training from some truly fantastic chefs. I have spent days cooking over hot stoves and nights reading cookbooks until dawn. With this project I can begin to fashion my true vision of what I believe cuisine can and should be. I can design not only flavors and textures on a plate but I will be able to orchestrate whole compositions of smells, sounds, sights and service that begins when a customer crosses the threshold. What I need is a sum of $325,000 dollars to purchase a local restaurant that is for sale. I have searched and searched and this oportunity is perfect. It is the right size, has the correct equipment and is located perfectly. I know I will be able to accomplish some truly amazing things with this space if contributors can help me achieve the purchase.

story:
There is an emerging danger hiding in our homes — lithium batteries, also known as button batteries — causing injuries and death in children. When swallowed, these small batteries get stuck in their throats. The saliva triggers an electric current, which causes a chemical reaction that can severely burn the esophagus in as little as two hours.  Lithium batteries are found in many things in our homes. They are used to power remote controls, toys, musical greeting cards, calculators, watches and other electronics. Small children often have easy access to these devices, and many parents do not know their is a risk.  More than 80 children nationwide have suffered permanent damage from injuries caused by ingesting button batteries.  Fifteen children have died, 11 of them within the last six years.  In 2010, more than 3,400 children swallowed button batteries. I have a hearing loss and use these batteries daily in my hearing aids.  I am also the mother of two small children and  I worry about the potential danger of having new and used batteries in my home.  I worry that despite my extreme efforts to keep these batteries out of reach, because they are so small and easy to mishandle, It is possible that one of my children will find one if I should ever accidentally drop one on the floor, leave a used one on the counter after replacing it, or after dropping a old one in a wastebasket.   Being a creative problem solver, I  have designed a secure way to store new and used button batteries, so they will not be accessible by children and pets.  I would like to see my invention used in all homes where children have access to these batteries, in order to eliminate the potential of more children being injured or dying. 

I have teamed up for the development of this project with Idea Design Studio, and together we have used our collaborative experience to transform this idea into a marketable platform.  I passionately feel a sense of pride about this concept and believe that it deserves immediate attention.  Because of the great market that exists for such a concept, I wholeheartedly believe in the positive impact its development and production will have on individuals and the market(s) to which it will be promoted.

What Problem Does it Solve?

The unique features of this invention will provide the following benefits for consumers everywhere:

A durable, secure storage for new and used button batteries, so they will not be attractive nuisances for small children or pets

Each compartment is designed with fail-safe ways to prevent spontaneous combustion

The separate compartments slide in and out to facilitate loading in fresh batteries and dumping the old ones

By dispensing a fresh battery one at a time, the risk of spilling many and unintentionally leaving one on the floor for a child to find is eliminated

The disposal bag is designed with a drawstring around a larger opening, so the used batteries can be dumped safely into the bag without the possibility of any being spilled or lost

When the new and used batteries are locked in this device, the risk of children ingesting these batteries will be reduced, and fewer children and pets will be injured or die 

How Does it Work?

I have been designing and documenting this concept for quite some time.  I have several “mock-up” drawings of the invention, which provide  a sense of how the concept will appear once brought into production.  This is beneficial for making any necessary modifications and revisions for improvements; thus promoting a more satisfactory and overall accommodating product.  

As currently designed in the technical drawings and 3-D models, the invention has unique features not presently available in the marketplace.  Although the system has not yet been engineered and is still in the 3-D developmental stages, an explanation of its functionality is as follows:

The Battery Vault is divided into two compartments, with one side for storing new button batteries and the other for the used ones.  There is a separate password-protected keypad for unlocking the slots on top where new batteries are dispensed and used batteries are inserted. Each side also has a master lock for opening the entire chamber when loading in new batteries or removing the old ones for disposal at an eco-friendly facility.  Separate, high-performance fans keep the compartments cool, to prevent spontaneous combustion. It is powered with long-lasting rechargeable batteries, making it convenient to carry and use when traveling away from home.

story:
We live in a degraded environment. Mainly due to greed and carelessness we have, as a society, taken some questionable decisions towards the way we manage the world thus impacting greatly the future we leave to our children. Water is polluted with contaminants, such as heavy metals and chemicals of all kinds, that are very hard to get rid of and ultimately integrate the food chain. The same can be said about the way we produce our energy, resorting vastly to nuclear energy is nonsensical. At the same time, we waste an awful lot of said energy that has been generated at high cost, and that could be salvaged . provided we have means to store it... That is indeed the whole problem with electricity, it is very hard to store efficiently so we always generate more than we actually need and the surplus is wasted as it goes back to ground.

We have devised what could be the blueprint for a self-sustained small community that addresses the problems of water purification and energy storage in an innovative and holistic way that is SUSTAINABLE. This blueprint rest on technology that is already existing but had never been put to work in such a way. No miracle here, just common sense and little technical know how.

In our model, electricity generation could be a mix of water / wind / solar generation units depending on what the close environment could better provide. The electricity generation would be coupled to low cost electrolysis facilities that actually split water into its base constituents : oxygen and hydrogen when there is over capacity in electricity generation compared to the demands of the network. With a flip switch electricity instead of being routed to ground and be wasted electricity would be sent to the electrolysis plant, wich consist merely of water reservoirs with anodes on one side and cathodes on the other. No costly apparatus there. That in turn is an effective way to store the overproduced electricity into something that could eventually serve as an energy source for other purposes when needed as hydrogen is a pollution free energy source that could be used to drive turbines and generate more electricity when needed, when there is not enough wind for example or could be used to heat the buildings on a hot water system. When Hydrogen burns, it recombines and produces PURE water. Thus, splitting water and burning subsequently the hydrogen generated has this advantage of making water purification process part of the equation.

You don't have to take clean drinking water for splitting purposes, you can take the most contaminated water there is and the contaminants would separate from water and remain in the bottom of the bucket used for electrolyte, better than any other process of purification you would end up with 100 percent pure water with no chemicals or heavy metals that could have made its way to contaminate the water

Using a process such as distillation for example, mercury or any contaminant with a very low boiling point, would most likely turn into vapor and be still present in water should distillation be used.  Likewise, filtration always will let a part of the contaminants slip through. This has no chance to happen with our technology as water is splitted to its basic constituents and then generated as PURE WATER as part of the process of burning hydrogen. No need to add even more chemicals to make it safe to drink either. No rocket science here.

And we do not even have to generate actual electricity to fuel the electrolysis process, we have floating in the air an enormous amount of energy currently generated for other purposes be it radio waves, static electricity, that also go to waste and that also could be salvaged and stored in gas form by splitting water with it. It can be easily harvested with a simple system of copper coil such devised by a 13 years old kid for $15 lately...
see : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yPhRq5r8iqg

The purpose of this fund raising effort is to have the whole process patented wich has a cost and to put together a small scale operational real life community operating on such a technology as "proof of concept". Depending upon the amount ultimately raised we could buy some land and make it the first village of its kind where no nukes are needed and everybody has fresh pure water to drink and bath in. That sounds like a good start to me... What do you say neighbour? Can we do it toghether? YES WE CAN make our world a better place.... So why not go for it all the way?

Whatever funds are collected with this event will be used towards making a "proof of concept" be it on a small or medium scale to use of the method explained with either a mix of windmill and/or solar panels as mean of producing electricity as the formula discussed is undoubtedly valid but we have to setup a small to medium facility to measure the data as how much energy creation (both hydrogen and oxygen) can be generated and how much waste water can be cleaned in the process.... As simple as that. No hoax, no lies, no carbon tax ever either ;)

story:
What if?

What if everything you'd ever learnt about Deaf people was wrong? What if over a cup of coffee you could discover that the Deaf aren't disabled.  What if by simply coming into our coffee shop you could get taste for Deaf Culture and their language? What if for a few dollars spent here you could change the world for 40 000 South Africans.  What if?

We all deserve a coffee break, right?

Coffee is our best friend whether you can hear or not.  i love coffee is South Africa's first Deaf-run coffee shop designed to break down the communication barriers between the hearing the Deaf.  We're almost ready to open but some help covering the cost of professional equipment would hugely improve our service and give us a greater chance of success. 

Our immediate needs are:

  • 2 door under counter refrigerator
  • Small deep freeze
  • Smoothie maker
  • Glass washer
  • 6 tables
  • 24 chairs
  • Staff uniforms
  • Signage
  • Services of a plumber and electrician

The Impact

South Africa has 11 official verbal languages but does not recognise South African Sign Language (SASL) which is a visual language. SASL is truly non-racial and unique to this country and differs from the over 70 other global Sign Languages. For many people born Deaf, SASL is their first and often only language. Any other language including their family “mother tongue” needs to be learned. Because SASL isn’t recognised not all Deaf schools teach it and if they do there isn't a national standard.

To add fuel to the fire Deaf children are often taught lip reading in favour of SASL. Literacy is poor and as many Deaf schools only offer a grade 10 education tertiary education and future employment are often out of reach of the average Deaf child.

This affects 40 000 Deaf South Africans and their families.

Customers will be will be encouraged to engage verbally as well as visually with Deaf staff and will be taught rudimentary SASL to order. We believe this will open dialogue and bring about the social change we need.

Where to from here?

The i love coffee Claremont store is a Proof of Concept Site and the aim is to grow into a national chain of Deaf-owned restaurants. The larger Deaf community will benefit by being incorporated into our supply and services chain.  We already have a national international retail chain interested in our concept.  If we get the first one right we stand the chance of them outsourcing all their in-house coffee shops to us - which is even more reason to open as soon as possible. 

I want to help but I don't live in Cape Town

We recognise that Cape Town, the most beautiful city in the world (Google it and you'll see it's true) may be far from you.  We will do everything we can to ensure your rewards reach you but in the spirit of paying forward, especially around the low value rewards we are happy to give you a shout out on our social media until you visit us for your  free coffee.  If you prefer to "pay it forward" will ensure someone less fortunate enjoys the coffee you have earned.

The company is set up as NPO/PBO so any donations count towards Enterprise Development B-BEEE points.  We are a Level 2 B-BEE organisation. 

We are also open to leasing to own equipment so financial assistance in the regard would be appreciated (interest free loan) and would also count towards ED Development. In exchange for any form of donation/assistance we’ll give you plenty of online & onsite branding as well as PR & Marketing exposure for your company.

story:
GRAND SPIRITS, based in the historic town of Grand Valley, is realizing its long held ambition to create Ontario’s very first renewable, community craft distillery. One hundred years since the beginning of Prohibition in the Province, the Headwaters Region will see its first legal stills come alive. A Community buy in will help to put distilling back at the heart of the community that was once the hub of Agri-Tourism for the region, long after other towns had gone “Dry”.

More than fifty percent of the distillery’s investment will be reserved for this purpose. The remaining investment will be available to social investors throughout Canada and beyond. This will ensure a high level of local ownership of the distillery, but include online opportunities here on INDIEGOGO rising in increments from as little as $40 CDN up to $2,500 CDN. Significant rewards are being extended to FIRST FOUNDERS as part of the campaign (see Perks). The first phase of the campaign kicked- off this summer, before the 149th birthday of the nation, and the official ribbon cutting ceremony of the new distillery will take place at 5PM EST on July 1st, 2017 with cocktails - for Happy Hour.

Whisky and Gin have been made in Grand Valley for more than a hundred years, thanks to pioneer immigrants from Ireland, England and the Netherlands. The new Distillery will re-instate craft distilling and serve as an engaging learning experience of the history, lore, traditional methods and secrets used to make the legendary “Grand Valley Gold”, noted for exceptional smoothness and unusually fresh qualities, to the area.  In its prime, the town boasted at least three service Tavern hotels, (The Dominion, The Commercial and The Central), in an era when all the surrounding communities and most of Ontario had been overrun by the scourge the Temperance Movement.  It is safe to say that the incorporation of Grand Valley, as independent from East Luther and Dufferin County, was specifically over the freedom to enjoy beverage alcohol in the town!  Elections were fought right through the early days of the twentieth century on this issue, prior to the Provincially-mandated Prohibition. Trainloads of tourists would come to the small town to stock up and experience the uniquely crafted products of the community, all made from local ingredients, before and during Prohibition.

The new GRAND SPIRITS Distillery will open its doors on a landmark site in the town of Grand Valley – the old schoolhouse built in 1893 that sits dramatically above Main Street.  It will use local ingredients from area family-owned farms and will be powered by green, ultra-low carbon sources.  Grand Valley itself currently produces up to 60 Megawatts of clean electricity with its wind turbines, making it one of the leading communities for renewable energy generation in the province. The significant architecture of the distillery site, as well as its associated museum displays and themed tasting room – coupled with this renewable energy leadership – will help make GRAND SPIRITS a major visitor destination.  This will also contribute to the distillery emerging as a unique player on the global stage, just as interest in craft spirits is building to unprecedented levels in North American and worldwide.

Grand Valley is uniquely positioned, high in the Headwaters Region, which itself attracted 875,000 visitors last year and generated over $65,700,000 in spending. In 2013, even the smallest of Scottish distilleries attracted an average of 25,000 visitors – including new builds on remote islands. With only 15 micro distilleries open or coming online in Ontario in 2016, and a rapidly improving legislative environment, the GRAND SPIRITS Renewable Community Distillery will be vertically integrated to grow with a demanding market for both unique travel experiences and locally-produced artisanal products from natural and sustainable sources.

Spokesman for the distillery is retired executive, mixologist and bootlegger, Jamie Stam, supported by a respected board of directors and local farming community representatives. He is currently featured in the “Faces of Headwaters” Marketing Campaign. Jamie said: “We have a truly winning combination here of a stunning natural location on the Grand River, immense historical appeal linking back to Prohibition and readily available local harvest and ingredients, plus solar and wind energy experience to bring this innovative distillery project to fruition.”

“From the outset we have envisaged the project as more than a distillery. It is an opportunity for all social investors to help this historic town build on its agricultural heritage, its community-ownership and its environmental credentials. We have amazing local resources and recipes, and will be using ingredients from our region.”

Jamie added: “There is a real buzz around small batch, crafted spirits and on the eve of our launch, we want to get the message out to the local community as well as to Gin and Whisky lovers near and far to become a founder in the future of the GRAND SPIRITS Renewable Community Distillery at the old schoolhouse.”

While major governmental hurdles remain, construction of the distillery itself will be underway this Fall and is due to be completed in early 2017. The distillery will produce craft Gin and Whisky, as well as a traditional “School Spirit” aqua vitae/white whisky/vodka for infusion and cocktails. The building will include an associated Visitor Centre/Tasting Room and gallery, with a themed late Victorian/Industrial décor, as part of a wider plan to position the area as Ontario’s premier rural tourism destination.

Thank you for becoming a part of this magnificent venture as a Founder!

doors on a landmark site in the town of Grand Valley – the old schoolhouse
built in 1893 that sits dramatically above Main Street.  It will use local ingredients from area
family-owned farms and will be powered by green, ultra-low carbon sources.  Grand Valley itself currently produces up to 60
Megawatts of clean electricity with its wind turbines, making it one of the
leading communities for renewable energy generation in the province. The
significant architecture of the distillery site, as well as its associated
museum displays and themed tasting room – coupled with this renewable energy
leadership – will help make GRAND SPIRITS a major visitor destination.  This will also contribute to the distillery
emerging as a unique player on the global stage, just as interest in craft
spirits is building to unprecedented levels in North American and worldwide.
Grand Valley is uniquely positioned, high in
the Headwaters Region, which itself attracted 875,000 visitors last year and
generated over $65,700,000 in spending. In 2013, even the smallest of Scottish
distilleries attracted an average of 25,000 visitors – including new builds on
remote islands. With only 15 micro distilleries open or coming online in
Ontario in 2016, and a rapidly improving legislative environment, the GRAND
SPIRITS Renewable Community Distillery will be vertically integrated to grow
with a demanding market for both unique travel experiences and locally-produced
artisanal products from natural and sustainable sources.
Spokesman for the distillery is retired executive,
mixologist and bootlegger, Jamie Stam, supported by a respected board of
directors and local farming community representatives. He is currently featured
in the “Faces of Headwaters” Marketing Campaign. Jamie said: “We have a truly
winning combination here of a stunning natural location on the Grand River, immense
historical appeal linking back to Prohibition and readily available local
harvest and ingredients, plus solar
and wind energy experience to bring this innovative distillery project to
fruition.”
“From the outset we have envisaged the project
as more than a distillery. It is an opportunity for all social investors to
help this historic town build on its agricultural heritage, its
community-ownership and its environmental credentials. We have amazing local
resources and recipes, and will be using ingredients from our region.”
Jamie added: “There is a real buzz around small batch, crafted spirits and on the
eve of our launch, we want to get the message out to the local community as
well as to Gin and Whisky lovers near and far to become a founder in the future
of the GRAND SPIRITS Renewable Community Distillery at the old schoolhouse.”
While major governmental hurdles remain, construction
of the distillery itself will be underway this Fall and is due to be
completed in early 2017. The
distillery will produce craft Gin and Whisky, as well as a traditional “School
Spirit” aqua vitae/white whisky/vodka for infusion and cocktails. The building will include an
associated Visitor Centre/Tasting Room and gallery, with a themed late Victorian/Industrial
décor, as part of a wider plan to position the area as Ontario’s premier rural
tourism destination. 
Thank you for becoming a part of this magnificent venture as a Founder!

story:
Indulge Right™ products are Delicious COMPLETE meal replacements that bridge the gap between the nutritional and culinary worlds -  where flavor meets nutrients in a delicious tasting line of products. 

Eating healthy doesn't mean sacrificing flavor. I’m Varouj – and as a chef, I know that “healthy food” is perceived as not tasting great and to “indulge” is to eat without health in mind. I invested years of my life learning from the best chefs plus countless hours reformulating recipes so I could offer the best taste, flavor and healthy ingredients to my client.

  Indulge Right Foods’ products are no
  different! I compare my recipes to the
  “classics” whenever applicable. I don’t
  believe you should settle for second best
  regardless if you made the choice to live free
  from allergens or you were forced to make
  that choice. 


Why Are We Different?
  • All in One Complete Plant Based Meal Replacement, Free From ALL Top Allergens and Inflammatory Ingredients and Diabetic Friendly
     
  • Chef Crafted with Flavor First
    Most products are designed to fulfill "label requirements" in a lab. Ours is created by a trained chef who is also a certified Gluten (free) Practitioner with over 24 years in the culinary world using raw and organic ingredients as much as possible.

  • Carefully Selected Ingredients to ....
    • Repair and rebuild your body with a complete plant based protein blend.
    • Balance insulin, improve gut health and stay fuller longer with Prebiotics and fiber blend.










       
    • Improve your energy and fat burning mechanism with a serving of MCT oil.
    • Improve your detoxification pathways with super-foods, vegetables and phytonutrients.
    • Balance your hormones with the right carbohydrates
    • Improve your overall health with naturally occurring vitamins, minerals and nutrients

What is Our Promise to You?

  • Scientifically Sound and Nutritionally Balanced
      I've spent 4 years researching, testing,
      tasting, and reformulating with every gluten
      free, vegan and healthy ingredient available
      to select the perfect ingredients with the best
      flavor profile for our products! 




     
    • Convenient and Readily Available Everywhere and to Everyone, Anytime
      Our first release, A COMPLETE MEAL shake, is unlike any shake you have ever had!! Delivered in a convenient, easy to
      use pouch! You can always enjoy great flavor and nutrition by keeping pouches
      in your office, your car, your suitcase or
      in your purse…ALWAYS ready!

      There is no excuse to ever need to skip a meal again or settle for something that would compromise your health. And with our great flavor, you’ll never feel the need to cheat.
    • Saves you time and money! Ready in Seconds!
      With our shakes, there is no longer the need to buy everything separately! You are saving money by not wasting highly perishable fruits and vegetables generally added to make a shake! And it's fast - just add your choice of liquid and GO!
    • Quick and Easy!
      No need to get out the blender! Our convenient single serving pouch allows you to take a complete meal with you anywhere, anytime! Take it in your purse, backpack or gym bag - or even carry it on the plane!
    • Good for the whole family!
      Have a peace of mind and enjoy a superb, sinfully delicious complete meal totally guilt-free. 

    Compare IRF with similar products.

    With Your Support and Pre-Order...

    • You will save money and enjoy special offers available on this page ONLY.
    • AS you share this page with friends and family, they will enjoy the savings as well!
    • Help curb the obesity pandemic.
    • You can change someone’s life by introducing them to Indulge Right and changing their perception of healthy foods.
    • Help us reach our goal and bring the products to market making them available and affordable to everyone, everywhere.

      Thank You For Your Support!
