story:
GRAFTING A COMMITMENT TO YOUR WINE EXPERIENCE

www.vinegraft.com

In our opinion, the mark of a successful business grows out of its relationship with people. And for us, while these people are our clients, customers or winery partners we love it when they become our friends and family.

During our years as managers for a collection of urban wineries, we discovered that as a startup in an isolated location with limited resources, our most valuable asset was our people. It became extremely empowering to learn that despite having little money, our clientele was the main thing we could grow simply by crafting a narrative which encapsulated the world of urban wine tasting.

What we learned was that people responded to our all-inclusive approach to wine tasting in an urban setting and showed support by returning with their friends to tell the stories we sat down and relayed to them. More than that, we found that people returned because they received one-on-one attention and genuine care for their wine interests and queries that they couldn’t find elsewhere.

This kind of organic growth, based on the communal sharing of much needed-to-be-told narratives about vineyards that have little, to no, representation, spoke to something much larger for us – that our guests truly needed a space in which they could voice their opinions and questions about wine in an open and creative way.
Our response to this need stemmed out of our passion to help contribute to the crafting of the urban wine experience which is actually quite different from the wine country experience. In our opinion, an urban wine experience setting offers guests the open invitation to get together to connect with others; it is not about being exclusive; it is about being inclusive and familial. 

Every wine activity that Vine Graft offers is designed to help guests come together to explore wine playfully and communally. These activities put wine exploration directly into the hands of our guests, making them interactive and highly eclectic. At the end of the day, your palate is something you want to feel like you can both own and openly explore, and our activities help you get more in tune with that part of yourself while enabling you to learn about, and help, others with theirs. 
Given that Vine Graft's foundation is built upon the grafting of specific wine interests with needs to create a tailored experience, our personal goal is to work directly with our guests, guiding them to select the most exciting wine activities to suit their needs, while exposing them to lesser-known local and urban wineries. No matter the goal, be it building team connectivity or for personal enjoyment, we'll guide you towards the experience and wine that you feel will best fit the occasion, helping you to develop friends out of co-workers and family out of friends.

In the way that one vine is particularly grafted onto another in order to create something stronger and more integrated, the activities we offer at Vine Graft promise to bring guests together in a similar way, bridging and building connections while strengthening personal palates. 

Explore our wine activities to begin building your own personally -crafted wine experience!  Follow the link to this page to learn more:

Vinegraft Activities Page


What We Need & What You Get

While every new business has costs associated with start up (and we are certainly no different) our greatest need is to fund and deliver our first few experiences. This approach will help us put together the long list of materials that we need to launch as well as give us "dry runs" on our new experiences with an audience that is interested in seeing this concept flourish. For this campaign, we are hoping to raise $5000 with much of this going directly into the perks that we will be offering. If we are fortunate enough to receive additional contributions, the monies will be spent in outreach to the market in the form of Ads to improve our search engine order as well as content-rich collateral and boosted social media campaigns.
We have a number of our activities that we are offering as perks for those who want to go big, but we want to start the fun with what everyone, no matter their level of contribution via The Launch Party! If you hit the $50 contribution level that will get you 2 tickets to our Launch Party. We will be conducting a few samples of our wine activities at that event so that you can get a first-hand look at what we do at Vine Graft. Beyond this, you can select a contribution level that gains you perks such as Building Your Own Flight, Mapping Your Palate, Meeting Your Palate, Top Pairing! or Paint and Palate experiences. Anyone who contributes, no matter the level, will receive a pair of tickets to our launch.


The Impact

If you think about our name, Vine Graft, it makes so much sense in terms of what we do. We are connecting to people, places and wine all across the board. And what we have found is that there is a huge need for it. Our business was born out of a natural and logical fulfillment of that need.  
Your contributions will help get a unique and innovative business launched. We envision a day where this approach could reach wine enthusiasts everywhere to create discovery and commerce.  
We did not simply wake up one day and say, "Wow! Let's have a wine experiences business!" What does that mean anyway? This decision revealed itself to us while working our tails off in the industry. We have seen what works, what doesn't work and what is missing. Vine Graft is the culmination of our experience and the collaboration between ourselves, our customers, our associates and people we have met in this business.  


Risks & Challenges

The good news here is that at this stage, we are not burdening this business with lots of cost. It won't take much to get us going. We don't need "brick and mortar" or a big investment in inventory, so at this early stage, the risk is minimal. Our challenge is in getting the Vine Graft concept out there -- to get ourselves off the ground and flying which is why this campaign is really geared toward delivering the perks. It's one way that we can begin. Writers have to pick up a pen, builders start with a shovel. We need to deliver our experiences to more people and let the buzz begin.


Other Ways You Can Help

So if you aren't up for a wine experience at your company or at your next party, we understand. Please don't buy a perk and not use it! You can help us by spreading the word inside your organization or among friends where you believe there is a fit. Even if you don't think it's a fit, sometimes it doesn't hurt to mention, right?  

Thank you,

Karen and Dave

www.vinegraft.com

story:
Yes Please More Please Seduction Supper Recipe Cards: Play with Your Food and Each Other.

It’s about fun.
It's about romance.
It’s an aphrodisiac experience.

Support us at the $25 level to receive your set of 36 seduction supper recipe cards.

Yes Please More Please Seduction Supper Recipe Cards answers the question: what awesome gift can I get for Valentine’s Day, an anniversary, or a birthday? Purchase these fun recipe cards as a gift or, better yet, create a seduction supper experience for your love!

Yes Please More Please Recipe Cards encourage you to play with your food and each other.

sample recipe card box cover design

We’re on a mission to create intimacy and connection.

Let’s be real. We’re living in a fast-paced, multi-tasked, overworked world. When was the last time you booked a romantic evening with your love, or prepared a sexy meal at home? It’s okay, we’ve all been there. Yes Please More Please is on a mission to help make intimacy and connection easy and fun.

Since late 2014, the Yes Please More Please team has been operating a super sexy supper club in our nation’s capital. Did you see us reviewed in Washington Post?! Awesome, right?

Our team is taking all the fabulousness we’ve learned from running our pop-up supper club so you can create an amazing experience at home!

can you imagine this sexy box in your local bookstore?

The recipe card details:

Enjoying food is already a truly sensual experience: look, feel, smell, flavor, and taste. Yes Please More Please Seduction Suppers turn up the heat by including aphrodisiacs in every recipe. Ingredients such as basil, coffee, honey, chocolate, chili peppers are proven to have positive effects on the body.

The Yes Please More Please team has created 36 aphrodisiac recipes: 12 mains + 12 appetizers + 12 desserts = a three-course seduction supper for each month of the year!

We love health, the environment, and compassion. Half of all the recipes are vegan for heart health! As we always say, “The heart is the most important organ for love making.” Don’t worry: omnivores will certainly find meals they love, too.

Yes Please More Please Seduction Supper Recipe Cards are simple to use! We want you to spend less time in front of the stove and more time making connections and creating intimacy! Pick your three recipes, take the cards to the grocery for ingredients, and create your meal. Most recipes take 30 minutes or less to prepare!

The card deck also includes sexy tips for setting the mood, creating connection, and stimulating intimacy.


The Team:

Sarah Massey, Founder & Chief Connections Officer
Sarah loves to cook, to eat, and to feed others! Her short stint as the Innkeeper at DC’s most romantic B&B, the Swann House, inspired Sarah’s love of hosting. Sarah is also the owner of DC’s top PR agency for arts, culture and social change, Massey Media, LLC. As Chief Connections Officer for Yes Please More Please, Sarah’s role is product development, marketing, and partnerships.

Stephanie Lenorovitz, Seduction Experience Designer 
Stephanie has been devouring life since she started living. With a background in advertising and marketing and a fascination for understanding behavior, she has evolved into a champion for the user throughout her projects. As a UX designer, Stephanie tailors products to create intuitive and enjoyable experiences. When she's not working you can find her living and admiring the beauty of the outdoors through; rock climbing, snowboarding, riding her motorcycle or watching sunsets on the beach.

Krishna Patel, Seduction Mistress Manager & Financial Advisor
With a strong background in marketing and brand experience enhancement, Krishna has an incredible dedication to bringing you the best product possible. With unique meal plans that entice you and your partner, Krishna sees to it that you will be back for more. Overseeing all aspects of project management and finances, Krishna will ensure we are always capable of more at Yes Please More Please.


What your funding supports: $17,999

Recipe cards are the first product to be launched by Yes Please More Please. With your help, we will demonstrate that there’s a healthy demand and market for romantic cuisine-centered offerings.

Your contributions fund the production of these first edition recipe cards. We’ve already developed, written, and tested the recipes. So fun! Our request from you is to help us design, print, and deliver. We’re working with an amazing photographer, our Seduction Experience Designer will lay out the cards, we will ship them to the printer, and then finally mail to you!

The production of the recipe cards: design, photography, printing, marketing, and delivery. 82%

The Yes Please More Please branded perks and delivery. 18%



The super fine print: if we exceed our fundraising goals, we will use the funds for further business development, such as developing the Seduction Supper in a box! If we super, super exceed the goals, we’ll bring our super popular recipe cards to stores near you!  THANK YOU so much!


And thank you for the social media love. Here are sample tweets:

I just funded @YesPleaseMorePl seduction supper recipe cards! #yespleasemoreplease https://igg.me/at/yespleasemoreplease #loverecipes

For $25, you can help @YesPleaseMorePl create and deliver seduction supper recipe cards #yespleasemoreplease https://igg.me/at/yespleasemoreplease

Facebook:

Join me in funding @yespleasemoreplease’s dream to create more intimacy and connections. https://igg.me/at/yespleasemoreplease

I just supported @yespleasemoreplease’s new seduction supper recipe cards for $25. Get your first edition now. https://igg.me/at/yespleasemoreplease

For $25, you can help @YesPleaseMorePl create and deliver seduction supper recipe cards #yespleasemoreplease https://igg.me/at/yespleasemoreplease

story: Help Austin Honey Company recover from recent flooding events at Bernhardt Farm in Elgin, TX.  We have lost a total of 28 beehives during three separate flood events during 2015 in May, June, and October.  As a small artisan honey company, this is a large loss.  We need to rebuild our apiaries and purchase high-quality and gentle nucleus colonies of bees for 2016.   You can help us by adopting a beehive, thus providing a direct economic contribution to our operation now.  This direct contribution will go to purchasing new colonies of bees now and helping us offset the high costs of getting bees built up to pollinate crops and produce honey through next year.  Our bees reside on local organic farms that are doing an outstanding job of producing wholesome food for our local community in the Austin, TX area, as well as, contributing to greater ecological diversity and a healthier environment.  Our bees reside on the following farms--Bernhardt Farm, Green Gate Farms, Springdale Farm, Tecolote Farm, Milberg Farm, Sunrise Farm, and Fruitful Hill Farm.  Our bees perform a vital pollination service thus helping our local producers have higher yields more consistently.  We do not charge for this pollination service, as it is a win-win for us and the farms.  Our bees thrive on the local farms and produce an excellent crop of raw wildflower honey and beeswax, which we offer to the Austin area community through farmer's markets and local stores.

story:
Summary

On February 14, 2000 a tragic hit & run car accident took the life of Carolyn Moor’s husband, Chad Moor. In an instant the love of her life and the father of her two- and four-year old daughters was gone leaving her with nowhere to turn. Unexpectedly, Carolyn found herself mentoring other widows which led to her appearance on TLC and The Oprah Winfrey Show in 2006. A multitude of widows feeling alone in the world contacted her and over the past three years, opening her home, Carolyn has mentored more than 400 hundred widows successfully helping them discover purpose and meaning.

Thus started Modern Widows Club which became a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization in 2014 with 9 chapters throughout the U.S. and a long waiting list of those wanting to start chapters in their hometowns. With its 30 day-to-day volunteers and nearly 20 dedicated professionals providing pro bono in-kind services to help launch this new nonprofit organization that serves to empower widows, Modern Widows Club is poised to expand and reach thousands more widows.

The Mentoring Model

Widows feel alone. While grief counseling, support groups, etc. may help get through the initial trauma, they are temporary. Modern Widows Club’s mentoring model is designed to help widows regain a sense of self and lean into life with dignity and confidence to build personal resilience. Using the mentoring model MWC has successfully helped over 3,000 of its members to get back in step with life to the point where they are giving back to others. Thus, our slogan Move Forward While Reaching Back.

Needs and Impact

1. Ensure ongoing services

  •  More than 15,000 widows are served on a daily basis via Modern Widows Club chapters and  local and online communities. For example, each month an average of 50 new widows attend socials led by MWC leadership teams at the 9 existing chapters throughout the United States. 

2. Launch more local chapters and reduce wait lists

  • Over the past year a list has been accrued of more than 75 widows who meet MWC’s leadership requirements and have been waiting to start chapters and begin mentoring widows in their hometowns.

As a start-up nonprofit, based on our strategic planning and proposed budget approved by our  Board of Directors, this campaign’s $100,000 will significantly assist Modern Widows Club in areas such as building a needed infrastructure and legal counsel, creating a chapter leader training toolkit and conferences, chapter growth and travel, technical support, and  volunteer year-end appreciation events.

Over 85% of funds go toward our community programs and services. Please, visit our Guidestar page for more information and Great Nonprofits for community reviews showing how we make a difference.

We invite you to play a role in touching the lives of those who feel undervalued and forgotten. Your contribution, regardless of size, will have a direct impact in helping Modern Widows Club to continue, and expand, its proven approach helping widows get back in step with life and give back to others. Thank you for your support!

Sample Success Stories

   (Names are real with expressed permission)

  • Cindy, 61, lost her husband to a sudden heart attack. Her children grown and living on their own, she and her husband loved to travel. After her husband passed she felt devastated and eventually lost her home. Searching online she found MWC on Facebook and decided to travel to meet Carolyn in person. She sought advice and guidance hoping to someday find the strength to move forward and give back too. After 18 months of mentoring, Cindy launched her own MWC chapter and has touched the lives of over 275 widows.  Cindy’s life has been touched also. After 3 1/2 years of feeling lost, but still full of hope and joy, Cindy remarried and honeymooned in Europe. Cindy’s new husband, Robert, is grateful for MWC, which contributed to her increased faith and joy to continue choosing life as a catalyst which shaped the woman he fell in love with and supports her in her service to widows.


  • Vickie, 59, a florist and her grown daughter, Yvonne, 32, became widows within 18 hours of each other. Vickie’s husband passed in his sleep on vacation and Yvonne’s husband sadly took his own life. Yvonne needed Vickie in her deep grief yet Vickie needed others to help her pick up the pieces. MWC gave Vickie the community and role models she was seeking. With her new found strength she uses her experience as a florist to give back joy on a daily basis. At the Orlando chapter, thanks to Vickie, every woman leaves an MWC social with one of her flowers and she has even provided flowers for other members’ events and weddings. 


  • Karen, 29, and mother of a 2 year old boy, found herself widowed when her husband was murdered. (His killer has not been found.) Due to mounting stress and loss of numerous sources of support, like many widows, eventually Karen lost her job. Overwhelmed with the extreme pressures of widowhood and solo parenting Karen found herself lost in a fog without anyone around to help her understand these feelings. Daily she hoped and prayed for evidence that she would overcome her tragedy and finally found reassurance through her involvement with Modern Widows Club. Once she experienced her life coming back together, she launched Widows at Work, a company that assists widows in transitioning back to the workplace after their loss as well as provides training to organizations on how to handle grief in the workplace. 

Little Known Facts About Widows

(Source: 2009 U.S. Census Bureau.)

  • Nearly 1 million women will become widowed this year.
  • There are more than 12 million widowed women in the United States (4 million under 65 and not retired), 245 million worldwide.
  • 70% of all married women will face widowhood in their lifetimes.
  • Widows in the United States range in age between early 20s to late 80s with the national average 59.
  • Few empowerment services and programs exist to help widows overcome their complex social, economic, and emotional hardships
  • 49.7% of U.S. widows have a household income in the past 12 months less than $25,000

For More Information 

(click links below)

Modern Widows Club 

Modern Widows Club Chapters

Success Stories

How to Get Involved

Modern Widows Club’s Founder

If you are a widow, you are not alone! Please find a safe place to be understood, loved and encouraged- join us at #OneMillionWidows Facebook Group Page!

from Zenspirations by Joanne Fink.

story:
Help us to save The Grain Tower

The Grain Tower, which has been decommissioned as a military building in 1956, remains derelict and unused till today. It’s been privately owned since 2005 but none of the owners did anything with this historically important building to bring it back to its previous glory.

Our aim is to restore it and made it available to general public as an observatory of diverse, local wetland bird population. Its tower, with several levels, will be perfect for both scientific and pleasure observation.

We strongly believe places like The Grain Tower should serve general public free of charge. Enough of these places have been turned into luxurious hotels which with its prices remain inaccessible to majority of us.

It is a designated Grade II listed building (from 1986) as well as a part of Scheduled Monument (nationally important historic building) – our aim will be to keep it accessible to general public and serve it in manner which will help preserving our flora and fauna.

There is a possibility of The Grain Tower being sold to the next owner before we will finish our collection (it is available to buy and we have to bear that in mind) – in such a case we will short-list 4 equally important and neglected sites and ask all the participants to vote for their choice.

What we need?

To buy and restore a building like this will not be easy and cheap. To keep a restoration in line with its requirements of the Great Listed building we will need at least £2,000,000. Additionally, this money will allow us set a base on shore, which will help us in later stage to maintain the tower.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi! My name is Michael Palombo, husband, father, cook, artist, artisan coffee roaster and owner at Fans Of Film cafe and V Roast Coffees.  I've worked at many local Albuquerque kitchens over the years and love putting my talent into food and coffee.
  • Our lease is up and no idea when we'll loose the location so we've decided to get excited and make the effort to move in a big way. We don't have the money to open a new location as of current so we've come to Indiegogo to share our passion to open a vegan cafe coffee house and bakery. We believe in what we're doing and believe you will want to help. 
  • I was for the most part homeless and living in a burned out retail building that was half remodeled from prior tenant. I finished the remodel myself and used it to live in and produce art and indie film projects. Being even further down on my luck I decided to take the thousand bucks in my pocket and get a business license for Fans Of Film Cafe and a coffee maker. In 2012 I open the space to the public and all I had was a projector on ceiling and a single coffee maker. 5 years later we're roasting our own organic coffees and have a small kitchen that provide breakfast lunch and a vegan menu. Check out my video and I will show you the cafe. 

  • We need a bigger kitchen to include dinner in the new place and have my vegan enchiladas, tacos, meatloaf and chicken fried steak with green chile gravy and mash potatoes. I don't use a gas grill, I use new technology that involves induction cook tops and cookware. We believe we have a greener footprint than any cafe in Albuquerque and currently the cafe bakes all vegan pastries, muffin, scones and cookies.
     

  • Current vegan menu

What We Need & What You Get

  • You get to make a difference in a world that depends on the killing of animals to survive. Our perks are small but the outcome of your contribution is huge beyond measure. In this recent report by CNN <--link, going vegan could save the planet. 
  • $50,000 will cover remodel and move, the rest will be on us to take our current customer base. The money will also insure we survive the first few months of re establishing a new location.
  • Your help will give me and my wife and business partner the ability to overcome the huge financial burden of moving into a bigger space and ensure our success.

The Impact

  • Our impact on the community and world at large would be huge environmentally. If we cook 50 vegan meals a day we'll save everyday 16 animals, 17600 gallons of water, 720 ponds of grain and 480 SQ feet of forest.
  • Being a cutting edge organic coffee house and vegan cafe it would be a game changer for our community.
  • Our coffee roasting process has a carbon foot print of 19 to 1 in emissions compared to gas drum roasting. We use new induction and air frying technology for our cooking for a 0 carbon emissions. 
  • It might be hard to connect meat and carbon emissions; but it turns out eating meat increases your carbon footprint more than driving your car.
  • Your help will give us the power to change peoples view on food and it's impact on the environment and world.  
  • Being a a small struggling coffee shop to a thriving cafe and coffee house roaster as been a true third wave experience. So lets now take it beyond the wave into the future of a cruelty free "V Roast Coffees" an all organic coffee house and vegan cafe.
 

Risks & Challenges

  • There is always risk in the food business but we believe good coffee and food at the right price will give us what we need to succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • For direct support and a simple fair trade of money for product go to our coffee website vroast.com and grab a pound. Roasted and shipped the same day.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Our limited edition shirt are two sided, Fans Of Film Cafe on front and V Roast Coffees on back.

Our coffee is always organic and shipped fresh.

story:
*Short Summary:

Allison owned the premier women's fitness/pole dancing studio in Boise, Idaho for several years before we united and began traveling the world in what can be called a spiritual journey. She built her business from the ground up and left it thriving in the hands of former customers-turned-teachers/owners. It was too much a commodity for the community to not continue the business.

Wind had completed massage therapy schooling between Boise, ID, and Sedona, AZ in 2012, in addition to his Reiki education and other Complementary and Alternative Therapies. He set out to the Amazon at the end of 2012 to dive into shamanism, mysticism, and heart-based consciousness. His background of 20 years Navy concluded with a Graduate-level Certificate in Social Entrepreneurship and Non-Profit Management at the University of Minnesota's prestigious Humphrey School of Public Affairs. In 2016 he added Tantric Yoga Teacher Training (RYT 200) to his toolbox. 

Together Wind and Allison have amassed thousands of miles of global travels in the 4 years we've been together, all being a deeply insightful inner journey. The knowledge has always been that in the right timing, we would open our own center to begin giving back to our community the knowledge of self-journey that we've amassed along our cumulative life experiences. And we've learned a lot.

We have a long-standing webpage for our services which saw a 300% increase in business beginning August of 2016. With our recent work at a local healing center, we were given the final tools and boost to recognize that what we have learned has high value in Santa Fe and to the global traveling community.  

*Short term (next 12 months) and long term objectives:

We are going to start immediately with Aerial Silk Yoga, mat yoga, and Energy/Reiki/Massage services. Aerial Silk and even Pole dance have been highly requested from a vast amount of various local population seeking to enhance their movement and empowerment in ways that don't yet exist in the Santa Fe market.

*As July is said to be of the busiest times in Santa Fe, and the location for our business is prime in the downtown area, we expect that even this modest start will hit a huge success immediately. 

By the end of the tourist season, in November, we anticipate being well-known and thriving with the local community - they will be our target membership. This will provide us sustainable growth even as the population decreases to a sleepy winter baseline.

One year from opening we anticipate seeing further expansion into a larger space, or a joint space in the same building, to accommodate what should easily be a busy class and therapy schedule, multiple teachers and therapists, and a full membership base. 

Beyond 12 months will be experimenting with alternative therapies and other classes, and include retreats both locally and abroad. Hosting various teacher trainings for yoga and energy therapies will be expanded, or initiated if they hadn't yet been implemented. The longterm vision is to create a community for local and traveling populations who seek deeper fulfillment and self-understanding, and for those who can help hold this space while aligned with our vision.

 

What We Need & What You Get

*Well - we need to raise at least $3,000.00 by July 1st!

To go "bare minimums" for our services and classes, here is a list of what we need to pay for immediately, not including insurance:

*Start-up expenses:

Yoga hammocks (6): $500

Yoga mats (10): $100

Blocks and blankets: $100

Massage table linens: $100

Foot towels: $50

2 chairs for foot massage: $100

Curtains: $200

Aromatherapy scents: $50

Massage lotion: $15

Décor: $200

Business registration: $35

Certificate of Occupcy (fire code): $75

Massage temp license: $75

Signage: $300

A-frames (for walk-by traffic): $150

Flyers: $40

Logo: $450

Mindbody: $99/month

Total: $2640 - which doesn't include the $1800 first-month's rent and deposit

*PERKS: 

We are offering some great perks for your donations! See our Perk Section for details and be sure to claim yours when you select your contribution!

The Impact

If we don't meet our goal, any monies will still be applied to the business. We are going to open on July 1st one way or the other! So all of your contributions will be utilized towards opening the doors, and we are grateful for anything you are able to contribute to assist in this!

We discovered that Santa Fe is an incredible location for what we offer, and seeking newer ways of inner-balance and awareness. We do very well in our daily community interactions and receive a lot of positive feedback from local business owners for what we are bringing - they are ready for something new and balancing! 

The benefits exceed just the local community, however, since the tourist population is a major part of what makes Santa Fe so special. So in truth, we are establishing an oasis of self-growth for an increasingly global community. This is what excites us and encourages us the most!

Risks & Challenges

The largest risk we run is in not being able to get our presence known widely enough out of the gate. We take a great leap of faith that within the first month we can find sustainability, and that we can offer enough desired classes and services to satisfy the demands...and to not burn ourselves out trying. But isn't that what entrepreneurship is all about?

At this stage, we have hit the obvious point in our paths that we have to open our own place. We have all we need to be tremendously successful and to see vast growth right from the beginning, to include faith and guidance. The first steps are daunting for us, but we know that we are here to be of service and to share joy in ways that the world is seeking. We are ready, and we are going all-in with learning from each moment! That is the key to our success as we move forward.

*Other Ways You Can Help

Any donation you can make is going to be appreciated and immediately paid forward to a community larger than any of us as individuals. So you can envision that every dollar you donate is going into a vessel of social health and growth. Truly, that is the bottom line!

If you are unable to help, we do know how much you would do so if you could! So we just ask that you share our FB (click here to see and like), our InstaGram (here), and this campaign with others! It's that easy!

We are grateful that you've given this due thought, and are looking forward to seeing you in the studio for a class, an energy session, and in general because you are special to us!
story_txt:
*Short Summary:
Allison owned the premier women's fitness/pole dancing studio in Boise, Idaho for several years before we united and began traveling the world in what can be called a spiritual journey. She built her business from the ground up and left it thriving in the hands of former customers-turned-teachers/owners. It was too much a commodity for the community to not continue the business.
Wind had completed massage therapy schooling between Boise, ID, and Sedona, AZ in 2012, in addition to his Reiki education and other Complementary and Alternative Therapies. He set out to the Amazon at the end of 2012 to dive into shamanism, mysticism, and heart-based consciousness. His background of 20 years Navy concluded with a Graduate-level Certificate in Social Entrepreneurship and Non-Profit Management at the University of Minnesota's prestigious Humphrey School of Public Affairs. In 2016 he added Tantric Yoga Teacher Training (RYT 200) to his toolbox. 
Together Wind and Allison have amassed thousands of miles of global travels in the 4 years we've been together, all being a deeply insightful inner journey. The knowledge has always been that in the right timing, we would open our own center to begin giving back to our community the knowledge of self-journey that we've amassed along our cumulative life experiences. And we've learned a lot.
We have a long-standing webpage for our services which saw a 300% increase in business beginning August of 2016. With our recent work at a local healing center, we were given the final tools and boost to recognize that what we have learned has high value in Santa Fe and to the global traveling community.  
*Short term (next 12 months) and long term objectives:
We are going to start immediately with Aerial Silk Yoga, mat yoga, and Energy/Reiki/Massage services. Aerial Silk and even Pole dance have been highly requested from a vast amount of various local population seeking to enhance their movement and empowerment in ways that don't yet exist in the Santa Fe market.
*As July is said to be of the busiest times in Santa Fe, and the location for our business is prime in the downtown area, we expect that even this modest start will hit a huge success immediately. 
By the end of the tourist season, in November, we anticipate being well-known and thriving with the local community - they will be our target membership. This will provide us sustainable growth even as the population decreases to a sleepy winter baseline.
One year from opening we anticipate seeing further expansion into a larger space, or a joint space in the same building, to accommodate what should easily be a busy class and therapy schedule, multiple teachers and therapists, and a full membership base. 
Beyond 12 months will be experimenting with alternative therapies and other classes, and include retreats both locally and abroad. Hosting various teacher trainings for yoga and energy therapies will be expanded, or initiated if they hadn't yet been implemented. The longterm vision is to create a community for local and traveling populations who seek deeper fulfillment and self-understanding, and for those who can help hold this space while aligned with our vision.
 
What We Need & What You Get
*Well - we need to raise at least $3,000.00 by July 1st!
To go "bare minimums" for our services and classes, here is a list of what we need to pay for immediately, not including insurance:
*Start-up expenses:
Yoga hammocks (6): $500
Yoga mats (10): $100
Blocks and blankets: $100
Massage table linens: $100
Foot towels: $50
2 chairs for foot massage: $100
Curtains: $200
Aromatherapy scents: $50
Massage lotion: $15
Décor: $200
Business registration: $35
Certificate of Occupcy (fire code): $75
Massage temp license: $75
Signage: $300
A-frames (for walk-by traffic): $150
Flyers: $40
Logo: $450
Mindbody: $99/month
Total: $2640 - which doesn't include the $1800 first-month's rent and deposit
*PERKS: 
We are offering some great perks for your donations! See our Perk Section for details and be sure to claim yours when you select your contribution!
The Impact
If we don't meet our goal, any monies will still be applied to the business. We are going to open on July 1st one way or the other! So all of your contributions will be utilized towards opening the doors, and we are grateful for anything you are able to contribute to assist in this!
We discovered that Santa Fe is an incredible location for what we offer, and seeking newer ways of inner-balance and awareness. We do very well in our daily community interactions and receive a lot of positive feedback from local business owners for what we are bringing - they are ready for something new and balancing! 
The benefits exceed just the local community, however, since the tourist population is a major part of what makes Santa Fe so special. So in truth, we are establishing an oasis of self-growth for an increasingly global community. This is what excites us and encourages us the most!
Risks & Challenges
The largest risk we run is in not being able to get our presence known widely enough out of the gate. We take a great leap of faith that within the first month we can find sustainability, and that we can offer enough desired classes and services to satisfy the demands...and to not burn ourselves out trying. But isn't that what entrepreneurship is all about?
At this stage, we have hit the obvious point in our paths that we have to open our own place. We have all we need to be tremendously successful and to see vast growth right from the beginning, to include faith and guidance. The first steps are daunting for us, but we know that we are here to be of service and to share joy in ways that the world is seeking. We are ready, and we are going all-in with learning from each moment! That is the key to our success as we move forward.
*Other Ways You Can Help
Any donation you can make is going to be appreciated and immediately paid forward to a community larger than any of us as individuals. So you can envision that every dollar you donate is going into a vessel of social health and growth. Truly, that is the bottom line!
If you are unable to help, we do know how much you would do so if you could! So we just ask that you share our FB (click here to see and like), our InstaGram (here), and this campaign with others! It's that easy!
We are grateful that you've given this due thought, and are looking forward to seeing you in the studio for a class, an energy session, and in general because you are special to us!

story:
I love bookstores. I don’t know many people that don’t: they are comforting, engaging, educational, and unique, spending time in a bookstore always rejuvenates me; just being around the thoughts, the feelings, the words, the ideas, and the imagination of so many it is enthralling, and it is empowering.

I grew up in a small town in the heart of the Texas Hill Country: Boerne, Texas. It’s a unique town, and it is home to a variety of people, and it continues to pull people to it. After college I left home, as many people do, I travelled the United States searching for something or I thought, rather, that I was in search of something, really I was learning how to allow myself to develop and to grow. I lived in Idaho, Utah, New York, and New Mexico, working in bookstores and writing. I moved back to Boerne a couple of years ago after spending four years in Santa Fe, New Mexico—though I have always dreamed of opening a bookstore it was in New Mexico that I began to amuse the idea with a real passion. I started selling books online out of the kitchen of my two bedroom home through abebooks.com, amazon.com, biblio.com, and alibiris.com. Moving back to Boerne I opened my bookstore in beta renting a room in a multi-vendor building on Main Street that I called Wardrobe Books.

I dream of a brick-and-mortar bookstore, tea, and coffeehouse, in a building not far from the river (438 S. Main Street Boerne, Texas 78006), where I’ll sell new, used, remainder, rare, and collectible books, a hybrid business model developed from the bookstore chain Books Inc. of San Francisco and Op. Cit. Books of Santa Fe (where I worked while in New Mexico), we will host author readings and events, various workshops, open-mics, community readings, show TED talks, and work with the local schools and shelters. We will offer a menu of teas from all over the world, not unlike The Teahouse in Santa Fe which is located at the peak of Canyon Road, as well as various coffees. I want to create, to build, and to develop a place for the people of my community to come together.

Boerne, Texas does not have a bookstore, in fact, there are no bookstores within 30 miles of Boerne in any direction. The city has 10 public schools, 4 private, and is considering the merits of a college/university. Boerne is the largest city in the 5th fastest growing county (Kendall County) in the United States. I believe whole-heartedly in this bookstore, I have a passion and a love for literature that has only grown, and shadowed me throughout these United States, that drive accompanied by the undeniable market success of a bookstore in Boerne, Texas is a catalyst for amazing things.

LiftFund is a designated community development financial institution created to provide credit and services to small businesses, they have agreed to move forward with a loan request to establish CommuniTea Books if we can raise $40,000. I am asking for, and would be forevermore grateful, if you all would support this campaign, to be a part of the initial funding that would inspire, and develop CommuniTea Books. Sincerely, Thank you.

 

James Bonner

story:
Short Summary

From inception, Breathing Room has always intended to be a place where you can come and learn to be yourself through the offerings and teachings of yoga. Over the past seven years, not only has Breathing Room served as a space for that individual growth, it has flourished into a community of individuals coming together to learn, play, collaborate and serve the larger good of New Haven and beyond. As we see this growth and dedication to practice and community flourish, we recognize it is time to create more capacity for all that is coming to be . . . and in order to do so, we physically need more square footage!

We are excited to announce that we have found the perfect location for more Breathing Room! 216 Crown Street will be an 8,000 square ft. Yoga and Wellness Center that will accommodate three yoga studios, an in-house Naturopathic doctor’s office, a float center, aerial yoga, co-working space, plus treatment rooms for massage, acupuncture and energy healing. WAHOOOO!

This location will not only contain everything one needs to enrich their personal health and wholeness, but it will also encompass Breathing Room’s future service projects and nonprofit organization; a nonprofit we will dedicate to expanding the reach of the full eight limbs of yoga into the greater community of Connecticut. 

By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping to bring an invaluable source of wellness offerings to our community and beyond, creating more space for additional yoga offerings, trainings, community events and service projects! Just a few of the offerings that will be supported by this new space include:

  • Additional yoga and meditation classes
  • Aerial yoga
  • Yoga therapy
  • Pre & postnatal yoga
  • Mom & me yoga (yes, we will have an elevator for strollers!)
  • An in-house naturopathic doctor
  • Massage
  • Acupuncture
  • Float tanks
  • Large coworking space to read, relax, and/or do work between classes
  • National trainings
  • Community education from health and wellness lectures to mindfulness coaching, cooking classes and more!
  • And of course, our upcoming 300 hour yoga teacher training!

What We Need & What You Get

The New BRYC project budget is $165,000. With a personal investment and a small business loan, we are looking to raise $40,000, one quarter of the total cost.

Funds raised will go toward:

  • Updating the current sprinkler system
  • Installation of new HVAC- a heating and cooling system
  • New flooring

We have AMAZING perks and incentives for your contribution, all coming from the amazing future offerings at BRYC ranging from

  • Yoga classes- including private and small group instruction
  • T-shirts & swag
  • Naturopathic consultations and full appointments
  • Float sessions
  • Massages
  • Acupuncture sessions
  • Reiki sessions
  • FREE PARKING for six months to a year!

If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds will go to what is needed most, ie Safety and livable needs, ie: heating and sprinkler systems.

Note: Many of these perks can be redeemed before the end of the campaign!

 

The Impact

I believe if you are reading this you have experienced first hand the impact of the Breathing Room community on yourself or someone you care for. There truly is something special here and it is not just the walls that we inhabit, it is so much larger. It is the presence of Peace, Assurance, Gratitude and Love that is instilled in us when we choose to truly do the work for positive change in ourselves and the communities we love. It is these values that Breathing Room truly embodies and is built upon. The students, teachers, volunteers, graduates and four- legged beings have and always will be soul of this community.ith this new space, we continue to build upon these core values in great efforts to create positive and important impact in the lives of all seeking that greater connection and higher awareness.

We are thrilled to be working to create a non profit portion of the Breathing Room community that will come to being in the year ahead. This will be a service project geared to support the community by using all the limbs of yoga, not just asana. We will be working with local schools, shelters and service communities to provide wellness and educational opportunities to individuals, families and organizations. The new space will be home to this important new Breathing Room endeavor.

Breathing Room was born from a dream and the contributions of this community. Six years ago, after out-growing  our 1.5 year pop-up in the English Market building, I compiled my then-life’s savings and $8,000 raised from family, friends and yogis to move to the Chapel Street location. Before we did construction, the space was a multi-colored tattoo parlor; I loved the design challenges! When we were finished, it felt like home. The beauty and hominess of that space will only increase with this move. Amazing high ceilings, that will not be removed, will hold space for our main studio that has two fireplaces…. The lobby in and of itself is a masterpiece of art that will house our beloved paintings and cozy benches. We will have more room for storage, cubbies and even a place where you can come kick back, do some reading or studying between classes, appointments and floats!

Risks & Challenges

Like any large construction project, there are always some unknown variables, ‘what will we find behind this wall… underneath this floor, etc…’ For the last several months, I have been working tirelessly with contractors, architects and specialists to understand the scope of work for this project. With many years under my belt working for an architecture firm in project and design management, a lifetime of being the daughter of a builder,  my education in entrepreneurship and small business management and many, many hours of meditation on accepting all that is and coming to be, I feel very peaceful and assured that this project will run smoothly and in record time! All we need is your help to reach our financial goals to help things run even more smoothly!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This is an all hands-on mat project and we totally understand if donating funds is too much of a stretch for some. If that is the case, we have many other ways that you can show your devotion to Breathing Room!

Help us get the word out! Share with others on social media about all the awesome incentives people can receive by donating.

Come help us Paint! We will have multiple call to action painting parties where you can come and serve the community.

Do you have an offering that might be great incentive you could donate to raise funds?

story:
Hello everyone!

It has always been my dream to have my own business, to create a unique space where I not only help people but also give back to the community in which I live.  I’m so excited to introduce the Denver Massage Collective (DMC) to you!  Colorado proudly represents a strong community of local business and the DMC looks to be the premier local massage provider where people can receive excellent service at an excellent price.  At the DMC you’ll receive the quality of a Ritz-Carlton with the convenience and affordability of Massage Envy.

Not only that but a portion of the profits from every massage will be donated to Metro Caring, a non profit focusing on feeding the hungry in Denver.  Your donation no matter how big or small goes directly to buying the supplies that will make my vision a reality.  I am asking for $1500 for the following things :

  • Sheets
  • Stool
  • Towel WarmerBlanket
  • Sheep Skin Face Cover
  • Side Table
  • Accent Chair
  • Hot Stones
  • Hot Stone Warmer
  • Towels
  • Organic Lotion and Oil
  • Extension Cord
  • Business Cards
  • Networking Group Fees
  • Operational Costs (Schedulicity, Sqaurespace, SOAP, etc...)

Being a part of the DMC means getting 30% off your first massage and wonderful massage/yoga packages (with Park Hill Yoga) to help enhance your health and well being.  For anyone who donates $75 or more you’ll receive a complimentary 45 minute massage!  

I am asking for the stars in hoping to raise the $1500 (but when shooting for your dreams, why not?), even if the goal isn’t met a good portion of supplies will still be covered, but I have faith that together we can do this.  Community is what the DMC is all about and with you being a part of that community I know we can accomplish anything.  Even if you don’t have a penny to spare PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE share this with your friends and family.  Indiegogo has wonderful share features that make it easy to spread the word!

Thank you so much!

Melissa Louis of the Denver Massage Collective

story:
Short Summary

It's been a dream of mine for a long time to become a Mermaid Entertainer for a variety of fun events like children's pool parties, fund raising events, and festivals.

  • You can ask anyone who knows me, I'm a fish out of water. I have always loved the water and I'm a natural swimmer. A few years ago I randomly stumbled upon this video and ever since I've known that this was my calling.
    The tail she's swimming is is made of Dragon Platinum Silicone. It's amazingly high quality which makes the tail really expensive, but worth it, because it'll last a lifetime.
  • I've set up this campaign in the hopes that I can get a little help from everyone to help my dream come true, and indirectly help the dreams of hundreds of children who may have always wanted to see a mermaid, but haven't been able to yet because of how rare they are. I love seeing children smile, hearing their laughter, and seeing the wonder in their eyes.
  • Your help with this dream will go on to help me bring smiles to children and even their parents all over the place. I don't just want to preform at pool parties, I want to be a symbol at fund raisers to help great causes, visit hospitals to entertain the sick, and educate kids and parents alike about the real facts concerning our oceans and the creatures who call them home.

What I Need & What You Get

  • All the funding gathered here will go towards the purchase of a mermaid tail, a matching swimmable top, a harp and a few advertising pieces (i.e. business cards and flyers). Here I've added some of my concept art for the type of tail and top I'm looking for. I've asked my family & friends which they like, they all seem to be split between the blue tail with blue hair and the red tail with red hair.


  • I've got some amazing perks lined up for all contributors like custom magnet calenders, custom hoodies, custom phone cases and even wall posters that will all have different pictures of me in my tail underwater! Plus, the more you donate the more you get, each level gets every item mentioned before it!


  • If I don't reach my goal I'll put the money away into savings until I get the total amount I need and then I'll continue to pursue my dream.

The Impact

  • Like I said I love the water and I love seeing children smile. Becoming a mermaid is my absolute dream, it's in my blood, it's everything I want to be. Your contribution will not only help me live my dream, but help me make kids smile and their eyes light up when they see me.
  • My family fully supports me, they tell me so every time we talk about it. It's an amazingly unique dream that I can't wait to start, your help really will make a difference.

Risks & Challenges

It's never easy starting out, I know that. It'll take time for me to make a name for myself and go out to do everything I want to, like being a part of fundraisers, visiting children's hospitals, even attending parties far away from me.

  • I'm very determined, when I set a goal for myself I don't stop 'till I reach it. Nothing will stop me from pursuing this dream, from making people around me smile and create unforgettable memories. Rain or shine I'll be out advertising myself, offering my services to any and everyone who wants this unique entertainer at their event.
  • If I'm not out selling what I can do as a mermaid no one will ever know. I want to make videos and post them on YouTube, take videos of fun times to share with party throwers, and get myself out there so everyone knows who and what I am. I won't stop until everyone is buzzing about the mermaid with cool ocean facts and an amazing realistic tail.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still get the word out:

  • Share my campaign on every social media out there, shout it out to your friends, spread the word across the world so anyone and everyone who wants to help can. There's nothing I'd appreciate more the your help getting the word out. You can even print out this flyer and pass them around. It's two sided, so you'll have to save both pictures to your PC then add them both Word or some other program and print them out with the left picture on the back and the right picture as the front, then fold on the black line. The larger version of these flyers are also in Gallery.

  • Don't forget you can use the IndieGoGo share tools to help get the word out.
story_txt:
Short Summary It's been a dream of mine for a long time to become a Mermaid Entertainer for a variety of fun events like children's pool parties, fund raising events, and festivals.  You can ask anyone who knows me, I'm a fish out of water. I have always loved the water and I'm a natural swimmer. A few years ago I randomly stumbled upon this video and ever since I've known that this was my calling.The tail she's swimming is is made of Dragon Platinum Silicone. It's amazingly high quality which makes the tail really expensive, but worth it, because it'll last a lifetime.
 I've set up this campaign in the hopes that I can get a little help from everyone to help my dream come true, and indirectly help the dreams of hundreds of children who may have always wanted to see a mermaid, but haven't been able to yet because of how rare they are. I love seeing children smile, hearing their laughter, and seeing the wonder in their eyes.
 Your help with this dream will go on to help me bring smiles to children and even their parents all over the place. I don't just want to preform at pool parties, I want to be a symbol at fund raisers to help great causes, visit hospitals to entertain the sick, and educate kids and parents alike about the real facts concerning our oceans and the creatures who call them home.
    What I Need & What You Get  All the funding gathered here will go towards the purchase of a mermaid tail, a matching swimmable top, a harp and a few advertising pieces (i.e. business cards and flyers). Here I've added some of my concept art for the type of tail and top I'm looking for. I've asked my family & friends which they like, they all seem to be split between the blue tail with blue hair and the red tail with red hair.

 I've got some amazing perks lined up for all contributors like custom magnet calenders, custom hoodies, custom phone cases and even wall posters that will all have different pictures of me in my tail underwater! Plus, the more you donate the more you get, each level gets every item mentioned before it!

 If I don't reach my goal I'll put the money away into savings until I get the total amount I need and then I'll continue to pursue my dream.
    The Impact  Like I said I love the water and I love seeing children smile. Becoming a mermaid is my absolute dream, it's in my blood, it's everything I want to be. Your contribution will not only help me live my dream, but help me make kids smile and their eyes light up when they see me.
 My family fully supports me, they tell me so every time we talk about it. It's an amazingly unique dream that I can't wait to start, your help really will make a difference.
    Risks & Challenges It's never easy starting out, I know that. It'll take time for me to make a name for myself and go out to do everything I want to, like being a part of fundraisers, visiting children's hospitals, even attending parties far away from me.  I'm very determined, when I set a goal for myself I don't stop 'till I reach it. Nothing will stop me from pursuing this dream, from making people around me smile and create unforgettable memories. Rain or shine I'll be out advertising myself, offering my services to any and everyone who wants this unique entertainer at their event.
 If I'm not out selling what I can do as a mermaid no one will ever know. I want to make videos and post them on YouTube, take videos of fun times to share with party throwers, and get myself out there so everyone knows who and what I am. I won't stop until everyone is buzzing about the mermaid with cool ocean facts and an amazing realistic tail.
    Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still get the word out:  Share my campaign on every social media out there, shout it out to your friends, spread the word across the world so anyone and everyone who wants to help can. There's nothing I'd appreciate more the your help getting the word out. You can even print out this flyer and pass them around. It's two sided, so you'll have to save both pictures to your PC then add them both Word or some other program and print them out with the left picture on the back and the right picture as the front, then fold on the black line. The larger version of these flyers are also in Gallery.



 Don't forget you can use the IndieGoGo share tools to help get the word out.

story:
A Short History

The Blue Moon in Petersburg, Ontario, is a heritage designated building that was originally a stage coach stop built in 1848.   

Our Banquet Hall was originally called the Petersburg Casino.  It was a dance hall built in the 1920’s.  It was located at the end of the parking lot and was dragged over and attached to the building in 1951 and the basement was dug out which is now called The Cellar Room.  It was quite the happening place in the 60’s & 70’s which featured Jazz music. 

There was a Ladies & Escorts room which is now called The Tree Room and The Gentlemen’s Room was where the Vinters Lounge is now.

In the Gentlemen’s room there is a table called the B.S. table.  People still ask to reserve it by name.  It got its name because local farmers used to come in and talk B.S. and sit at that table. (Did they mean Butter Sauce?)

One of the original ice boxes is now a fridge and is located in John A’s room(originally a kitchen).

The lock on the front door is the original lock made by Peter Williker who was the town Black Smith.

The previous owner of The Blue Moon, George Schmalz, was the man responsible for convincing the Liquor Board of Ontario that beer should be served in pitchers!

 

What We Need 

Since 2006 there has been over $300,000.00 in renovations and we still need at least another $60,000.00 to improve your experience and maintain the Blue Moon.  All funds raised, if there is an overage, will be used for improvements. The funds will be used towards a new roof, washroom updates, equipment updates, building maintenance, concrete restoration, plumbing, electrical and bakery upgrades.


The Impact

 The Blue Moon is the oldest continuous running hotel/restaurant in Waterloo region.  With your help, we can continue to run for another 167 years.  By doing so, we will continue to be an important part of history in our community, supportive of live music and theatre, local food, local beer, provide employment for a large staff serving 7 licensed rooms and up to 550 people.  
 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our campaign, "like" our Facebook Page and follow us on Twitter

  • Sign up for our newsletter

  • Recommend us to your friends and family

  • Plan your parties here

  • Recommend us to your boss for company events

  • Be a regular

  • Support and attend events: Live Music, Murder Mysteries, Wine and Beer Tastings

story:
The #20forYemen Project

Twitter Brought friends together, friends who had either experienced or seen poverty first hand to discuss about the situation in Yemen, the most impoverished country in the Middle East with 90% of their food being imported.

With a single intent and single goal, and idea was born. An idea to somehow go around the current Blockade on Yemen and help people who are displaced by war.

Armed with relentless passion and the ability to focus on helping others the #20ForYemen project was started on Twitter.

The Project Spirit

The basic idea was to collect funds and send them to Yemen to have one of the project members buy food locally and distribute it. This was the only way to beat the blockade which is in place.
This idea has proven to be successful and we have so far managed to feed 300 Internally Displaced Families. Much more needs to be done.

By Giving a simple amount of 20$

By giving a simple amount of only 20$ you are helping a whole family for one month! For each 20$ we can buy:

25 kg wheat

5 kg rice

5 kg sugar

2L cooking oil


What has been done so far?

In as little as 10 days Twitter responded and we raised $4200 enough to feed almost 150 families. The food has been distributed. (See pictures) Between then and now we have already distributed food to over 500 families, and this Eid we distributed clothes to displaced children so they could celebrate Eid. We believe that in spite of the heavy shelling, we could at least remind them that they are still children. Gods's little angels who don't deserve this life and they are loved!


What do you get?

What is better than the satisfaction of helping a family in dire need?

There are only two ways to live a pleasant life, either in someone’s heart or in someone’s prayer. In this case you get both!

We like quotes!


The Money You Donate

Every penny we receive from the donors goes to buy food for Internally displaced families As for last time, we bought 149 bags each one contained: 25 Kg wheat, 5 kg sugar, 5 kg rice and 2L of cooking oil. The total price was 845820 YR which is equal to 2500$.

Transport costs from Sanaa (Capital of Yemen) to Harf Safyan (The Area where the food was given) costed 62000 YR which is equal to 180$.


Wait... What Is Happening to Yemen?

Saudi Arabia together with a coalition of nine Arab states, began carrying out in-discriminant airstrikes in Yemen on 25 March 2015 and at the same time a blockade was placed on Yemen so at the moment nothing can go in, not even basic supplies!

Some UN stats:


According to UNOCHA, this is the latest situation report on Yemen, published 30. June 2015:


About Us

The Project founder is Fatik Abdullah Al Rodaini. He is 36 Years Old and he lives in Sanaa, Yemen. Fatik is a Journalist and an Human Rights Activist in Yemen. Follow him on twitter here: https://twitter.com/Fatikr

Working alongside Fatik are a core group of compassionate people who are obsessively and tirelessly working to see that Humanity prevails. 

Dr. RS Karim is the European Liaison for this project. Dr. Karim has worked with NGO's in crisis areas and has seen death and destruction up close and personal. Dr Karim is the founder of the charity lifelineafrica.org.uk he also spearheads this project from Europe.
The project's American Liaison is Lorrie Lynn King, she is the founder of the Charity,  50 Cents Period. You can see some of the wonderful work she does at 50centsperiod.org   
Finally there is Hassan Aziz who runs his web design company from Denmark. and has been tirelessly working on Twitter and has been instrumental in designing this page.
These are the friends of Twitter who initially started this project and keep it running. Without the patronage and help of some of our Twitter friends, we wouldn't be able to do what we do.
 
Remember: We work in extremely dangerous and volatile conditions everyday, to get much needed food to people, Your donations do go a long way to make this happen. Please give Yemen a chance!

Fatik Al Rodaini's charity fund MONA does all the work on the ground in Yemen.


Cant Donate? That's Okay.. Raise Awareness!

Not everybody can donate, but everybody can make a difference - it doesn't always have to be money, you can raise awareness by using the twitter hashtag: #20foryemen to raise awareness about this campaign. Share it with family and friends and help spread the message!


Last Words

This concept comes to fruition with the aim that every human being should be able to live with dignity without having to worry about the very basic right of sustenance.

Please give generously because the only way to live a pleasant life is either in someone's heart or someone's Prayer. and in this case you get both!

story:
We do not need a few to contribute a lot we need a lot to contribute a few dollars

Who and What we are!

Happy Puppy Care is a full service daycare, boarding and play place for your PAWtastic pups. We also offer daily adventures for your dog with trips out to the beach, mountains and countryside, as well as walks, the local dog parks and transportation for your pups. Our daycare facilities will be open from 4:30am through 8:00pm, 7 days a week & boarding is of course 24 hours a day.

Harper Lee was the inspiration for starting HPC

The back story...

Where do I start, how about the beginning...

 My name is James Lassiter & I own a little business, Happy Puppy Care that boards dogs overnight in our home as well as provides daycare services & so much more. We started out a little more than two years ago and it has been a whirlwind experience to say the least! Not only have we met some amazing pups, but we have also made life long friends. Needless to say this has been the best time in my life! Not only has it allowed me to be a stay at home dad to three of my four children, it has also offered me the opportunity to help many Kitsap County families by providing a safe place for their pups.


The "Three Amigos" heading to the Howe Farm off leash park for some fun!


What happened?

Everything came to a screeching halt on July 14th of this year. I received a notice from Code Enforcement that we were in violation of the Home Occupation Ordnance that sets the guidelines for home based businesses. Code Enforcement was made aware of this because of a complaint filed by one of my neighbors. This was the only complaint we have ever received while in business , thus far. While I was aware of the ordnance, I drew an incorrect interpretation of what it stated: As many of you know who have to deal with laws in your business legal speak can sometimes be difficult for laypersons like myself to understand. I found out through Code Enforcement that having the day care business in my home is absolutely fine, but  I violate the Home Occupation Ordnance when I take the dogs to my yard to go to the bathroom. 

Crazy right ?


Moxie is one of our long time guest pups!


Who this has affected?

Happy Puppy Care is a business,  but first it is our way of giving back to our community and our Navy families whom are 85% our clients. The military and government employee discount makes our services affordable to everyone in the area. My first concern throughout this whole ordeal has not been about the funds from the bookings, rather the safety and security of our pups. 

We tend to take the pups no one else wants, serious anxiety issues, puppies (since they can chew and pee on anything!), the sick,  the elderly, et cetera. It has been my pleasure to open my home & heart to dogs from my community that no other sitters will take. The only other option that the FURparents have is a kennel. Kennels serve their purpose, but that is not for us and it is cost prohibitive to a large portion to our clients.


Molly wants to know why she cannot come stay with us any longer?


Why we need your help...


We have decided to look for property to lease or buy  as close to home as possible where we will operate our daycare & overnight boarding.  In addition, we will provide many other services such as our puppy walks, adventures to local beaches & mountains for the pups that stay with us. Today, we have these great clients: people I have taken the time to get to know & enjoyed the work of supporting their pups and their needs.   At this time some of these pups do not have what they need & we simply want to help them feel safe & happy again. With our savings & your donations, we feel it now the right time for us to move forward with Happy Puppy Care 2.0!!


Simba is one of my favorite little buddies


What will the funding be used for?

We have some savings about that we are putting into the business but sadly it is not nearly enough for this venture. We will use all of the funds that are donated in a transparent way entirely for the business. 

  • Deposits for property or downpayment for land.
  • Build out of new property/land.
  • Operating cost for the first 6 months, we hope!
  • Hiring and training employee, yes we will need a hand selected person to help with our day to day operations I cannot be there all the time.
  • Toy, beds, bowls, et al

The time line!

  • Funded by September 15th
  • Finalize property selection by November 1st
  • Build out phase completed by December 15th to open the doors for the 2015 holiday travel season.

The new and improved HPC

We are going to mirror what Happy Puppy Care used to be, a loving home where your pups will enjoy staying. A safe place where you know the emphasis is on loving and caring for your FURbabies.
In addition to our qualified staff we will provide:
  • Hours of playtime indoors and out.
  • Agility course for your active pups.
  • Comfortable boarding areas that will mimic our home.
  • Bathing facility because sometimes happy pups get dirty playing.
  • 24/7 webcams in all areas as well as the play & boarding room so the FURparents can look in on the pups.
  • A clean environment for your Happy Puppy
  • Pickup and Drop off services

Spread the word.

Now besides you generous donations we also need help "getting the word out". Even if you are not able to donate at this time you can assist us by passing our campaign on to your friends and contacts. Look for the share links and tools at the bottom of our campaign page!

Deposits for property or downpayment for land.
Build out of new property/land.
Operating cost for the first 6 months, we hope!
Hiring and training employee, yes we will need a hand selected person to help with our day to day operations I cannot be there all the time.
Toy, beds, bowls, et al

The time line!


Funded by September 15th
Finalize property selection by November 1st
Build out phase completed by December 15th to open the doors for the 2015 holiday travel season.

The new and improved HPC
We are going to mirror what Happy Puppy Care used to be, a loving home where your pups will enjoy staying. A safe place where you know the emphasis is on loving and caring for your FURbabies.
In addition to our qualified staff we will provide:


Hours of playtime indoors and out.
Agility course for your active pups.
Comfortable boarding areas that will mimic our home.
Bathing facility because sometimes happy pups get dirty playing.
24/7 webcams in all areas as well as the play & boarding room so the FURparents can look in on the pups.
A clean environment for your Happy Puppy
Pickup and Drop off services

Spread the word.

Now besides you generous donations we also need help "getting the word out". Even if you are not able to donate at this time you can assist us by passing our campaign on to your friends and contacts. Look for the share links and tools at the bottom of our campaign page!

story:
I was assigned for 15 days by the company where I work to make a trip to Gambia to undertake the installation of machinery in a factory.

I loved the stay and especially the humility of the people of the Gambia.
Although poverty was everywhere and there was no way I could be indifferent to this reality.
I felt bad with myself for having such good conditions in the hotel where I was staying, where nothing was missed, but just next to me, everything was limited. Most children were happy if I gave them an empty pack of cigarettes, where they could pretend to be a toy car to play.
They walked barefoot, poorly clothed and malnourished.
I also felt bad to know that many people expected the remains of meals of the hotel in order to stave their hunger and that many of them did not have a roof over their heads.
Most of the houses were made with branches of shrubs and thatched roofs. Who had a tin roof was already considered a middle-class person.
It was only fifteen days, but was time enough to distinguish the difference between being happy with much or too little.
Gambia is a former British colony and any foreign loves going there on holidays. They love to pay €0.10 for a coke, and €0.30 for a packet of cigarettes, as also to enjoy the excellent beaches, but they forget that to have these wonderful vacation, there are people who do not have a roof for the nigh.

GAMBIAN PETROL STATION:


When I returned, I swore to myself I would do all possible to try to build at least 50 homes to provide the neediest families.
With the help of some generous people, in 2014 I managed to build three houses, but it is too little for the needs of these welcoming people.

ONE OF THE THREE HOUSES BEING BUILT:


FINAL RESULT:


Trhat way, in my travels over the Internet, I came across this website, and I thought to be here my opportunity to make known to the world my dream of helping the people in Gambia to find a new roof, and at the same time asking the collaboration of sensitive people so that I may accomplish the feat of sending 47 more houses to Gambia.
I have already designed and costed the model home that fits the needs of the people. I guarantee that I myself will monitor the manufacture of homes in Portugal, and I will travel to Gambia to undertake the installation of homes and only return when all the houses are built and assigned to each family in needl.


I have contacts with close associates of the president of Gambia, where I guarantee I can find a way for the installation of the houses at no cost.
The cost of each house (with transportation and installation) is € 39,500.00.
50 houses can accommodate about 50 families or 300 people.
If I cannot build all the houses, I will build the maximum that donations give.
Please help me to realize this dream.
story_txt:
I was assigned for 15 days by the company where I work to make a trip to
Gambia to undertake the installation of machinery in a factory. 
I loved the stay and especially the humility of the people of the Gambia. Although poverty was everywhere and there was no way I could be indifferent to this reality.I felt bad with myself for having such good conditions in the hotel where I was staying, where nothing was missed, but just next to me, everything was limited. Most children were happy if I gave them an empty pack of cigarettes, where they could pretend to be a toy car to play. They walked barefoot, poorly clothed and malnourished. I also felt bad to know that many people expected the remains of meals of the hotel in order to stave their hunger and that many of them did not have a roof over their heads. Most of the houses were made with branches of shrubs and thatched roofs. Who had a tin roof was already considered a middle-class person. It was only fifteen days, but was time enough to distinguish the difference between being happy with much or too little.Gambia is a former British colony and any foreign loves going there on holidays. They love to pay €0.10 for a coke, and €0.30 for a packet of cigarettes, as also to enjoy the excellent beaches, but they forget that to have these wonderful vacation, there are people who do not have a roof for the nigh.GAMBIAN PETROL STATION:
When I returned, I swore to myself I would do all possible to try to build at least 50 homes to provide the neediest families.With the help of some generous people, in 2014 I managed to build three houses, but it is too little for the needs of these welcoming people.ONE OF THE THREE HOUSES BEING BUILT:FINAL RESULT:
Trhat way, in my travels over the Internet, I came across this website, and I thought to be here my opportunity to make known to the world my dream of helping the people in Gambia to find a new roof, and at the same time asking the collaboration of sensitive people so that I may accomplish the feat of sending 47 more houses to Gambia.I have already designed and costed the model home that fits the needs of the people. I guarantee that I myself will monitor the manufacture of homes in Portugal, and I will travel to Gambia to undertake the installation of homes and only return when all the houses are built and assigned to each family in needl.
I have contacts with close associates of the president of Gambia, where I guarantee I can find a way for the installation of the houses at no cost.The cost of each house (with transportation and installation) is € 39,500.00.50 houses can accommodate about 50 families or 300 people.If I cannot build all the houses, I will build the maximum that donations give.Please help me to realize this dream.
